b.7.2.3.2 open versus enclosed parking open parking has permanent wall openings for natural ventilation at each parking level. exterior sides of structure shall have uniformly distributed openings on two or more sides. area of such openings in external walls on level shall be not less than 20% of total perimeter wall area of each level. aggregate length (i.e. total of widths) of openings deemed to be providing natural ventilation shall be not less than 40% of perimeter of level. open parking facilities shall conform to nfpa 88a for natural ventilation. slope in areas where vehicles parked shall be not more than 4% (as shown in figure b.55). accessible parking slopes shall be limited to maximum of 2%. parking facilities that do not meet definition of open parking shall be designed as enclosed parking with mechanical ventilation as required by h.4.12.11

b.7.2.3.2 open versus enclosed parking open parking has permanent wall openings for natural ventilation at each parking level. exterior sides of structure shall have uniformly distributed openings on two or more sides. area of such openings in external walls on level shall be not less than 20% of total perimeter wall area of each level. aggregate length (i.e. total of widths) of openings deemed to be providing natural ventilation shall be not less than 40% of perimeter of level. open parking facilities shall conform to nfpa 88a for natural ventilation. slope in areas where vehicles parked shall be not more than 4% (as shown in figure b.55). accessible parking slopes shall be limited to maximum of 2%. parking facilities that do not meet definition of open parking shall be designed as enclosed parking with mechanical ventilation as required by h.4.12.11

b.7.2.3.2 open versus enclosed parking open parking has permanent wall openings for natural ventilation at each parking level. exterior sides of structure shall have uniformly distributed openings on two or more sides. area of such openings in external walls on level shall be not less than 20% of total perimeter wall area of each level. aggregate length (i.e. total of widths) of openings deemed to be providing natural ventilation shall be not less than 40% of perimeter of level. open parking facilities shall conform to nfpa 88a for natural ventilation. slope in areas where vehicles parked shall be not more than 4% (as shown in figure b.55). accessible parking slopes shall be limited to maximum of 2%. parking facilities that do not meet definition of open parking shall be designed as enclosed parking with mechanical ventilation as required by h.4.12.11

4% 4% figure b.55 parking at slope b 63 dubai building code part b architecture b.7.2.3.3 parking areas technical requirements parking areas (covered or uncovered) shall be provided for vehicles within plot limits

for parking entry and exit, straight, and preferably level, 6 long access should be provided before vehicle access barriers as shown in figure b.57. parking areas shall be provided with directional arrows and traffic signs, as described in b.11
fixed mirror shall be provided for blind corners

wheel stoppers of maximum height of 120 mm and minimum width of 200 mm shall be installed as shown in figure b.56 where parking bays adjacent to fences, walls, buildings or walkways. wheel stops should be avoided where they might be in path of pedestrians moving to or from parked vehicles
no parking area shall be allowed to be utilized as both parking bay and loading space

basement parking areas shall account for presence of columns and adjacent walls, which shall be covered with protective angle guards of suitable material. round columns do not require protective angle guards

hotel meeting, ballroom, function hall 1 bay for every 20 m2 of related space na healthcare refer to dha guidelines, part b ref. b.3 to ref. b.18 healthcare centres industrial light medium industry heavy industry warehouse table b.13 parking ratios (continued) 1 bay per each patient bed 1 bay per each 50 m2 of na for internal clinics, staff offices and all occupiable spaces 1 bay for every 70 m2 of management office na 1 bay for every 70 m2 for office if area exceeds 10% 1 bay for every 70 m2 of management office na b.7.2.6.2 preferred parking for buildings that have more than 20 parking bays, designated preferred parking shall be provided for combination of hybrid vehicles, electrical vehicles and carpool vehicles. number of preferred parking bays shall be calculated based on total vehicle parking bays required for building, as defined in b.7.2.6.1. percentage required for preferred parking 5%. this percentage does not include parking bays provided for people of determination (see c.6.4)

headings: charging equipment for electrical vehicles in malls
Description: b.7.2.6.3 charging equipment for electrical vehicles in malls for shopping malls, where preferred parking bays provided in accordance with b.7.2.6.2, necessary charging equipment for electrical vehicles shall be provided for 20% of total preferred parking bays. charging equipment shall conform to g.5

b.7.2.6.3 charging equipment for electrical vehicles in malls for shopping malls, where preferred parking bays provided in accordance with b.7.2.6.2, necessary charging equipment for electrical vehicles shall be provided for 20% of total preferred parking bays. charging equipment shall conform to g.5

b 70 dubai building code part b architecture bicycle parking provision in building b.7.2.7 bicycle parking should be located within building or within shaded area at ground level (see figure b.66) in easily accessible locations within plot limit and no more than 30 from building entrance

x figure b.67 bicycle stand minimum dimensions b 71 dubai building code part b architecture b.7.3 service and maintenance access to buildings loading and unloading areas b.7.3.1 b.7.3.1.1 general site layout shall allow for loading and unloading of vehicles to take place within plot boundaries. loading areas shall be located and designed such that vehicle intended to use them can manoeuvre safely and conveniently to and from row and can complete loading and unloading without obstructing or interfering with any row or any parking bay
loading and unloading spaces shall be provided for service vehicles within plot limits off public street/area
access driveway width for heavy vehicles shall be not less than 9 two way. one way driveway and gates for truck access shall be not less than 4.5 wide

in general, off-street loading areas shall not be located in front of any type of building, including industrial buildings. off-street loading areas shall be located on rear or side of buildings in accordance with plot-defined access in affection plan and dcrs
all off-street loading areas shall be drained. they shall be lit in accordance with part h

0 45 4.0 12.0 4.0 18.0 figure b.72 loading/unloading area with (10 and 45) manoeuvring for 15 long trucks key 01 dock leveller 02 side loading 03 end loading 04 draw forward before turning b 75 dubai building code part b architecture service ramps b.7.3.2 service ramps shall have width of not less than 1.2 and slope of not more than 8%. service ramps used by waste containers shall be sized to allow for clear passage and manoeuvring of containers. at building entrance door, ramp landing shall be level, with 2% maximum slope where drainage required
landing platforms shall be at least 1.2 deep if doors swing inwards, and 1.5 deep if doors swing outwards, as shown in figure b.73

if vertical height requires two ramps to achieve properly graded slope, ramps shall be not longer than 10 or provided with intermediate landing. two ramps shall be separated by level-landing platform of at least 1.2 long with 90 or 180 turns
ramp surface should be hard surfaced and anti-slip
handrails and fall protection shall be provided in accordance with b.6.4.1.7 and b.6.4.1.8
b 76 figure b.73 service ramp dubai building code part b architecture maintenance ladders b.7.3.3 when building space requires access by ladder, ladder shall meet following requirements

a) ladders inclined at angle of 75 to 90 shall be provided with handrails on each side. handrail shall extend not less than 900 mm above platform, parapet wall or roof edge. b) there shall be clear width between handrails of not less than 500 mm. c) ladders with climbing height of more than 6 shall be provided with back guards, cages or self-retracting lifelines. climbing height shall be measured to top of parapet wall or roof. d) when cages provided, they shall encircle ladder entirely and have clear width of not less than 800 mm. e) ladders shall be protected from corrosion
f) ladders shall be provided with clear bottom landing that not less than 900 mm  900 mm

g) ladders dimensions shall be not less than minimum values given in table b.17 and figure b.74. maximum riser height, r (mm) minimum rung radius (mm) minimum ladder width, w (mm) minimum toe clearance (mm) minimum side clearance (mm) 350 20 800 150 400 table b.17 service ladder minimum dimensions w 0 0 9  01 0 0 0 , 6  r figure b.74 service ladder requirements key 01 maximum height without cage b 77 dubai building code part b architecture ladders permitted to provide access to following areas only 1) spaces frequented by personnel for maintenance, repair or monitoring of equipment 2) non-occupiable spaces accessed only by catwalks and crawl spaces 3) raised areas used primarily for purposes of security, life safety or fire safety including, but not limited to, observation galleries, prison guard towers, fire lookout towers or lifeguard stands and 4) non-occupied roofs that not required to have stairway access

access to utilities b.7.3.4 uae flsc ref. b.1 does not permit ladder access in lieu of stairs to roofs, to liquefied petroleum gas (lpg) tanks on roofs, solar power generation systems on roofs or fire pump rooms. at least one rcc protected exit stairway shall extend to all roofs

at least one rcc protected exit stairway shall reach level of lpg tank installation. cat ladders, alternate stairs and temporary stairs not permitted (see ch. 11 of uae flsc ref. b.1). solar power generation systems on roofs shall be accessed by one rcc protected exit stairway in accordance with ch. 14 of uae flsc ref. b.1. fire pump room shall be in basements or ground floor, within 6 visibility of protected exit stair leading to ground floor in accordance with table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. b.1. hatch entry, cat ladders, spiral stairs, winding stairs not allowed to access fire pump room. b 78 dubai building code part b architecture sanitary provisions and fixture calculations b.8.1.3 b.8.1.3.1 occupancy requirements minimum number of sanitary fixtures to be provided shall be calculated based on occupant load factors given in b.5.1 and table b.18

at least one rcc protected exit stairway shall reach level of lpg tank installation. cat ladders, alternate stairs and temporary stairs not permitted (see ch. 11 of uae flsc ref. b.1). solar power generation systems on roofs shall be accessed by one rcc protected exit stairway in accordance with ch. 14 of uae flsc ref. b.1. fire pump room shall be in basements or ground floor, within 6 visibility of protected exit stair leading to ground floor in accordance with table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. b.1. hatch entry, cat ladders, spiral stairs, winding stairs not allowed to access fire pump room. b 78 dubai building code part b architecture sanitary provisions and fixture calculations b.8.1.3 b.8.1.3.1 occupancy requirements minimum number of sanitary fixtures to be provided shall be calculated based on occupant load factors given in b.5.1 and table b.18
number of occupants of each gender calculated by halving total number of occupants and rounding up to next whole number
for calculations involving multiple occupancies, fractions of numbers for each occupancy shall first be summed and then rounded up to next whole number
b.8 communal provisions in buildings b.8.1 sanitary facilities b.8.1.1 every occupiable building shall include sanitary facilities
general use of common sanitary facilities for both sexes not allowed, except for family and accessible toilets as specified in c.8.3 and table c.20
sanitary facilities for people of determination and children shall be provided in accordance with c.8

sanitary finishes b.8.1.2 water closets, urinals, washbasins, showers and baths shall have smooth and readily cleanable non-absorbent surface. all sanitary fixture finishing materials and fixed fittings shall be moisture-proof and floors of these fixtures shall be made of non-slip materials

sanitary finishes b.8.1.2 water closets, urinals, washbasins, showers and baths shall have smooth and readily cleanable non-absorbent surface. all sanitary fixture finishing materials and fixed fittings shall be moisture-proof and floors of these fixtures shall be made of non-slip materials

sanitary finishes b.8.1.2 water closets, urinals, washbasins, showers and baths shall have smooth and readily cleanable non-absorbent surface. all sanitary fixture finishing materials and fixed fittings shall be moisture-proof and floors of these fixtures shall be made of non-slip materials

sanitary finishes b.8.1.2 water closets, urinals, washbasins, showers and baths shall have smooth and readily cleanable non-absorbent surface. all sanitary fixture finishing materials and fixed fittings shall be moisture-proof and floors of these fixtures shall be made of non-slip materials

walls, floors and partitions in sanitary facilities shall meet following requirements. a) in wet areas, floor finish material shall have smooth, hard, non-absorbent and non-slip surface. b) intersections of floors with walls shall have smooth, hard, non-absorbent vertical base that extents upward to walls to height of not less than 100 mm
c) walls and partitions within 600 mm of sanitary fixtures shall have smooth, hard, non-absorbent moisture-proof surface, up to height of not less than 1,200 mm above ffl
d) shower compartments, screens and walls around bathtubs shall be finished with smooth, non-absorbent surface to height of not less than 1,800 mm above drain outlet
slip resistance shall conform to c.7.2.1.2

a) in public toilets, required wash basins shall be located in same toilet block as required water closet
b) public toilets in buildings should not open directly to row or sikka
c) public toilets, including their entry points and doors, should be designed to provide privacy, especially between mens and womens bathrooms
d) individual toilet stalls and single-user toilets shall be provided with locking or latching devices

e) stall partitions that not full height of room shall meet minimum requirements in table b.22. f) urinals for public toilets shall be provided with walls or partitions that meet minimum requirements in table b.23

750 400 750 400 600 750 600 750 figure b.76 fixture clearances b 84 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.2 facilities for building occupants drinking fountains b.8.2.1 drinking fountains shall be provided as shown in table b.24. they shall not be installed in public restrooms. they shall be placed in safe and clean areas where they will not obstruct building circulation

feeding rooms (lactation rooms) b.8.2.2 feeding rooms shall be provided in all malls and amusement parks exceeding 1,000 m2 of ga and/or designed for more than 250 occupants. at least one feeding room shall be provided within 300 of any part of building. it recommended that one feeding room provided for each block of public toilets

a) flooring and walls shall be acoustically insulated (see h.10.3.3), and if gymnasium space located on roof deck or above apartments, their floors and walls shall be treated with effective sound insulation materials. acoustic isolation from adjacent habitable spaces and occupiable spaces shall be attained

b) exercise rooms which produce noises of vibrations (such as karate, weightlifting sanitary facilities should be provided in accordance with b.8.1. minimum of one from each fixture type and one changing room shall be provided for each gender

in accordance with ch.3. of uae flsc ref. b.1, two exits shall be provided from exterior swimming pool decks, jogging tracks and landscaping areas when distance to single exit exceeds 30 m. b.8.3.2.2 safety requirements suitable place for lifeguards highchair, and notice boards with guidelines and policies for swimmers to follow, shall be provided. signboard showing water depth shall be fitted at pools edge. signboard shall mark location of slope changes showing maximum and minimum depth

gymnasiums and similar) should be situated at lower building levels or acoustically treated. provide sufficient number of life saving devices (rings, etc.) in area. all details shall be in accordance with swimming pools safety guidelines ref. b.43 to ref. b.45
c) number of changing rooms and lockers to be provided shall be determined according to expected number of users. at least one changing room/locker shall be provided for both men and women
swimming pools b.8.3.2 b.8.3.2.1 general requirements swimming pool designs shall conform to dm ph&sd guides ref. b.43 to ref. b.45
swimming pools and decks shall be constructed of non-toxic, inert, impervious and durable materials
swimming pool shall be configured to be safely patrolled, maintained and cleaned and to provide good circulation of water
swimming pools shall be provided with lighting, both above and under water surface in order to provide adequate illumination for overall area of pool

design of outdoor swimming pools located at roof, podium roofs and other elevated locations shall provide privacy to adjacent buildings and shall be provided with fall protection in accordance with b.4.2.5.2. b 87 slope in floor of shallow area of pool shall not exceed 10%
slip resistance of swimming pool floors shall conform to c.7.2.1.2
slip resistance of swimming pool floors shall conform to c.7.2.1.2
safety signage advising on danger of diving into shallow areas and on prevention of drowning shall be provided as mandated by relevant authority as shown in figure b.79
warning no diving! shallow water
prevent drowning can be permanently injured
watch children at all time

rescue figure b.79 safety sign ( international code council 2014. figure based on diagram of 2015 international swimming pool and spa code. washington, d.c. international code council. reproduced with permission. all rights reserved. www.iccsafe.org) dubai building code part b architecture swimming pools designated for children shall be separated from swimming pools designated for adults with protective barriers
b.8.3.2.3 swimming pool fences outdoor swimming pools shall be surrounded by fence to protect against drowning
pools and their surroundings shall be free of any dangerous obstacles
fence shall meet following requirements operable windows adjacent to pool shall have sill height of not less than 1,200 mm above indoor ffl
b) vertical clearance between ffl and bottom of fence shall not exceed 50 mm
c) openings in fence shall not allow passage of 100 mm diameter sphere
fence of swimming pool shall be set back at least 1,200 mm from plot limits and adjacent structures
4) swimming pool fence not required where there full-time lifeguards patrolling pool, together with pool supervision systems in accordance with public swimming pools safety guidelines ref. b.43

b 88 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.3.2.4 decks and walkways swimming pools shall be surrounded by continuous unobstructed deck or walkway. it shall be not less than 1.2 wide, excluding width of coping or interior portion of gutter. walkway or deck shall be immediately adjacent to pool as shown in figure b.80
deck or walkway shall be constructed in impervious material with smooth, non-slip and easily cleanable surface
all decks and walkways shall have 2% slope, in order to drain water effectively to deck drains
allowance for infinity pools or non-fenced pools shall be made according to permitting authorities approval

1  1.2 03 01 02 1.2 figure b.80 swimming pool setback and walkway requirements key 01 swimming pool 02 adjacent structure 03 plot limit or adjacent obstruction b 89 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.3.2.5 ladders and steps pools shall have ladders or steps if depth exceeds 600 mm
at least one ladder shall be installed within each 30 of pool perimeter. there shall be at least one ladder located at deep end, and ladder or steps at shallow end
material for swimming pool ladder shall be corrosion-resistant and shall be provided with non-slip stepping surface
ladder shall be separated from pool wall or boundary by at least 100 mm

if steps into swimming pool recessed, steps shall a) be anti-slip b) be provided with drain to pool c) be easily cleaned d) have tread depth of at least 150 mm e) have clear height between risers for each two recessed steps of not more than 300 mm and f) have width of at least 400 mm

swimming pools with regular steps permitted only if following conditions met 1) 2) pool shallow, with depth not exceeding 1,000 mm at any point steps located at one of corners of pool, or within special recess outside pool boundaries, and do not encroach into net area of pool and 3) each tread not less than 250 mm in depth and not less than 600 mm in width. riser shall be not more than 300 mm in height
b 90 swimming pool ladders shall be provided with side handrails that extend around water surface on both sides of ladder or recessed wall steps

a) toilets shall not be set or located toward qibla direction of prayer rooms, according to islamic doctrine. no single praying space shall face toilet facilities. b) location and entrance of toilet facilities shall be separated from prayer room and ablution areas
open spaces b.8.3.4 when open spaces provided, landscape species shall be selected in accordance with b.10.5
shading calculations and shading provisions in public areas conform to b.10.5

b.8.4 service facilities service rooms in basements of buildings shall meet all of requirements in table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. b.1. table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. b.1 does not permit rmu rooms in basements of buildings. transformer rooms, low voltage switchgear rooms, high voltage rooms and generator rooms preferred at ground level, but permitted in basements by dubai electricity and water authority (dewa) and dubai civil defence (dcd) provided that design conforms to g.7.6 and table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. b.1
waste rooms preferred at ground level, but permitted in basements by dcd provided that design meets following criteria
a) room 1 h fire resistance rated, including 1 h fire door and fire resistance rated opening protectives
b) room no more than one level below ground level
c) room provided with dedicated mechanical ventilation system direct to outside to achieve 10 air changes/h, in accordance with section 2.17, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. b.1

b 93 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.5 waste management b.8.5.1 waste management hierarchy waste management hierarchy (see figure b.84) shall be followed when defining waste storage and management within buildings. this shall include facilitation of material reuse, recycling and recovery wherever possible

prevention preparing for reuse recycling other recovery disposal minimise quantity of materials from consumptions and those used in design and manufacturing checking, cleaning, repairing or refurbishing whole items or spare parts turning waste into new substance or product, including composting includes anaerobic digestion and incineration/thermal treatment with energy recovery landfill and incineration/thermal treatment without energy recover figure b.84 waste management hierarchy diagram b.8.5.2 waste storage rooms b.8.5.2.1 general all buildings shall be provided with suitable storage for general waste and recycling. this shall include provision of a) main waste storage room(s) for final storage of waste and recycling prior to its collection and transfer offsite to suitable treatment and/or disposal facility and (if appropriate) b) interim waste storage room(s) which might be required for temporary storage of waste and recycling within development, prior to transfer to main waste storage room(s). if it not feasible to provide waste storage room(s) inside building, separate onsite storage area(s) may be provided. this shall meet relevant requirements for waste storage in b.8.5.2.2 and b.8.5.2.3 as well as following additional requirements

prevention preparing for reuse recycling other recovery disposal minimise quantity of materials from consumptions and those used in design and manufacturing checking, cleaning, repairing or refurbishing whole items or spare parts turning waste into new substance or product, including composting includes anaerobic digestion and incineration/thermal treatment with energy recovery landfill and incineration/thermal treatment without energy recover figure b.84 waste management hierarchy diagram b.8.5.2 waste storage rooms b.8.5.2.1 general all buildings shall be provided with suitable storage for general waste and recycling. this shall include provision of a) main waste storage room(s) for final storage of waste and recycling prior to its collection and transfer offsite to suitable treatment and/or disposal facility and (if appropriate) b) interim waste storage room(s) which might be required for temporary storage of waste and recycling within development, prior to transfer to main waste storage room(s). if it not feasible to provide waste storage room(s) inside building, separate onsite storage area(s) may be provided. this shall meet relevant requirements for waste storage in b.8.5.2.2 and b.8.5.2.3 as well as following additional requirements
1) 2) 3) 4) it shall not impede access points to and from building
it shall not be located less than 2.5 horizontally and 5 vertically from any openable windows of living space such as bedroom or living room
it shall be located where interference with pedestrian traffic and other vehicle access minimal

it shall be roofed and have concrete pad designed to handle load of bins. note separate onsite storage areas generally only permitted when ga of largest storey of building less than 250 m2, regardless of height of building. b 94 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.5.2.2 specification of waste storage rooms waste storage room(s) shall meet following requirements

it shall be roofed and have concrete pad designed to handle load of bins. note separate onsite storage areas generally only permitted when ga of largest storey of building less than 250 m2, regardless of height of building. b 94 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.5.2.2 specification of waste storage rooms waste storage room(s) shall meet following requirements

a) waste storage room(s) shall be situated within boundary of development and be easily accessible for both residents and tenants alike. where access by waste management contractor required, suitable and unimpeded access shall be provided for waste collection vehicles to allow easy removal of waste and recycling from site. where possible, waste storage room(s) shall be located away from ingress and egress of development so as not to cause obstruction during times of collection

b) if it not possible to locate waste storage room(s) at ground floor level, they may be placed no more than one level down from ground floor, at first basement level, and shall conform to dcd requirements as stated in b.8.4. service elevator shall be provided to transfer waste and recycling to waste storage rooms(s) as required. if waste collection occurs on first basement level, it shall be designed with suitable access and clearance for waste collection vehicle as appropriate. c) access to waste storage room(s) shall be sufficient to facilitate easy entry, exit and manoeuvring of waste and recycling containers and waste collection operatives. where change in floor level exists, any longitudinal gradient falling away from storage location shall not exceed 8.33% (112). width of any passageway or access route which has to be passed through to reach waste storage room(s) should be of suitable width to allow waste containers to pass through easily, and not be less than 1.2 m. access paths should be free of kerbs and steps, and avoid difficult turns and bends. drop kerbs shall be provided where access paths meet roadways. manual manoeuvring of waste containers from interim storage point to collection point 1) should be avoided for containers greater than 1,500 l in capacity 2) shall be limited to step-free distance of 7 and maximum slope of 8.33% (112) for containers up to 1,000 l in capacity 3) shall be limited to step-free distance of 50 and maximum slope of 8.33% (112) for containers up to 360 l in capacity

d) floor and wall surfacing shall be finished with non-slip concrete, ceramic tiles, or similar impervious and waterproof material to facilitate cleaning. textured finishes should be avoided, as they attract dirt and detritus. walls, floors and ceilings of room shall be finished with light colour

e) water supply and adequate drainage shall be provided to facilitate cleaning of waste storage room(s) and waste containers. this may be provided direct from water supply network or from high-level tank. all drains and gullies should be connected to drainage pipes of development and have cleanable filters and/or grates to prevent blockages to drainage system caused by waste residue
f) lighting shall be provided with sealed (ingress protection rated) bulkhead fittings to protect against water from cleaning and washdown

g) efficient ventilation system shall be provided to vent any odorous or dense flammable gases that might escape from waste. any waste rooms that contain organic waste shall be kept at constant and cooled temperature, not higher than 18 c, to prevent waste decomposition and associated odour. lower temperature might be required depending upon occupancy of adjacent spaces and frequency with which waste room door(s) will be accessed
h) all windows shall be airtight and protected by metal mesh wire screen in order to prevent insects and rodents from accessing waste storage room(s)

i) all doors shall be made of anti-rust metal (e.g. aluminium) construction and provided with ventilation louvers or mechanical ventilation. doors shall open to outside and be fitted with automatic door closers. they shall be of sufficient width to allow waste containers to pass into and out of waste storage room(s). b 95 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.5.2.3 dimensions of waste storage rooms suitable storage space for waste and recycling shall be calculated and determined based on type and number of containers required and collection frequency. storage space provision shall be sized for two days of waste and recycling generation as minimum. this shall include area appropriate for storage of bulky and special waste, sorting of recyclables and any other relevant facilities or equipment which might be required. suitable clearance space shall be provided to enable manoeuvring of containers, easy access and use of waste room for residents, tenants, and waste management contractors, as appropriate. corridors and doors shall be wide enough to accommodate waste container sizes

i) all doors shall be made of anti-rust metal (e.g. aluminium) construction and provided with ventilation louvers or mechanical ventilation. doors shall open to outside and be fitted with automatic door closers. they shall be of sufficient width to allow waste containers to pass into and out of waste storage room(s). b 95 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.5.2.3 dimensions of waste storage rooms suitable storage space for waste and recycling shall be calculated and determined based on type and number of containers required and collection frequency. storage space provision shall be sized for two days of waste and recycling generation as minimum. this shall include area appropriate for storage of bulky and special waste, sorting of recyclables and any other relevant facilities or equipment which might be required. suitable clearance space shall be provided to enable manoeuvring of containers, easy access and use of waste room for residents, tenants, and waste management contractors, as appropriate. corridors and doors shall be wide enough to accommodate waste container sizes

i) all doors shall be made of anti-rust metal (e.g. aluminium) construction and provided with ventilation louvers or mechanical ventilation. doors shall open to outside and be fitted with automatic door closers. they shall be of sufficient width to allow waste containers to pass into and out of waste storage room(s). b 95 dubai building code part b architecture b.8.5.2.3 dimensions of waste storage rooms suitable storage space for waste and recycling shall be calculated and determined based on type and number of containers required and collection frequency. storage space provision shall be sized for two days of waste and recycling generation as minimum. this shall include area appropriate for storage of bulky and special waste, sorting of recyclables and any other relevant facilities or equipment which might be required. suitable clearance space shall be provided to enable manoeuvring of containers, easy access and use of waste room for residents, tenants, and waste management contractors, as appropriate. corridors and doors shall be wide enough to accommodate waste container sizes

required number of containers shall be calculated based on estimates of potential waste and recycling quantity to be generated by development, using suitable metrics for estimating waste and recycling produced. suggested waste generation rates for dubai as follows
a) residential use  at rate of 12 kg for each 100 m2 of na
b) commercial use  at rate of 12 kg for each 100 m2 of na
c) office use  at rate of 5 kg for each 100 m2 of na
d) hotels  at rate of 3 kg for each room and 5 kg for each suite

to quantify number of containers required, total mass of waste shall be converted to volume using waste density appropriate to waste type being considered. total volume of waste shall be divided by volume of container type selected to determine number of containers

in order to determine area required for waste storage, following requirements shall be met a) in buildings with total ga of more than 230 - 460 m2, waste storage room of 1.2 x 1.8 shall be provided on ground floor only

b) in buildings with total ga of more than 460 m2, waste storage room(s) shall accommodate all required containers according to their standard size. type of container required shall be determined based on quantity of waste and recycling generated by development, and practicalities of access to development and removal of waste and recycling by waste management contractor. c) guideline dimensions and examples of typical containers shown in table b.27, table b.28 and figure b.85. container sizes vary by manufacturer. typical standards for waste containers provided in bs en 840-1 to bs en 840-4 and bs en 12574-1 and these shall be taken into account when determining waste storage requirements

d) indicative waste storage rooms sizes provided in table b.29. dimensions of waste storage room(s) shall allow for manoeuvring of required containers within room so as to provide suitable access to containers as well as easy removal and return to waste storage room(s). this shall include 1) minimum clearance of 150 mm between individual containers and between containers and surrounding walls of waste storage room(s) 2) minimum clearance of 600 mm between individual containers and front faade of room, where door that leads to waste room situated 3) minimum door width of 1.2 m. where utilized for movement of containers, this shall be of appropriate size to allow for easy entry and exit of container type required 4) minimum clear room height of 2.4 m. in all cases, this shall permit lids of waste containers to be opened and closed in-situ. b 96 dubai building code part b architecture capacity (litres) capacity (m3) width (w) (mm) length (l) (mm) height (h) (mm) 120 240 360 0.12 0.24 0.36 480 580 660 550 715 880 940 1,060 1,100 table b.27 wheeled bins capacity (litres) capacity (m3) width (w) (mm) length (l) (mm) height (h) (mm) 660 1,100 2,500 4,500 0.66 1.1 2.5 4.5 720 980 1,370 1,700 1,250 1,250 2,040 2,040 1,320 1,355 1,540 1,800 table b.28 eurobins and bulk storage containers weight of waste room should accommodate following containers up to 100 kg up to 250 kg up to 500 kg up to 750 kg up to 1,000 kg 1 x 1.1 m3 1 x 2.5 m3 2 x 2.5 m3 3 x 2.5 m3 4 x 2.5 m3 > 1,000 kg waste management consultant should advise note single container with capacity of 4.5 m3 may be used instead of two containers with capacity of 2.5 m3, provided that waste storage room directly overlooking street or it possible to easily transfer 4.5 m3 containers to street

dubai building code part b architecture recycling and segregation b.8.5.3 sorting area for recyclable waste shall be provided within main waste storage area(s). this shall facilitate sorting of recyclables where segregation not undertaken at source by buildings tenants. it recommended that floor area of waste storage room(s) increased by not less than 5 m, to allow for additional space and manoeuvrability for sorting recyclable waste. hydraulic skip compactors b.8.5.6 in all types of buildings and facilities, hydraulic skip compactors, either portable or static, permitted for waste storage in lieu of number of traditional waste containers, and where waste quantities high enough to justify their use. where skip compactors used, at least two shall be provided to ensure facilitation of recycling one for general waste and one for recyclables. type of compactor provided shall be suitable for composition of waste and amount of waste generated by development, and shall be in accordance with specifications of authority and din 30722-1 to din 30722-3 as appropriate

dubai building code part b architecture recycling and segregation b.8.5.3 sorting area for recyclable waste shall be provided within main waste storage area(s). this shall facilitate sorting of recyclables where segregation not undertaken at source by buildings tenants. it recommended that floor area of waste storage room(s) increased by not less than 5 m, to allow for additional space and manoeuvrability for sorting recyclable waste. hydraulic skip compactors b.8.5.6 in all types of buildings and facilities, hydraulic skip compactors, either portable or static, permitted for waste storage in lieu of number of traditional waste containers, and where waste quantities high enough to justify their use. where skip compactors used, at least two shall be provided to ensure facilitation of recycling one for general waste and one for recyclables. type of compactor provided shall be suitable for composition of waste and amount of waste generated by development, and shall be in accordance with specifications of authority and din 30722-1 to din 30722-3 as appropriate

dubai building code part b architecture recycling and segregation b.8.5.3 sorting area for recyclable waste shall be provided within main waste storage area(s). this shall facilitate sorting of recyclables where segregation not undertaken at source by buildings tenants. it recommended that floor area of waste storage room(s) increased by not less than 5 m, to allow for additional space and manoeuvrability for sorting recyclable waste. hydraulic skip compactors b.8.5.6 in all types of buildings and facilities, hydraulic skip compactors, either portable or static, permitted for waste storage in lieu of number of traditional waste containers, and where waste quantities high enough to justify their use. where skip compactors used, at least two shall be provided to ensure facilitation of recycling one for general waste and one for recyclables. type of compactor provided shall be suitable for composition of waste and amount of waste generated by development, and shall be in accordance with specifications of authority and din 30722-1 to din 30722-3 as appropriate

dimensions, manoeuvrability and collection methodology of skip compactors shall be accounted for in design of waste storage room(s) or any provided service bay(s) as well as site access. guideline dimensions and examples of typical portable skip compactors shown in table b.30. capacity (litres) add capacity (m3) width (w) (mm) length (l) (mm) height (h) (mm) 10,000 20,000 1,000 2,000 2,015 2,550 4,400 6,390 2,500 2,560 table b.30 portable skip compactors special and bulky waste b.8.5.4 area shall be provided for special and bulky wastes such as hazardous wastes, furniture and electrical appliances. this may be within main waste storage room(s) or in separate location as appropriate. area shall be appropriately sized according to size and type of development and expected quantities of special and bulky waste. it recommended that area of not less than 5 m2 provided. this storage area shall be easily accessible for residents, tenants and waste collection contractors alike and shall not restrict access to building. chemical and toxic waste b.8.5.5 chemical wastes, toxic substances, chemical/toxic liquids and other dangerous materials shall not be disposed of in waste containers provided for general waste. if such wastes arise, they shall be stored in appropriate and separate waste storage containers, and removed from development by appointed and approved waste management contractor authorized to deal with such wastes by concerned departments of authority

dimensions, manoeuvrability and collection methodology of skip compactors shall be accounted for in design of waste storage room(s) or any provided service bay(s) as well as site access. guideline dimensions and examples of typical portable skip compactors shown in table b.30. capacity (litres) add capacity (m3) width (w) (mm) length (l) (mm) height (h) (mm) 10,000 20,000 1,000 2,000 2,015 2,550 4,400 6,390 2,500 2,560 table b.30 portable skip compactors special and bulky waste b.8.5.4 area shall be provided for special and bulky wastes such as hazardous wastes, furniture and electrical appliances. this may be within main waste storage room(s) or in separate location as appropriate. area shall be appropriately sized according to size and type of development and expected quantities of special and bulky waste. it recommended that area of not less than 5 m2 provided. this storage area shall be easily accessible for residents, tenants and waste collection contractors alike and shall not restrict access to building. chemical and toxic waste b.8.5.5 chemical wastes, toxic substances, chemical/toxic liquids and other dangerous materials shall not be disposed of in waste containers provided for general waste. if such wastes arise, they shall be stored in appropriate and separate waste storage containers, and removed from development by appointed and approved waste management contractor authorized to deal with such wastes by concerned departments of authority

if hazardous waste to be stored, it might need to be separated from rest of waste storage room(s) by walls and/or bunding as required, depending upon type and quantity of materials, materials composition and waste container to be utilized. dcd, dm environment department and dm public health and safety department shall be consulted as necessary

b 98 dubai building code part b architecture where refuse chute situated at distance from roads that surround building, main waste storage room(s) shall be situated near to access roads and shall facilitate easy access by waste management contractors for removal of waste from site

where suitable arrangements in place for transfer of waste to main waste storage area, service elevators may be used in lieu of refuse chutes. these shall be located in area that isolated from main passenger elevators and close to main waste storage area of building. in some situations, use of passenger elevators permissible for transfer of waste on scheduled basis. this subject to occupancy type of development and other factors including compliance with food safety regulations. interim waste storage rooms shall be provided as appropriate and conform with requirements of b.8.5.2

where suitable arrangements in place for transfer of waste to main waste storage area, service elevators may be used in lieu of refuse chutes. these shall be located in area that isolated from main passenger elevators and close to main waste storage area of building. in some situations, use of passenger elevators permissible for transfer of waste on scheduled basis. this subject to occupancy type of development and other factors including compliance with food safety regulations. interim waste storage rooms shall be provided as appropriate and conform with requirements of b.8.5.2

where suitable arrangements in place for transfer of waste to main waste storage area, service elevators may be used in lieu of refuse chutes. these shall be located in area that isolated from main passenger elevators and close to main waste storage area of building. in some situations, use of passenger elevators permissible for transfer of waste on scheduled basis. this subject to occupancy type of development and other factors including compliance with food safety regulations. interim waste storage rooms shall be provided as appropriate and conform with requirements of b.8.5.2

refuse chutes b.8.5.7 for residential buildings, where building height exceeds g+3 and floor area of any storey exceeds 250 m2, refuse chute shall be provided. for purpose of determining number of floors, mezzanine floor shall not be included where its functional use connected with ground floor. other occupancies may utilize refuse chutes as appropriate

in all cases where refuse chute required or provided, one of following shall be included to facilitate recycling a) second chute, or suitable automated separation system such as bi-separator or tri-separator, to handle recyclable material. this shall discharge into separate receptacle within waste management area or b) waste rooms provided on each floor, where recyclable waste can be stored. waste rooms shall comply with b.8.5.2.2 (d)-(g). number of rooms provided shall be appropriate to size and occupancy of building. these shall have floor area of not less than 2 m2. recyclable waste shall be collected by building operator daily, transported in service elevator and discharged into designated receptacle within waste management area

all refuse chutes shall conform to bs 1703. refuse chutes for collecting waste from floors to collection room shall be not less than 600 mm in diameter. material used shall resist corrosion, prevent dampness, be non-combustible and have smooth inner surface. all refuse chutes shall be supplied with cleaning and fire protection systems

area of not less than 900 mm  1,000 mm shall be included on each floor in order to provide access to refuse chute. door entrance shall be not less than 915 mm in width. doors shall swing outwards and be fitted with automatic door closing mechanisms. for ground floor residents, suitable access shall be provided to main waste storage room(s) or appropriate interim storage room(s) to facilitate disposal of waste and recycling

b 99 dubai building code part b architecture b.9 architectural requirements for specific building types and spaces b.9.1 general applicable requirements b.9.4 mosques this section details specific requirements for different building types. these requirements shall be met in addition to all applicable requirements in rest of part b

b 99 dubai building code part b architecture b.9 architectural requirements for specific building types and spaces b.9.1 general applicable requirements b.9.4 mosques this section details specific requirements for different building types. these requirements shall be met in addition to all applicable requirements in rest of part b
general requirements b.9.4.1 following requirements and recommendations apply to space planning of mosques

fire safety aspects of building design shall be in accordance with ch. 1 to ch.3 of uae flsc ref. b.1, based on occupancy classification, building height and/ or building depth, together with occupancy-specific fire separation and egress requirements given in section 5, ch. 3 of uae flsc ref. b.1. building design shall also follow applicable health and safety requirements ref. b.42 to ref. b.54

fire safety aspects of building design shall be in accordance with ch. 1 to ch.3 of uae flsc ref. b.1, based on occupancy classification, building height and/ or building depth, together with occupancy-specific fire separation and egress requirements given in section 5, ch. 3 of uae flsc ref. b.1. building design shall also follow applicable health and safety requirements ref. b.42 to ref. b.54

fire safety aspects of building design shall be in accordance with ch. 1 to ch.3 of uae flsc ref. b.1, based on occupancy classification, building height and/ or building depth, together with occupancy-specific fire separation and egress requirements given in section 5, ch. 3 of uae flsc ref. b.1. building design shall also follow applicable health and safety requirements ref. b.42 to ref. b.54

a) size of mosques should be sufficient for population density they serve, taking into account number of mosques within proximate locations, as well as other plots reserved for mosque construction in future
b) future expansions of mosque facilities should be taken into account
c) professionals involved in design and construction of mosques shall have knowledge and experience of islamic architecture

d) direction of prayer and flow of movement inside mosque shall be taken b.9.2 fire separating construction into account. fire separating construction shall be provided in accordance with table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. b.1
e) vehicular and pedestrian movement inside mosque plot shall segregated to avoid interference with movement of worshippers to and from mosques buildings and service blocks

b.9.3 cinemas, theatres and auditoria architectural design of mezzanines, balconies, aisles and seating arrangements in cinemas, theatres and auditoria shall conform to minimum requirements given in section 5.1, ch. 3 of uae flsc ref. b.1. where there well-defined main entrance or exit from cinemas, theatres and auditoria, it shall be designed to accommodate two thirds of total occupant load. b 100 dubai building code part b architecture mosque architecture b.9.4.2 there no restrictions on mosque design, provided that following basic requirements and recommendations met

a) mosque design should respect islamic architecture principles and should be in harmony with local heritage and environment conditions of region. b) none of design elements used shall contradict islamic principles. this includes proposed geometry, zoning of spaces to interior finishes and calligraphy. c) architectural style used in mosque design should be implemented consistently for all mosque elements including dome and minaret

d) mosque design shall include aesthetic treatment of mosque spaces and elements including internal treatment of prayer halls. e) height of mosque elements such as domes and minarets, shall be proportionate to mosque general massing. ratio of minaret height to mosque should be 31. window openings shall be positioned carefully and treated to avoid distraction of worshippers and sun glare effect, especially in direction of prayer. examples of mosque design given in figure b.86. mosque prayer hall shall be provided with mihrab for imams space and to indicate direction of prayer. minbar for friday prayers and eid prayers shall be provided and should be appropriately sized and positioned to avoid restricting prayer space in front lines. minbar shall be positioned on right side of mihrab as shown in figure b.87

minaret shall be provided with permanent stair constructed from durable materials, for access. as minimum, minaret shall have spiral access stair from ground level to roof. radius of spiral stair shall be not less than 900 mm and shall conform to requirements for spiral stairs in b.6.4.1.12. minaret openings should be covered to reduce maintenance requirements
b 101 figure b.86 mosque examples figure b.87 mihrab and minbar example dubai building code part b architecture implementation of green planted open spaces within mosque plot encouraged

when plot area allows, it recommended that mosque includes library, storage spaces and learning spaces. materials used (such as prayer hall carpets, floor finishes and ceiling materials) shall have hygienic and eco-safety properties designed to prevent accumulation of dust, mould, etc. materials shall be appropriate to holy nature of mosque. finishes shall be selected to withstand high frequency of mosque space use. acoustic treatment shall be included in design of prayer hall to suit space and height (see h.10.4.1). when mosque requires fences for security or safety purposes, these fences should allow visibility into mosque plot. mosques located in industrial areas or areas under construction shall be provided with fences
mosque design should include courtyard spaces and iwan for prayer overspill as needed

mosque access strategy b.9.4.3 number and size of entrances to mosques should be proportionate to area and expected number of worshippers, avoiding congestion that might occur during access and exit of worshippers

mosque access strategy b.9.4.3 number and size of entrances to mosques should be proportionate to area and expected number of worshippers, avoiding congestion that might occur during access and exit of worshippers

entrance doors to prayer halls shall be sized proportionately to number of worshippers and should be not less than 3 in height. prayer hall door positions shall be carefully planned to avoid impacting prayer space or creating queues during access or exit. doors should always be located in rear of prayer hall. doors shall be provided with vision glass panels

separate entrance into prayer area shall be provided for imam from mihrab side. entrance door shall open towards direction of egress. roof access for maintenance shall be provided with protective ladders for ascending heights of up to 6 m. if required ascending height exceeds 6 m, access stair should be provided

b 102 dubai building code part b architecture mosque prayer hall arrangement b.9.4.4 prayer hall areas shall be planned to accommodate total number of worshippers in accordance with occupant load factor in b.5.1

prayer lines shall be 1,330 mm in length, with each line indicated through carpet patterns. each person in mosque assumed to occupy 675 mm of line width. prayer halls should be rectangular in shape, with longest edge perpendicular to qibla. irregular angles, protrusions or recesses within prayer halls should be avoided. example of general prayer hall arrangement shown in figure b.88

intermediate structural elements inside prayer halls that impact continuity of prayer lines should be avoided. 600 mm space shall be provided on sides of prayer hall in jumaa mosques to facilitate movement and exit from prayer hall
net height of prayer halls shall be proportionate to expected number of worshippers and to architectural style chosen. height of prayer hall shall be not less than minimum value given in b.5.3

space for shoe storage shall be provided prior to accessing prayer hall. space shall be adequately sized to serve expected number of worshippers and shall be positioned so as not to conflict with prayer hall access
prayer halls lighting intensity and homogeneity should be taken into consideration

600 04 02 03 01 05 06 06 1,500 figure b.88 prayer hall general arrangement example key 01 prayer hall 02 qibla direction 03 mihrab 04 area for each worshipper 05 clear entry 06 racks for shoes 07 door should be clear of prayer space 07 b 103 dubai building code part b architecture b.9.4.5 womens prayer halls in mosques all mosques (except for those located in industrial areas) shall provide womens prayer hall with required number of sanitary facilities and ablution spaces. area of womens prayer halls shall be sufficient to expected number of female worshippers and shall be sized to accommodate at least 20% of total planned number of worshippers. position of womens prayer halls shall be planned such that imam position in front of all of praying group. prayer hall shall not be adjacent to mens toilet blocks or located in remote area of mosque (see figure b.89). privacy of womens entrance and prayer hall shall be taken into account. provision shall be made for direct and private circulation between womens prayer hall and womens facilities in mosque (see figure b.89). b 104 01 03 02 01 02 04 03 figure b.89 prayer hall general arrangement example key 01 men main prayer hall 02 men secondary prayer hall 03 women prayer hall 04 prayer prohibited in this area when imam in secondary prayer hall dubai building code part b architecture womens prayer hall shall be located near to main road access and parking areas and shall not be allocated in mosque basement floor

indicative mihrab or wall recess should be provided to inform qibla direction. visual and audio connection between womens and mens prayer halls shall be provided. audio systems shall provide appropriate sound levels into women prayer room
