g 15 dubai building code part g incoming utilities g.4 design, erection and installation of electrical systems g.4.1 general g.4.2 electrical supply g.4.3 incoming supply and metering sections g.4 to g.7 outline requirements for design of electrical installations. they based on latest edition of bs 7671 and institution of engineering technology (iet) documents ref. g.2 and ref. g.3. 11 kv medium voltage (mv) network installations shall meet requirements of g.7. for specific requirements beyond scope of g.7, project shall be referred to dewa at concept design stage. sections g.4 to g.7 not intended to a) take place of detailed specification b) instruct untrained persons or c) provide for every circumstance

g 15 dubai building code part g incoming utilities g.4 design, erection and installation of electrical systems g.4.1 general g.4.2 electrical supply g.4.3 incoming supply and metering sections g.4 to g.7 outline requirements for design of electrical installations. they based on latest edition of bs 7671 and institution of engineering technology (iet) documents ref. g.2 and ref. g.3. 11 kv medium voltage (mv) network installations shall meet requirements of g.7. for specific requirements beyond scope of g.7, project shall be referred to dewa at concept design stage. sections g.4 to g.7 not intended to a) take place of detailed specification b) instruct untrained persons or c) provide for every circumstance
where situation arises that not covered or allowed for within these sections, dewa shall be consulted to obtain further clarity and guidance

nominal electric supply voltage from dewa (see iec 60038) 230/400 v  10%, 50 hz, three-phase, 4-wire with separate neutral and protective conductor (generally metallic armour of dewa service cable). neutral solidly earthed at dewas substations and shall not be earthed elsewhere in consumers electrical installations. design fault level within substation 40 ka (fault duration 1 s), except for fuse protected equipment/circuits

all equipment, apparatus, materials and accessories used in electrical installations shall be designed and rated for operation on this electric supply. overload, short-circuit and earth leakage protective devices shall be provided. depending on design of consumer installations, protective devices shall also be provided to protect against following as required a) over voltages b) fluctuations c) transients and harmonics d) loss of one or more phases e) unforeseen interruptions
note earth leakage current may have capacitive component, including that resulting from deliberate use of capacitors
before commencing building design, consumer shall obtain confirmation of availability of power supply from dewa
note 1 power supply from dewas network subject to all applicable terms and conditions as issued by dewa
consumer shall protect all elements of dewa installations provided for and within premises. any violation, defect or damage to dewa lines, equipment or metering shall be reported to dewa immediately

where total connected load (tcl) exceeds 400 kw, provision shall be made within building or plot for dewa substation. note 2 in some circumstances dewa substation might be required for connected loads less than 400 kw
meters shall be installed to measure and record electricity demand and consumption of facility. all meters shall conform to dewa specifications and be approved by dewa

tariff metering shall be in accordance with g.4.5. when building tariff meter not present, sub meters shall be installed for each individual tenancy in building. these submeters shall be for demand management and electricity cost allocation purposes only. virtual meters using run-hours shall not be used as submeters

g 16 dubai building code part g incoming utilities g.4.4 point of supply general g.4.4.1 point of supply shall be made available at one location within plot/project, unless otherwise approved by dewa. point of supply defines boundary of dewa equipment, and shall be decided by dewa

circuit breaker(s) and/or main distribution board (mdb) provided at point of supply shall be designed and rated to suit required application, and to conform to all applicable requirements of g.4 to g.7

main circuit breaker at point of supply (see figure g.1) shall be marked as such and shall be identifiable from other breakers for easy operation in emergency. where more than one incoming supply available, in any premises, each main circuit breaker shall be marked to indicate which installation, or section of installation, it controls

where main low voltage (lv) distribution panel connected directly to lv side of transformer, main incomer circuit breaker proposed in lv panel shall be fully withdrawable four-pole type air circuit breaker (acb) (see figure g.2)

where consumers main lv distribution board (db)/panel connected to dewas two or more distribution transformers, separate bus-sections with mechanically and electrically interlocked bus-section breakers/isolators (four-pole) shall be provided

g 17 figure g.2 typical fully withdrawable four-pole circuit breaker all incoming cable terminations/live connections in metering cabinets, mdbs and sub-main distribution boards (smdbs) shall be shrouded and insulated. all exposed live terminal connections and busbars in any lv db shall be shrouded and/or insulated

g 17 figure g.2 typical fully withdrawable four-pole circuit breaker all incoming cable terminations/live connections in metering cabinets, mdbs and sub-main distribution boards (smdbs) shall be shrouded and insulated. all exposed live terminal connections and busbars in any lv db shall be shrouded and/or insulated

figure g.1 main circuit breaker dubai building code part g incoming utilities switchgear locations g.4.4.2 main electrical switchroom shall be located near to plot entrance, on ground floor. where substation provided within building, main electrical switchroom shall be provided in ground floor area adjacent to transformer room. consumers mdbs, smdbs and final dbs shall all be installed in locations to which access always available. minimum dimensions for safe access shall be in accordance with figure g.3. mounting height to top of board(s) shall normally be 2 from ground/floor level

all main electrical switchrooms, and other sub- electrical switchrooms in which capacitor banks installed, shall be air-conditioned. non-air-conditioned electrical rooms shall be ventilated and provided with heavy duty exhaust fans and metallic louvered doors, as applicable

g 18 adequate level of illumination shall be provided to facilitate safe operation at all times. all electrical rooms shall be provided with non-maintained emergency lighting in accordance with ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. g.1
door openings to electrical switchrooms shall meet following requirements
a) door shall open outwards in direction of egress
b) opening shall be kept free from obstructions
c) door shall not open towards driveway, staircases and steps, or other areas of people or traffic movement

key 01 lv switchboard/panel 02 capacitor bank 03 smdb (sample) 04 kwh meters 05 non-maintained, minimum 3 h rated, self-contained emergency light 06 light fitting 07 non-combustible door in exterior wall and 90 min fire resistance rated, non- combustible, non-louvered door in interior wall note minimum clear space shown at sides and rear of panel for switchboards with rear access requirements only

0 0 5 1 , 1,500 figure g.3 layout of main electrical switchroom with one cubicle type lv switchboard/panel dubai building code part g incoming utilities minimum illumination of 500 lux shall be provided to facilitate safe operation at all times. incoming supply cables to consumers mdb(s) shall be completely segregated and identified from consumers cables

electrical switchrooms shall not be located below or beside following wet areas main electrical switchroom g.4.4.3 dimensional layout of electrical switchrooms shall be maintained as shown in figure g.3 for single lv panel, figure g.4 for switchrooms containing two freestanding lv panels or figure g.5 for switchrooms containing wall mounted lv panels. electrical switchroom shall not be used for storage of any equipment, material, etc
1) bathrooms 2) toilets 3) kitchens 4) pantries 5) storage tanks 6) air conditioning chillers or other liquid/hazardous materials
water pipes shall not be installed within or on electrical switchroom walls

all tariff metering shall be smart meters, normally provided by dewa and restricted to one for each consumer installation, unless otherwise approved/ specified by dewa

g.4.5.3 metering cabinet arrangement minimum space provided for installation of kwh meter shall be 300 mm wide and 500 mm high (see figure g.7). minimum space of 1,200 mm shall be provided in front of kwh meter cabinet/meters

general arrangement and dimensional layout of metering cabinets and array of meters installed in electrical switchrooms and enclosures, along with associated wiring, shall be submitted to dewa for approval. g 22 minimum 2 clearance shall be maintained between electrical and water service
following typical arrangements of kwh metering cabinets/kwh meters given for guidance a) multi-tenant arrangements (see figure g.7) b) single-tenant arrangements (see figure g.8)

dimensions (mm) 1,800 b 600 (min) c 500 100 e 300 figure g.7 typical multi-tenant metering arrangement dubai building code part g incoming utilities key ct operated, kwh metering compartment b transparent viewing window for meter (size 1.25  1.25 m) c protection cover with hinges on top (size 1.5  1.5 m) three sealable type vt fuse carriers in sealable enclosure for data concentrator e kwh meter f pad locking arrangement (hole size 10 mm diameter) g ct shorting terminal block in sealable enclosure (rs1 and rs2/ys1 and ys2/bs1 and bs2) 01 load side busbars (400 mm) 02 metering 03 main incomer and cts 04 main cable terminal 05 20 mm conduit from kwh metering compartment to cable trench for ct operated meters and data concentrators, vt fuses shall be sealed type, located in sealable enclosure

to facilitate meter reading, transparent viewing window shall be provided in all metering cabinets, and in doors of enclosures housing meters with associated distribution switchgear (see figure g.8, item b). material used for viewing window shall be not less than 5 mm thick. window shall have hinged type protection cover
all metering cabinets and enclosures shall be constructed from non-combustible material

when meters installed in electrical switchrooms, fire-resistant/non-combustible base plates shall be provided. single core pvc or xlpe insulated and pvc sheathed cables conforming to bs 6004 shall be used for connection to kwh meters

all metering cabinets/compartments shall be provided with padlocking and wire sealing facilities on their external door/cover, which shall normally be hinged (see figure g.9). generally, all apparatus, circuit breakers, isolators, busbars, removable lid section of busbar - trunking, etc., installed on supply side of any dewas metering shall have provision for sealing by dewa

b c e g f 05 figure g.8 arrangement of metering in main lv panel g 23 dubai building code part g incoming utilities ct metering requirements g.4.5.4 metering by means of current transformers (cts) shall be installed where circuit breaker rating at point of supply 160 and above. note 1 dewa provides smart kwh meter(s) and associated cts for all tariff metering. in some circumstances consumer might be permitted to provide kwh meter and cts as private check meters for energy monitoring purposes

b c e g f 05 figure g.8 arrangement of metering in main lv panel g 23 dubai building code part g incoming utilities ct metering requirements g.4.5.4 metering by means of current transformers (cts) shall be installed where circuit breaker rating at point of supply 160 and above. note 1 dewa provides smart kwh meter(s) and associated cts for all tariff metering. in some circumstances consumer might be permitted to provide kwh meter and cts as private check meters for energy monitoring purposes
note 2 basic data schedule for smart metering shown in table g.1 and table g.2

meter and cts shown in figure g.8 shall be tested and calibrated by dewa prior to installation onsite. cts shall be located on busbars immediately after circuit breaker/isolator at which complete installation to be metered

each ct shall have following markings (illustrated in figure g.10) 1) manufacturers name and/or trademark 2) 3) rated primary current and secondary current rated frequency and primary maximum voltage 4) accuracy class 5) 6) rated output (va) terminal (secondary winding) identification (s1, s2) and 7) power flow direction (p1, p2)
figure g.9 typical metering cabinet padlocking and wire tag metering section/compartment in all mdbs and smdbs, if and when incorporated within, shall be segregated from other sections/compartments

removable links of adequate length shall be provided in busbar of each phase to enable easy maintenance and replacement of cts. for consumer premises with groups of villas, space/provision shall be made for installing dewa feeder pillars. location of such feeder pillars shall be finalized during estimation taking into account cable route, cable route length, road crossing, etc
three cts shall be provided for each metering
following ct transformation ratios shall be used a) 200/5 b) 300/5 c) 400/5 d) 800/5 e) 1,600/5 f) 2,400/5

all light fittings, wiring accessories and other electrical equipment in potentially hazardous atmospheres shall be selected in accordance with bs en 60079

g.4.10 load balancing in all cases where three-phase supply provided to premises, various categories of connected load (such as lighting, socket outlets, water heaters, single-phase air conditioning units, equipment, apparatus, etc.) shall be distributed and connected on red, yellow and blue phases as evenly as possible, to maintain load balance between phases at all distribution levels

g.4.11 wiring accessories g.4.11.1 conduits and fittings high impact rigid pvc conduits and fittings shall conform to all relevant parts of bs 4607, bs en 60423 and bs en 61386. they shall meet following requirements a) be suitable for use at maximum ambient temperature of 48 c b) not soften or suffer structural degradation at temperature of 70 c c) be non-hygroscopic d) be heat-resistant

g.4.11 wiring accessories g.4.11.1 conduits and fittings high impact rigid pvc conduits and fittings shall conform to all relevant parts of bs 4607, bs en 60423 and bs en 61386. they shall meet following requirements a) be suitable for use at maximum ambient temperature of 48 c b) not soften or suffer structural degradation at temperature of 70 c c) be non-hygroscopic d) be heat-resistant
pvc conduits shall be provided with copper/brass terminals

steel conduits and fittings shall conform to relevant specifications in bs en 60423 and bs en 61386. they shall be hot-dip galvanized to class 4 protection, both inside and outside. flexible steel conduits and fittings shall conform to bs en 61386. conduit systems shall be designed and installed to exclude moisture, dust and dirt. small drainage holes shall be provided at lowest part of system to avoid accumulation of condensation

dubai building code part g incoming utilities all fittings, bends, tees, elbows, couplers, etc. and supports shall be of factory-made sections and of same quality as trays. cables shall be fastened securely by purpose-made clips, cleats or saddles

g.4.12 gear assemblies low-voltage switchgear and control g.4.12.1 main and sub main distribution boards mdbs and smdbs installed within consumer installations shall be factory-built assemblies and conform to relevant parts of bs en 61439/ iec 61439

headings: main and sub main distribution boards
Description: g.4.12 gear assemblies low-voltage switchgear and control g.4.12.1 main and sub main distribution boards mdbs and smdbs installed within consumer installations shall be factory-built assemblies and conform to relevant parts of bs en 61439/ iec 61439

assemblies shall be constructed of materials capable of withstanding following when encountered in normal service a) mechanical stress b) electrical stress c) thermal stress d) effects of humidity. apparatus forming part of assembly shall have clearances, creepage distances and isolating distances conforming to bs en 61439/iec 61439. these distances shall be maintained during normal and relevant service conditions
phase busbar, neutral bar and earth bar shall be copper. they shall be colour identified as indicated in table g.7 and table g.8. neutral bar shall be of same cross-section as phase busbar

circuit breakers, busbars, etc. shall be designed and rated to suit individual applications at site conditions. table g.9 may be used to indicate preferred details and parameters of equipment and components in mdbs/smdbs for individual application

trunking g.4.11.2 where applicable, surface and underfloor (duct) trunking and their fittings shall conform to bs en 50085. trunking and fittings shall be constructed of steel, hot-dip galvanized both inside and outside, or non-combustible insulating material with removable covers. installation of trunking shall be carried out strictly in accordance with manufacturers guidelines

cable trays and supports g.4.11.3 cable trays, accessories and supports shall be either hot-dip galvanized or pvc-coated steel. cable trays shall be either perforated type or ladder type. they shall have sufficient strength and rigidity to support cables installed, and be provided with upstands of dimensions sufficient to carry cables on both sides

cable trays and supports g.4.11.3 cable trays, accessories and supports shall be either hot-dip galvanized or pvc-coated steel. cable trays shall be either perforated type or ladder type. they shall have sufficient strength and rigidity to support cables installed, and be provided with upstands of dimensions sufficient to carry cables on both sides

cable trays and supports g.4.11.3 cable trays, accessories and supports shall be either hot-dip galvanized or pvc-coated steel. cable trays shall be either perforated type or ladder type. they shall have sufficient strength and rigidity to support cables installed, and be provided with upstands of dimensions sufficient to carry cables on both sides

switches shall be metal clad when used within industrial installations
for large groups of lighting, gang switch shall be provided with phase barrier inside switch boxes
for outdoor locations, switches with weather protection classified as ip55 in accordance with bs en 60529 shall be used

g 35 dubai building code part g incoming utilities plugs and socket outlets g.4.13.2 single-phase plugs and socket outlets used in domestic and commercial installations shall conform to bs 1363. socket outlets shall be of type illustrated in figure g.11
figure g.11 typical 3-pin flat, double-pole, shuttered, switched single socket 15 plugs and socket outlets used in domestic and commercial installations shall conform to bs 546
g 36 shaver socket outlets shall conform to afdds available in following types a) bs en 61558 in bathrooms and a) one single device, comprising afd unit and b) bs 4573 in rooms other than bathrooms
in hotel rooms, 5 plugs and socket outlets for table lamps which switched from dedicated lighting circuit shall conform to bs 546

industrial plugs and socket outlets shall conform to bs en 60309. they shall feature switch that integrally built in or attached to them. rating and type of socket outlets with plugs shall be selected to suit individual applications and shall not be interchangeable for different current ratings
weather protected type (classified as ip55 in accordance with bs en 60529) socket outlets shall be used for outdoor applications

g.4.13.3 arc fault detection devices (afdds) additional protection to mitigate risk of fire due to arcing recommended in certain applications. afdds protect against series and parallel arcing by detecting low-level hazardous arcing that circuit breakers, fuses and rcds not designed to detect. afdds shall be selected in accordance with bs en 62606. afdd shall be placed at origin of circuit to be protected

opening means, intended to be connected in series with suitable short-circuit protective device declared by manufacturer as conforming to one or more of following standards 1) bs en 60898-1 2) bs en 61009-1 or 3) bs en 60269 series b) one single device, comprising afd unit integrated in protective device conforming to one or more of following standards 1) bs en 60898-1 2) bs en 61008-1 3) bs en 61009-1 or 4) bs en 62423 c) afd unit (add-on module) and declared protective device, intended to be assembled onsite

examples of where such devices can be used include 1) premises with sleeping accommodation 2) locations with risk of fire due to nature of processed or stored materials 3) locations with combustible construction materials 4) structures having fire propagating features and 5) locations with endangered or irreplaceable objects (such as museums, libraries, art galleries)

dubai building code part g incoming utilities surge protection devices (spds) g.4.13.4 surge protection devices shall be implemented on electrical distribution systems within new buildings. spds shall have necessary capability to deal with current levels and durations involved at point of installation

for protection of ac power circuits, spds allocated type number. number corresponds to test class from bs en 61643 series as follows, and as illustrated in figure g.12 a) type 1  only used where there risk of direct lightning current and typically cooker control units g.4.13.5 all stationary cooking appliances in domestic premises shall have cooker control switch. switch shall conform to bs 4177 and be located separately from appliance (see figure g.13). cooking appliance shall incorporate integral earthing terminal

for protection of ac power circuits, spds allocated type number. number corresponds to test class from bs en 61643 series as follows, and as illustrated in figure g.12 a) type 1  only used where there risk of direct lightning current and typically cooker control units g.4.13.5 all stationary cooking appliances in domestic premises shall have cooker control switch. switch shall conform to bs 4177 and be located separately from appliance (see figure g.13). cooking appliance shall incorporate integral earthing terminal

cooker control switch shall be two-pole (for single-phase appliance) or four- pole (for three-phase appliance). it shall be connected to separate final sub-circuit from db, through 100 elcb
used at origin of installation b) type 2  used at dbs c) type 3  used at or near equipment

g.4.13.6 kitchen appliances electrical appliances used in consumer installations (such as water heaters, cookers, hot plates, etc.) shall generally conform to bs en 60335. figure g.14 illustrates typical setting out details of kitchen

key 01 no sockets within 300 mm of edge of sink 02 no sockets or accessories above gas or electric hobs 03 cooker switch 04 dishwasher 05 fridge 06 150 vs 250 cooker connection figure g.14 cooker and kitchen typical installation setting out details ( institution of engineering and technology. figure based on figure 5.2.2 in institution of engineering and technology, 2018. electricians guide to building regulations ref. g.2) g 38 dubai building code part g incoming utilities each room air-conditioning unit shall be connected to separate final sub-circuit from db

maximum of two window-type air-conditioning units permitted to connect on single-phase supply. where three or more window-type units installed, they shall be balanced as evenly as possible over three-phase supply
breaker rating and wire size shall be selected based on connected load of air conditioning unit, subject to minimum 20 with 4 mm2 circuit wires

g.4.13.9 extra lv safety apparatus includes extra lv safety apparatus a) electric buzzers and bells b) mirror lights and shaver socket outlets in bathrooms c) light fittings for underwater installations

extra-lv safety apparatus shall incorporate appropriately rated double wound safety isolation transformer. transformer shall either be integral or mounted separately. cartridge fuse or mcb shall be incorporated in secondary circuit. safety isolation transformer shall conform to bs en 61558. segregation of lv and extra-lv circuits shall be in accordance with g.4.18.4

g.4.13.10 hv discharge lighting equipment hv discharge lighting equipment and installations shall conform to bs 559. they shall be rated for voltages not exceeding 5 kv, rms to earth, measured on open circuit
hv discharge lighting equipment, including neon signs, shall not be installed without prior approval from dewa
g.4.13.11 electric motors and starters control of electric motors shall conform to bs en 60204 where equipment within scope of standard

all motors shall be protected against overload, short-circuit and earth leakage. they shall also be protected against voltage fluctuations and loss of one or more phases, as necessary for individual application

every motor having rating exceeding 0.37 kw shall be provided with control equipment incorporating means of protection against overload of motor. only installation of single-phase motors rated up to 3.7 kw, and three-phase motors up to 110 kw, permitted, unless otherwise approved by dewa. control of water heaters, saunas, g.4.13.7 jacuzzis and washing machines double-pole switches with neon indicator shall be provided, appropriately rated for control of equipment. final connection to equipment shall be made from flex outlet plate. plate shall be mounted adjacent to equipment. for water heaters installed in bathroom or water closet, control switch shall be installed immediately outside room. for saunas and jacuzzis, control gear shall be placed outside sauna room/cabin

every motor having rating exceeding 0.37 kw shall be provided with control equipment incorporating means of protection against overload of motor. only installation of single-phase motors rated up to 3.7 kw, and three-phase motors up to 110 kw, permitted, unless otherwise approved by dewa. control of water heaters, saunas, g.4.13.7 jacuzzis and washing machines double-pole switches with neon indicator shall be provided, appropriately rated for control of equipment. final connection to equipment shall be made from flex outlet plate. plate shall be mounted adjacent to equipment. for water heaters installed in bathroom or water closet, control switch shall be installed immediately outside room. for saunas and jacuzzis, control gear shall be placed outside sauna room/cabin

water heaters, saunas, jacuzzis and washing machines shall be connected to separate final sub-circuit from db. water heaters shall incorporate integral earthing terminal adjacent to phase and neutral terminals. all terminals shall be housed in suitable recess with splash proof removable cover. every heater circuit shall be protected by 30 rccb/elcb

control of air conditioning unit/ g.4.13.8 equipment window-type room air conditioners with maximum cooling capacity of 1.5 kw shall be connected by 15 switched socket outlet. for other room air-conditioning units, double-pole switch of appropriate rating, with flex outlet, shall be provided and mounted adjacent to unit. g 39 dubai building code part g incoming utilities g.4.14 standby generators standby safety power provision shall be made for all projects and premises in category of touristic, commercial and cultural, that require dedicated transformer and lv panel supplies. these include, but not limited to a) shopping malls and shopping centres b) hotel buildings c) amusement and theme parks d) museums e) major exhibition halls f) hospitals g) main government buildings

control of air conditioning unit/ g.4.13.8 equipment window-type room air conditioners with maximum cooling capacity of 1.5 kw shall be connected by 15 switched socket outlet. for other room air-conditioning units, double-pole switch of appropriate rating, with flex outlet, shall be provided and mounted adjacent to unit. g 39 dubai building code part g incoming utilities g.4.14 standby generators standby safety power provision shall be made for all projects and premises in category of touristic, commercial and cultural, that require dedicated transformer and lv panel supplies. these include, but not limited to a) shopping malls and shopping centres b) hotel buildings c) amusement and theme parks d) museums e) major exhibition halls f) hospitals g) main government buildings

note 1 for new and existing buildings, following considered to be essential services/loads. a) separate main and/or sub-main lv panel b) in-house standby generator(s) of sufficient capacity for 100% backup, with auto-changeover functionality (ats)
figure g.15 push buttons motors and their control gear shall be located in well ventilated areas with adequate space for operation, inspection and maintenance
where multiple motors above 110 kw proposed, advice of dewa shall be sought on obtaining bulk supply

all starters, isolators and pushbuttons (see figure g.15) shall be clearly marked in arabic and english stating which machine they control and their function. to avoid confusion, words start and stop shall be used (and not open and closed)

g 40 dubai building code part g incoming utilities generator rooms shall be 2 h fire rated to conform to table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. g.1. exterior walls do not need to be fire rated unless there risk of exterior fire spread and wall fire rated in accordance with ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. g.1. louvers in fire rated walls not permitted without opening protection
note 4 installing and connecting standby generators in consumers installation to maintain power supply in event of mains failure permitted only with prior approval from dewa

note 5 changeover circuit breaker or isolator should have four poles for three-phase supply and two poles for single-phase supply. this ensures that phases and neutral of two systems remain separate and distinct

note 6 installation should be carried out in such way that there no possibility of paralleling generator supply with dewa supply. note 7 adequate mechanical and electrical interlock should be provided between incomer circuit breakers or isolators of both generator and dewa supplies. full details of equipment, including details of essential loads, and circuit and wiring diagrams, should be submitted to dewa for approval before commencement of works

note 8 provision for connecting mobile generator with incomer rating 2,500 a/1,600 a, to maintain power supply in event of mains failure, should be included in mdb/lv panel. circuit breaker should be four-pole type. adequate mechanical and electrical interlock should be provided between incomer circuit breakers of both mobile generator and dewa supply

note 9 location of main electrical room should be near to front entrance/approach road and sleeves to be provided for intake generator cables. this provision not mandatory for main lv panel connected with standby generator in auto/manual changeover mode
g.4.15 power to fire pumps table 9.3, ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. g.1 requires direct power supply from utility company to main electric fire pump and jockey pump via dedicated db located inside pump room

note it responsibility of consumer to provide this arrangement at main lv panel. following loads shall be served by standby generators 1) elevators, escalators, security systems, cctv, alarm systems, bms systems, stairways, entrances, control rooms, data centres, electrical rooms, generator rooms, etc. 2) minimum 20% of lighting installations in landlord areas (corridors, public lobbies, assembly points, reception, underground parking, etc.)

note it responsibility of consumer to provide this arrangement at main lv panel. following loads shall be served by standby generators 1) elevators, escalators, security systems, cctv, alarm systems, bms systems, stairways, entrances, control rooms, data centres, electrical rooms, generator rooms, etc. 2) minimum 20% of lighting installations in landlord areas (corridors, public lobbies, assembly points, reception, underground parking, etc.)

note it responsibility of consumer to provide this arrangement at main lv panel. following loads shall be served by standby generators 1) elevators, escalators, security systems, cctv, alarm systems, bms systems, stairways, entrances, control rooms, data centres, electrical rooms, generator rooms, etc. 2) minimum 20% of lighting installations in landlord areas (corridors, public lobbies, assembly points, reception, underground parking, etc.)

note 2 for new buildings, following considered to be non-essential services/loads a) additional acb(s) as incomer with auto-changeover facility (motorized acb operation) to connect to external mobile generator for all non-essential lv panels b) access for transportation and stationing of mobile generators, intake arrangements for cabling and connections, identification labels and notices for connection of generator during emergencies

note 2 for new buildings, following considered to be non-essential services/loads a) additional acb(s) as incomer with auto-changeover facility (motorized acb operation) to connect to external mobile generator for all non-essential lv panels b) access for transportation and stationing of mobile generators, intake arrangements for cabling and connections, identification labels and notices for connection of generator during emergencies

note 2 for new buildings, following considered to be non-essential services/loads a) additional acb(s) as incomer with auto-changeover facility (motorized acb operation) to connect to external mobile generator for all non-essential lv panels b) access for transportation and stationing of mobile generators, intake arrangements for cabling and connections, identification labels and notices for connection of generator during emergencies

note 3 requirements listed above for standby provision of electrical power under unforeseen power interruptions only. emergency and standby power requirements of fire and life safety systems covered in ch. 6 to ch.10 of uae flsc ref. g.1. emergency generators for operational continuity can be shared with those required by uae flsc provided that shared generator(s) meets requirements of both codes

current demand of 13 shall be assumed for each 13 switched socket outlet circuit. minimum of 200 w per point shall be used for calculation purposes for each 13 switched socket outlet, installed for general utility purpose, other than kitchen. all twin socket outlets shall be taken to be as two separate socket outlet points. kitchen area might need separate circuits

for multi-consumer installations, including commercial premises such as shops, showrooms, garages and workshops, where provision for connection of additional load might be required, assumed connected load of additional spaces/circuits shall also be indicated in load distribution schedules submitted for dewas approval (see g.4.16.2)

g.4.17 conduits, trunking, trays and accessories design criteria for installation of trunking and conduits g.4.17.1 trunking and conduits shall be selected to meet requirements of g.4.11
g.4.17 conduits, trunking, trays and accessories design criteria for installation of trunking and conduits g.4.17.1 trunking and conduits shall be selected to meet requirements of g.4.11
as far as possible, trunking and conduit runs from electrical switchrooms to individual consumer dbs shall be routed only within common electrical service routes and riser ducts
as far as possible, trunking and conduit runs from electrical switchrooms to individual consumer dbs shall be routed only within common electrical service routes and riser ducts

long trunking and conduit runs from electrical switchrooms located on ground floor to consumer dbs located on upper floors shall not be installed unless unavoidable. where armoured cables used, they shall be installed in cable trays

long trunking and conduit runs from electrical switchrooms located on ground floor to consumer dbs located on upper floors shall not be installed unless unavoidable. where armoured cables used, they shall be installed in cable trays

long trunking and conduit runs from electrical switchrooms located on ground floor to consumer dbs located on upper floors shall not be installed unless unavoidable. where armoured cables used, they shall be installed in cable trays
draw-in boxes shall be provided in all straight conduit runs exceeding 15 m. conduit runs having 90 bends shall be provided with draw-in boxes for every two bends

g 50 dubai building code part g incoming utilities draw-wires shall be provided in all concealed conduits (and ducts) with ends left free at outlet boxes for pulling wiring cables. permitted cable routes for concealed cables illustrated in figure g.19
all trunking and conduit runs shall be free from sharp edges and burrs throughout their lengths. suitable grommets and bushes shall be provided at terminal outlets
trunking and conduit runs shall be supported at regular intervals (see table g.17 to table g.19)
