h 24 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.10.4 air inlets and exhausts outdoor air inlets for all ventilation systems, including doors, operable windows and mixed mode ventilation systems, shall be located at suitable distance from potential sources of contamination as specified in ashrae 62.1, ashrae 62.2 and ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. h.17. isolation of pollutant sources h.4.10.5 all buildings with activities producing hazardous fumes or chemicals (such as print rooms and laboratories) shall be provided with dedicated air extraction systems for those spaces. system shall create negative pressure and exhaust fumes or chemicals, to prevent them from entering adjacent rooms. note this to reduce possibility of odour, smoke or other air contaminants entering ventilation system

h 24 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.10.4 air inlets and exhausts outdoor air inlets for all ventilation systems, including doors, operable windows and mixed mode ventilation systems, shall be located at suitable distance from potential sources of contamination as specified in ashrae 62.1, ashrae 62.2 and ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. h.17. isolation of pollutant sources h.4.10.5 all buildings with activities producing hazardous fumes or chemicals (such as print rooms and laboratories) shall be provided with dedicated air extraction systems for those spaces. system shall create negative pressure and exhaust fumes or chemicals, to prevent them from entering adjacent rooms. note this to reduce possibility of odour, smoke or other air contaminants entering ventilation system

exhaust air shall be discharged in such way that it does not get drawn back into building or building ventilation system. it also shall not become nuisance to building occupants or occupants of nearby buildings or to pedestrians

air inlets and exhaust louvers/vents shall be positioned such as to prevent recirculation of air, and separated by distance not less than minimum given in table 5-1 of ashrae 62.12019. air inlets and exhausts shall be located relative to prevailing wind directions, using wind rose diagrams for building. air inlets shall be positioned at upwind or windward direction. exhausts (such as from kitchens, toilets and smoke extract) shall discharge at downwind or leeward direction. intake air shall be drawn into system through sand trap louvers sized for at least 1 m/s across face area of louver, to provide 80% or higher filtration efficiency at coarse sand grain size (355 m to 425 m)

pandemic air quality measures h.4.10.6 recent pandemic has meant that many owners and tenants looking to enhance ventilation solutions to improve air quality and to control airborne diseases and pollutants. research and technologies in this field evolving and later editions of dbc might include specific design requirements. in interim, owners wishing to add filtration and purification systems to control airborne infectious diseases in epidemic/pandemic situations, or to control bacterial pollutants in air, shall consult authorized department in dm for advice and approval of proposed technology

h.4.11 natural ventilation natural ventilation of occupied spaces via windows, doors or other openings permitted but shall not be relied upon to provide ventilation and thermal comfort. operating mechanisms for such openings shall be accessible so that openings readily operable by building occupants. h 25 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.12 mechanical ventilation h.4.12.1 general ventilation system design and selection shall be determined by mechanical design engineer for given application, taking into account all relevant issues associated with building design, usage, configuration and commissioning, operation and maintenance of system. mechanical ventilation shall be provided by method of supply air and return or exhaust air (see figure h.3). amount of supply air shall be approximately equal to amount of return and exhaust air. system shall not be prohibited from producing negative or positive pressure. air handling units shall deliver filtered and conditioned air within building. air handling units shall be american heating and refrigeration institute or eurovent certified

h.4.11 natural ventilation natural ventilation of occupied spaces via windows, doors or other openings permitted but shall not be relied upon to provide ventilation and thermal comfort. operating mechanisms for such openings shall be accessible so that openings readily operable by building occupants. h 25 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.12 mechanical ventilation h.4.12.1 general ventilation system design and selection shall be determined by mechanical design engineer for given application, taking into account all relevant issues associated with building design, usage, configuration and commissioning, operation and maintenance of system. mechanical ventilation shall be provided by method of supply air and return or exhaust air (see figure h.3). amount of supply air shall be approximately equal to amount of return and exhaust air. system shall not be prohibited from producing negative or positive pressure. air handling units shall deliver filtered and conditioned air within building. air handling units shall be american heating and refrigeration institute or eurovent certified

mechanical ventilation installations shall meet requirements given in ch. 16 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1 requires flexible air ducts to be tested and classified in accordance with ansi/ul 181, and only used when air temperature in ducts does not exceed 250 c or as vertical ducts serving not more than two adjacent stories in height. in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1, pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings, vapour retarder facings, adhesives, fasteners, tapes and supplementary materials added to air ducts, plenums, panels, and duct silencers used in duct systems, shall have, in form in which they used, maximum flame spread index of 25 without evidence of continued progressive combustion and maximum smoke developed index of 50 when tested in accordance with astm e84 or ul 723. when fire testing pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings (and their adhesives and tapes), specimen preparation and mounting procedures of astm e2231 shall be followed

ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1 requires flexible air ducts to be tested and classified in accordance with ansi/ul 181, and only used when air temperature in ducts does not exceed 250 c or as vertical ducts serving not more than two adjacent stories in height. in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1, pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings, vapour retarder facings, adhesives, fasteners, tapes and supplementary materials added to air ducts, plenums, panels, and duct silencers used in duct systems, shall have, in form in which they used, maximum flame spread index of 25 without evidence of continued progressive combustion and maximum smoke developed index of 50 when tested in accordance with astm e84 or ul 723. when fire testing pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings (and their adhesives and tapes), specimen preparation and mounting procedures of astm e2231 shall be followed

ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1 requires flexible air ducts to be tested and classified in accordance with ansi/ul 181, and only used when air temperature in ducts does not exceed 250 c or as vertical ducts serving not more than two adjacent stories in height. in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1, pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings, vapour retarder facings, adhesives, fasteners, tapes and supplementary materials added to air ducts, plenums, panels, and duct silencers used in duct systems, shall have, in form in which they used, maximum flame spread index of 25 without evidence of continued progressive combustion and maximum smoke developed index of 50 when tested in accordance with astm e84 or ul 723. when fire testing pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings (and their adhesives and tapes), specimen preparation and mounting procedures of astm e2231 shall be followed
fibrous duct construction shall conform to latest smacna fibrous glass duct construction standards ref. h.21

flexible duct connectors shall not pass through any wall, partition, or enclosure of vertical shaft that required to have fire resistance rating of 1 h or more. flexible duct connectors shall not pass through floors

in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1, ventilation ducts shall not pass through smokeproof enclosures, exit stairs, exit passageways or (unless unavoidable) firefighting lobby. where having ventilation duct within firefighting lobby cannot be avoided, that part of duct that within lobby shall be enclosed in fire-resisting construction at least equal to that of elements of structure
h 27 dubai building code part h indoor environment ducts shall be constructed to allow even distribution of air over entire filter

ductwork shall be effectively sealed to limit air leakage in system. application of duct sealing and air leakage shall meet requirements of ashrae 111 and smacna hvac duct construction standards, depending on specific application

h.4.12.6 ductwork air leakage air ductwork shall be designed, built and installed in such way as to minimize air leakage. following shall be pressure tested prior to occupancy a) ductwork attached to equipment and having external static pressure of more than 250 pa b) ductwork exposed to external ambient conditions or within unconditioned spaces. pressure testing shall be carried out in accordance with authoritys approved methodology to verify that air leakage does not exceed permitted maximum. ductwork leakage testing shall be carried out by company that specialized in commissioning of buildings and approved by authority. plenums h.4.12.4 plenum design shall meet requirements given in ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18 and in table 10.1, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. supply, return, exhaust, relief and ventilation air plenums shall be limited to uninhabited crawl spaces, areas above ceiling or below floor, attic spaces and mechanical equipment rooms. plenums shall be limited to one fire compartment. fuel-fired appliances shall not be installed within plenum. plenum enclosures shall be constructed of non-combustible materials permitted for type of construction classification of building

h.4.12.6 ductwork air leakage air ductwork shall be designed, built and installed in such way as to minimize air leakage. following shall be pressure tested prior to occupancy a) ductwork attached to equipment and having external static pressure of more than 250 pa b) ductwork exposed to external ambient conditions or within unconditioned spaces. pressure testing shall be carried out in accordance with authoritys approved methodology to verify that air leakage does not exceed permitted maximum. ductwork leakage testing shall be carried out by company that specialized in commissioning of buildings and approved by authority. plenums h.4.12.4 plenum design shall meet requirements given in ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18 and in table 10.1, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. supply, return, exhaust, relief and ventilation air plenums shall be limited to uninhabited crawl spaces, areas above ceiling or below floor, attic spaces and mechanical equipment rooms. plenums shall be limited to one fire compartment. fuel-fired appliances shall not be installed within plenum. plenum enclosures shall be constructed of non-combustible materials permitted for type of construction classification of building

h.4.12.6 ductwork air leakage air ductwork shall be designed, built and installed in such way as to minimize air leakage. following shall be pressure tested prior to occupancy a) ductwork attached to equipment and having external static pressure of more than 250 pa b) ductwork exposed to external ambient conditions or within unconditioned spaces. pressure testing shall be carried out in accordance with authoritys approved methodology to verify that air leakage does not exceed permitted maximum. ductwork leakage testing shall be carried out by company that specialized in commissioning of buildings and approved by authority. plenums h.4.12.4 plenum design shall meet requirements given in ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18 and in table 10.1, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. supply, return, exhaust, relief and ventilation air plenums shall be limited to uninhabited crawl spaces, areas above ceiling or below floor, attic spaces and mechanical equipment rooms. plenums shall be limited to one fire compartment. fuel-fired appliances shall not be installed within plenum. plenum enclosures shall be constructed of non-combustible materials permitted for type of construction classification of building

h.4.12.6 ductwork air leakage air ductwork shall be designed, built and installed in such way as to minimize air leakage. following shall be pressure tested prior to occupancy a) ductwork attached to equipment and having external static pressure of more than 250 pa b) ductwork exposed to external ambient conditions or within unconditioned spaces. pressure testing shall be carried out in accordance with authoritys approved methodology to verify that air leakage does not exceed permitted maximum. ductwork leakage testing shall be carried out by company that specialized in commissioning of buildings and approved by authority. plenums h.4.12.4 plenum design shall meet requirements given in ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18 and in table 10.1, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. supply, return, exhaust, relief and ventilation air plenums shall be limited to uninhabited crawl spaces, areas above ceiling or below floor, attic spaces and mechanical equipment rooms. plenums shall be limited to one fire compartment. fuel-fired appliances shall not be installed within plenum. plenum enclosures shall be constructed of non-combustible materials permitted for type of construction classification of building
all materials within plenums shall be non-combustible or as permitted by table 10.1, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1
plenums shall not be used as part of smoke management system

h.4.12.5 air filters hvac systems shall be provided with approved air filters to minimum recommended efficiency reporting value in accordance with ashrae hvac systems and equipment handbook ref. h.22 and in table e-1 of ashrae 52.22017. filters shall also be installed in return air system, upstream from any heat exchanger or cooling coil. media type air filters shall conform to ul 900. high efficiency particulate air filters shall conform to ul 586. electrostatic-type air filters shall conform to ul 867. air filters utilized within dwelling units shall be designed for intended application and not required to be approved

h 28 dubai building code part h indoor environment exhaust ventilation systems h.4.12.7 mechanical exhaust ventilation systems (see figure h.4) shall meet requirements of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18 and ashrae 62.1
h.4.12.8 mechanical ventilation in fire mode hvac systems in building shall be designed to shut down automatically in fire, unless they integral part of smoke management system
h.4.12.8 mechanical ventilation in fire mode hvac systems in building shall be designed to shut down automatically in fire, unless they integral part of smoke management system

air removed by every mechanical exhaust system shall be discharged outdoors at point where it will not cause nuisance and at distances no less than those specified in table 5-1 of ashrae 62.12019. air shall be discharged to location from which it cannot again be readily drawn in by ventilating system. air shall not be exhausted into attic or crawl space

06 07 01 11 10 05 02 08 09 03 04 figure h.4 example mechanical exhaust ventilation system ( crown copyright, 1998. modified figure based on figure 1, good practice guide 257, department of environment, transport and regions (detr). contains public sector information licensed under open government licence v3.0) key 01 exhaust air outlet 02 positively pressurized extract ductwork shall 02 not run within occupied spaces 03 wet or contaminated zone 04 occupied zone 05 supply air through air inlet 06 exhaust air louver 07 relief air damper 08 filter 09 extract fan 10 extract grille 11 control h 29 air duct smoke detectors shall be provided in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. each air distribution system shall be provided with at least one manually operable means for stopping operation of supply, return, and exhaust fan(s) in emergency
means of manual operation shall be located in emergency command centre or in dedicated protected room
fire and smoke dampers h.4.12.9 fire dampers, smoke dampers and/or combined fire and smoke dampers shall be provided as required by ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1

h.4.12.10 smoke control and pressurization systems smoke control and pressurization systems shall be provided when required by section 3, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. design of systems shall be in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1
note roof ventilation systems as required by table 10.26, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1 no longer mandated by dubai civil defence (dcd) for warehouses <900 m in built-up ground floor areas

installation of electrical wiring and equipment associated with smoke control systems shall be in accordance with nfpa 70. dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.12.11 ventilation for vehicle parking areas mechanical ventilation shall be provided to ensure carbon monoxide (co) concentration within enclosed parking areas (see b.7.2.3.2) maintained below 50 ppm. concentration shall be maintained by providing at least six outside air changes per hour, or by installing variable air volume ventilation system that controlled by input response from co monitoring equipment

co monitoring equipment shall be installed, with at least one co sensor per 400 m2 floor area of parking. audible alarm shall be triggered when co concentration reaches or exceeds 75 ppm in at least 5% of monitored locations
outdoor air shall be provided for each parking level

occupied areas, such as offices, shopping centres, hotels, elevator lobbies, waiting rooms and ticket booths connected to enclosed parking space, shall be supplied with conditioned air under positive pressure when compared with adjoining parking area
for smoke clearance purposes, ventilation systems shall be capable of providing ten air changes per hour and shall meet requirements of section 3.5, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1
where building management system (bms) installed, co concentration shall be monitored to allow real time profiling and management of air quality
co monitoring equipment shall be checked and recalibrated every 6 months or according to manufacturer specification by specialized calibration company, certified by authority
natural ventilation of vehicle parking areas shall conform to b.7.2.3.2 and nfpa 88a
note definition of open parking in nfpa 88a exceeds current requirements of uae flsc ref. h.1, but dcd refers to nfpa 88a as it supersedes edition referenced in uae flsc ref. h.1
h.4.12.12 motors and fans motors and fans shall be sized to provide required air movement and shall conform to ch. 21 and ch. 45 of ashrae hvac systems and equipment handbook ref. h.22
motors in areas that contain flammable vapours or dusts shall be of type approved for such environments
manually operated remote control, installed at approved location, shall be provided to shut off fans or blowers in flammable vapour or dust systems

electrical equipment and appliances used in operations that generate explosive or flammable vapours, fumes or dusts shall be interlocked with ventilation system so that equipment and appliances cannot be operated unless ventilation fans in operation

motors for fans used to convey flammable vapours or dusts shall be located outside duct or shall be protected with approved shields and dustproofing. motors and fans shall be provided with means of access for servicing and maintenance

parts of fans in contact with explosive or flammable vapours, fumes or dusts shall be of non-ferrous or non-sparking materials, or their casing shall be lined or constructed of such material. when size and hardness of materials passing through fan can produce spark, both fan and casing shall be of non-sparking materials. when fans required to be spark resistant, their bearings shall not be within airstream, and all parts of fan shall be grounded. fans in systems handling materials that can clog blades, and fans in buffing or woodworking exhaust systems, shall be of radial-blade or tube-axial type
fans located in systems conveying corrosives shall be of materials that resistant to corrosive or shall be coated with corrosion resistant materials

h 30 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.12.13 clothes dryer exhausts dryer exhaust systems shall be independent of all other systems and shall convey moisture, and any products of combustion, to outside of building. clothes dryer exhaust ducts shall be fire rated, and fire-resistance rating shall be maintained in accordance with table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. h.1. fire dampers, combination fire/smoke dampers and any similar devices that will obstruct exhaust flow shall not be used in clothes dryer exhaust ducts. each vertical riser shall be provided with means for cleanout. screens shall not be installed at exhaust termination

h.4.12.14 domestic kitchen exhaust equipment where domestic range hoods and domestic appliances equipped with downdraft exhaust located within dwelling units, such hoods and appliances shall discharge to exterior through sheet metal ducts constructed of galvanized steel, stainless steel, aluminium or copper. such ducts shall have smooth inner walls and shall be airtight and equipped with backdraft damper
where installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and where mechanical ventilation otherwise provided, ductless range hoods not required to discharge to outdoors

h.4.12.15 commercial kitchens h.4.12.15.1 kitchen hood ventilation systems commercial kitchen hood ventilation systems shall be designed for type of cooking appliance and hood served. design shall follow requirements of ashrae hvac applications and fundamentals handbooks ref. h.17, ref. h.18 section 2.18, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1 and dw/172

fire dampers, combination fire/smoke dampers and any similar devices that will obstruct exhaust flow shall not be incorporated in kitchen hood ventilation systems. exhaust duct systems shall not have openings other than as required for correct operation and maintenance of system. any section of duct system that cannot be accessed from duct entry or discharge shall be provided with cleanout openings. cleanout openings shall be equipped with tight-fitting doors constructed of steel having thickness not less than that required for duct
exhaust equipment, including fans shall be of approved design for application. exhaust fan motors shall be located outside of exhaust airstream
exhaust fans shall be positioned so that discharge will not have impact on roof, other equipment or appliances or parts of structure

h 31 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.12.15.2 commercial kitchen hoods commercial kitchen exhaust hoods shall be installed and maintained in accordance with ashrae hvac applications, fundamentals and hvac systems and equipment handbooks ref. h.17, ref. h.18 and ref. h.22 section 2.18, ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1 and dw/172. exhaust hoods shall be type or ii and shall be designed to capture and confine cooking vapours and residues. type hoods shall be installed where cooking appliances produce grease or smoke. type ii hoods shall be installed above dishwashers and light-duty appliances that produce heat or moisture and do not produce grease or smoke. type hoods shall be equipped with listed grease filters designed for specific purpose

h.4.12.15.3 commercial kitchen make-up air total replacement air flow rate for commercial kitchen ventilation system shall be equal to total kitchen exhaust air flow rate plus net exfiltration. it permissible to supply replacement air to kitchen space by using transfer air from areas other than kitchen. every kitchen shall be slightly negatively pressurized (e.g. 0.25 pa) to adjacent rooms or immediately surrounding areas, to help contain odours in kitchen and to prevent odour migration out of kitchen. dedicated mechanical make-up air system shall provide not less than 75% and not more than 95% of total extracted air volume, with remaining infiltrating naturally into kitchen from surrounding areas
building housing kitchen shall be slightly positively pressurized (+1.25 pa to +5.0 pa maximum) compared to atmosphere, to prevent infiltration of outdoor air
note example of restaurant and kitchen air balancing shown in figure h.5

01 02 03 04 05 09 15 14 07 08 16 06 11 12 13 figure h.5 example of restaurant and kitchen air balancing 10 key 01 kitchen exhaust (3,000 l/s) 02 dedicated outdoor air 03 outdoor air (2,400 l/s) 04 roof terminal unit 05 outdoor air (1,000 l/s) 06 toilet exhaust 07 kitchen exhaust (3,000 l/s) 08 supply air (2,400 l/s) 09 supply air (3,300 l/s) 10 return air (2,300 l/s) 11 toilet exhaust (250 l/s) 12 transfer air (250 l/s) 13 exfiltration (150 l/s) 14 kitchen (negatively pressurised) 15 transfer air (600 l/s) 16 dining area (positively pressurised) h 32 dubai building code part h indoor environment commercial kitchen replacement air design shall conform to sections 6.2, 6.3 and 7 of ashrae 1542016, and to dw/172

make-up air shall not reduce effectiveness of exhaust system. make-up air shall be provided by gravity or mechanical means or both. mechanical make-up air systems shall be automatically controlled to start and operate simultaneously with exhaust system

exhaust system shall discharge to outside of building either directly by flue or indirectly through bin or vault into which system discharges except where contaminants have removed. exhaust system discharge may be recirculated provided that all of following criteria met a) solid particulate has removed at efficiency of not less than 99.9% at 10 m (0.01 mm) temperature differential between make-up air and air in conditioned space shall not exceed 6 c

b) vapour concentrations less than 25% of lower flammable limit and c) approved equipment used to monitor vapour concentration. outlet of open-air exhaust terminal shall be protected with approved metal or other non-combustible screen to prevent entry of sparks
safety or explosion relief vent shall be provided on all systems that convey combustible refuse or stock of explosive nature

h.4.12.17 combustion air solid fuel-burning appliances shall be provided with combustion air in accordance with appliance manufacturers installation instructions. oil-fired appliances shall be provided with combustion air in accordance with nfpa 31

combustion and dilution air for gas-fired appliances (other than fireplace stoves and direct-vent appliances) shall be in accordance with requirements given in ch. 7 of ashrae hvac systems and equipment handbook ref. h.22 and in nfpa 54

h.4.12.16 dust, stock and refuse conveying systems collectors and separators involving such systems as centrifugal separators, bag filter systems and similar devices, and associated supports shall be constructed of non-combustible materials and shall be located on exterior of building or structure. collector or separator shall not be located within 3 of combustible construction or unprotected wall or floor opening, unless collector provided with metal vent pipe that extends 9.1 above highest part of any roof

collectors such as point of use collectors, close extraction weld fume collectors, spray finishing booths, stationary grinding tables, sanding booths, and integrated or machine-mounted collectors may be installed indoors provided that installation in accordance with applicable nfpa standards. these standards include, but not limited to, nfpa 33, nfpa 61, nfpa 69, nfpa 70, nfpa 91, nfpa 499, and nfpa 654

collectors such as point of use collectors, close extraction weld fume collectors, spray finishing booths, stationary grinding tables, sanding booths, and integrated or machine-mounted collectors may be installed indoors provided that installation in accordance with applicable nfpa standards. these standards include, but not limited to, nfpa 33, nfpa 61, nfpa 69, nfpa 70, nfpa 91, nfpa 499, and nfpa 654
collectors in independent exhaust systems handling combustible dusts may be installed indoors provided that such collectors installed in compliance with applicable nfpa standards mentioned above
delivery pipe from cyclone collector shall not convey refuse directly into firebox of boiler, furnace, dutch oven, refuse burner, incinerator or other appliance

h 33 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.12.18 chimneys and vents h.4.12.18.1 general every fuel burning appliance shall discharge products of combustion to vent, factory-built chimney or masonry chimney. chimney or vent shall be designed for type of appliance being vented
h.4.12.18.3 connectors connectors shall be used to connect appliances to vertical chimney or vent, except where chimney or vent attached directly to appliance
connectors shall be located entirely within room in which connecting appliance located
oil-fired appliances shall be vented in accordance with nfpa 31. gas-fired appliances shall be vented in accordance with nfpa 54
venting systems shall be designed and constructed to develop positive flow adequate to convey all combustion products to outside atmosphere
h.4.12.18.2 vents all vent systems shall be approved by authority. vents shall be tested in accordance with ul 641

vent systems shall be sized, installed and terminated in accordance with vent and appliance manufacturers installation instructions. vents shall terminate with approved cap in accordance with vent manufacturers installation instructions
double wall vents shall terminate not less than 610 mm above highest point of roof penetration and not less than 610 mm higher than any portion of building within 3,050 mm
venting systems of direct-vent appliances shall be installed in accordance with appliance and vent manufacturers instructions
support of all portions of vents shall be sufficient for design and weight of materials employed

where vents pass through insulated assemblies, insulation shield shall be installed to provide clearance between vent and insulation material. connector shall not be smaller than size of flue collar supplied by manufacturer of appliance. where appliance has more than one flue outlet, and in absence of specific instructions from manufacturer, connector area shall be not less than combined area of flue outlets for which it acts as common connector

h.4.12.18.4 factory-built chimneys factory-built chimneys shall be approved by authority and shall be installed and terminated in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions. chimneys for use with open combustion chamber appliances installed in buildings other than dwelling units shall meet requirements of ul 103 and shall be marked building heating appliance chimney
h.4.12.18.5 metal chimneys metal chimneys shall be constructed and installed in accordance with nfpa 211

h.4.12.19 explosion control buildings with potential explosion hazards shall be provided with ventilation for explosion control as required by ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. explosion control systems shall be designed and installed in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. h.1. h 34 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.13 hydronic systems h.4.13.1 general this section applies to hydronic piping systems that part of hvac systems. they include steam, hot water, chilled water, steam condensate and ground source heat pump loop systems
design and installation of hydronic systems shall meet requirements of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

h.4.13.2 materials pipe material and associated pipeline equipment and fittings shall have appropriate temperature and pressure rating for system in which it operating. they shall be suitable for fluid or gas conveyed
hydronic pipe material shall conform to relevant astm standards (see ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18)

h.4.13.3 pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. pipe joints and connections h.4.13.4 valves shut-off valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch.22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

h.4.13.3 pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. pipe joints and connections h.4.13.4 valves shut-off valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch.22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

h.4.13.3 pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. pipe joints and connections h.4.13.4 valves shut-off valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch.22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

h.4.13.3 pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. pipe joints and connections h.4.13.4 valves shut-off valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch.22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18
pipe installation h.4.13.5 pipes, valves, fittings and connections shall be installed in accordance with conditions of approval
pipe installation h.4.13.5 pipes, valves, fittings and connections shall be installed in accordance with conditions of approval
pipe installation h.4.13.5 pipes, valves, fittings and connections shall be installed in accordance with conditions of approval
hydronic piping systems shall be designed and installed to permit system to be drained

openings for pipe penetrations in walls, floors or ceilings shall be larger than penetrating pipe. openings through concrete or masonry building elements shall be sleeved. annular space surrounding pipe penetrations within fire rated walls or floors shall be protected in accordance with section 3, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. h.1
hydronic piping system shall not be in direct contact with building materials that cause piping material to degrade or corrode, or that interfere with operation of system

piping shall be installed to prevent detrimental strains and stresses in pipe. provisions shall be made to protect piping from damage resulting from expansion, contraction and structural settlement. piping shall be installed to avoid structural stresses or strains within building components
pipe shall be supported in accordance with ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

flash point of transfer fluid in hydronic piping system shall be not less than 28 c above maximum system operating temperature. transfer fluid shall be compatible with make-up water supplied to system. note further guidance given in ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18
h 35 dubai building code part h indoor environment pipe design h.4.13.6 hydronic piping design and sizing shall follow guidelines within ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

pumped hydronic systems h.4.13.7 hydronic cooling or heating systems shall include pressure independent two-way control valves. for heating and chilled water services following design criteria shall be applied

pumped hydronic systems h.4.13.7 hydronic cooling or heating systems shall include pressure independent two-way control valves. for heating and chilled water services following design criteria shall be applied

pumped hydronic systems h.4.13.7 hydronic cooling or heating systems shall include pressure independent two-way control valves. for heating and chilled water services following design criteria shall be applied
expansion tanks and air separators shall be sized correctly. a) pressure drop shall not exceed 250 pa/m for all pipe sizes
b) maximum pipe velocity shall not exceed 1.2 m/s for pipe sizes of 50 mm and smaller, and 2.5 m/s for pipe sizes of 65 mm and larger
c) minimum pipe velocity shall be not less than 0.45 m/s

pump motors and pump seal cooling shall be designed for variable speed operation range of 15 to 50 hz (300 rpm to 1,450 rpm). pumps shall be selected to handle 105% of design flow to allow for possible flow increases in presence of low delta-t condition
above criteria shall be reviewed against ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18 based on particular installation and anticipated operating hours

mechanical efficiency of pump shall be not less than 85%. electric efficiency of pump motor shall be not less than 95%. piping to be embedded in concrete shall be pressure tested prior to pouring concrete

variable speed drive efficiency shall be not less than during pouring, pipe shall be maintained at proposed operating pressure. joints of pipe or tubing that embedded in portion of building, such as concrete or plaster, shall meet following requirements
a) 97% at 50 hz (1,450 rpm) b) 95% at 35 hz (1,000 rpm) c) 90% at 25 hz (725 rpm) and 1) steel pipe shall be welded by electrical arc or oxygen/acetylene method
d) 85% at 15 hz (300 rpm)
2) copper tubing shall be joined by brazing with filler metals having melting point of not less than 538 c
3) polybutylene pipe and tubing shall be installed in continuous lengths or shall be joined by heat fusion

pressure vessels h.4.13.8 all pressure vessels shall be in accordance with asme boiler and pressure vessel code ref. h.23. they shall bear label of approved agency and shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions

h 36 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.13.9 boilers h.4.13.9.1 general oil-fired boilers and their control systems shall be in accordance with ul 726. electric boilers and their control systems shall be listed and labelled in accordance with ul 834. boilers shall be designed and constructed and installed in accordance with requirements of asme csd-1 and, as applicable, sections or iv of asme boiler and pressure vessel code ref. h.23, or nfpa 85

boilers shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers instructions. operating instructions shall be permanently attached to boiler, to avoid misplacement. boilers shall have all controls set, adjusted and tested by installer. manufacturers rating data and nameplate shall be attached to boiler
boilers shall be mounted on floors of non-combustible construction

hot water and steam boilers shall have all operating and safety controls set and operationally tested by installing contractor. complete control diagram and boiler operating instructions shall be provided by installer for each installation

h.4.13.9.2 boiler connections every boiler or modular boiler shall have shut-off valve in supply and return piping. for multiple boiler or multiple modular boiler installations, each boiler or modular boiler shall have individual shut-off valves in supply and return piping

h.4.13.9.2 boiler connections every boiler or modular boiler shall have shut-off valve in supply and return piping. for multiple boiler or multiple modular boiler installations, each boiler or modular boiler shall have individual shut-off valves in supply and return piping
h.4.13.9.3 safety and pressure relief valves and controls all steam boilers shall be protected with safety valve. hot water boilers shall be protected with safety relief valve
h.4.13.9.3 safety and pressure relief valves and controls all steam boilers shall be protected with safety valve. hot water boilers shall be protected with safety relief valve
all pressure vessels shall be protected with pressure relief valve or pressure-limiting device as required by manufacturers installation instructions for pressure vessel

safety and safety relief valves shall be approved by authority and shall have minimum rated capacity for equipment or appliances served. safety and safety relief valves shall be set at maximum of nameplate pressure rating of boiler or pressure vessel
h.4.13.9.4 boiler low-water cut-off all steam and hot water boilers shall be protected with low-water cut-off control
low-water cut-off shall automatically stop combustion operation of appliance when water drops below lowest safe water level as established by manufacturer

h.4.13.9.5 steam boiler blow-off every steam boiler shall be equipped with quick-opening blow-off valve. valve shall be installed in opening provided on boiler. size of valve shall be either as specified by boiler manufacturer or determined by size of valve opening

h.4.13.9.6 hot water boiler expansion tank expansion tank shall be installed in every hot water system. for multiple boiler installations, at least one expansion tank shall be provided. expansion tanks shall be of closed or open type. tanks shall be rated for pressure of hot water system

h 37 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.13.9.7 gauges every hot water boiler shall have pressure gauge and temperature gauge, or combination pressure and temperature gauge. gauges shall indicate temperature and pressure within normal range of systems operation

h.4.13.9.8 testing hydronic piping systems, other than ground source heat pump loop systems, shall be tested hydrostatically at one and half times maximum system design pressure, but not less than 689 kpa (100 psi). duration of each test shall be not less than 15 min. ground source heat pump loop systems shall be tested before connection (header) trenches backfilled. assembled loop system shall be pressure tested with water at 689 kpa (100 psi) for 30 min with no observed leaks. flow and pressure loss testing shall be performed, and actual flow rates and pressure drops shall be compared to calculated design values. if actual flowrate or pressure drop values differ from calculated design values by more than 10%, problem shall be identified and corrected. upon completion of assembly and installation of boilers and pressure vessels, acceptance tests shall be conducted in accordance with asme boiler and pressure vessel code ref. h.23. h.4.13.9.9 flushing, cleaning and water treatment before system operated, all water piping shall be flushed, chemically cleaned and treated following guidelines in ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. h.17

h.4.13.9.8 testing hydronic piping systems, other than ground source heat pump loop systems, shall be tested hydrostatically at one and half times maximum system design pressure, but not less than 689 kpa (100 psi). duration of each test shall be not less than 15 min. ground source heat pump loop systems shall be tested before connection (header) trenches backfilled. assembled loop system shall be pressure tested with water at 689 kpa (100 psi) for 30 min with no observed leaks. flow and pressure loss testing shall be performed, and actual flow rates and pressure drops shall be compared to calculated design values. if actual flowrate or pressure drop values differ from calculated design values by more than 10%, problem shall be identified and corrected. upon completion of assembly and installation of boilers and pressure vessels, acceptance tests shall be conducted in accordance with asme boiler and pressure vessel code ref. h.23. h.4.13.9.9 flushing, cleaning and water treatment before system operated, all water piping shall be flushed, chemically cleaned and treated following guidelines in ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. h.17

h.4.13.10 refrigeration h.4.13.10.1 general design, construction and installation of refrigeration systems shall meet requirements of ashrae refrigeration handbook ref. h.24 and ashrae 15, including a) system requirements b) refrigerant types and classifications c) system application requirements d) machinery room requirements e) refrigerant piping installation and materials and f) testing

h.4.13.10.2 refrigerant and ozone depletion management refrigerants with zero ozone depletion potential or with global warming potential less than 100 shall be used, unless equipment contains less than 0.23 kg of refrigerant. h 38 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.14 hvac systems controls and metering controls for hvac systems h.4.14.1 hvac systems shall be equipped with efficient controls to reduce energy consumption, in accordance with ashrae 90.1. control systems shall meet following requirements

a) control systems shall be divided into sub-zones with independent controls for each building zones. controls for each sub-zone may vary based on zones exposure to sun or cooling load levels or by nature of usage. b) all independent control areas shall be able to 1) control temperature and 2) turn off systems when building or controlled part of building not occupied. c) central systems shall operate only when required by zonal control systems. h.4.14.2 building management system (bms) buildings having cooling load of 1,000 kw, or gross area of 5,000 m2 or greater, shall have bms capable of ensuring that buildings systems operate as designed and as required during all operating conditions. system shall provide full control and monitoring of system operations, apart from diagnostic reporting. system shall control chiller plant and hvac equipment as minimum, and record energy and water consumption. it shall also monitor and record performance of these items. h.4.14.3 h.4.14.3 control systems for hotel rooms hotel guest rooms shall incorporate automatic control systems that can turn off lighting, air-conditioning and power when room not occupied. each guest room should also incorporate automatic control system that can turn off air-conditioning when balcony door or window kept open. outdoor air ventilation shall be provided so that rooms can be kept well-ventilated and under positive pressure during unoccupied periods. ventilation shall be demand-controlled and capable of being activated by occupancy sensor or light switch. it shall be electrically interlocked

h.4.14.4 air-conditioning metering in buildings supplied by central air-conditioning source (such as chiller plant or district cooling), or where cooling energy delivered individually to several consumers, smart meters approved by authority shall be installed to measure and record chilled water supply to air-conditioning units. meters shall provide accurate records of consumption, which shall be determined as follows

h.4.14.4 air-conditioning metering in buildings supplied by central air-conditioning source (such as chiller plant or district cooling), or where cooling energy delivered individually to several consumers, smart meters approved by authority shall be installed to measure and record chilled water supply to air-conditioning units. meters shall provide accurate records of consumption, which shall be determined as follows

a) smart energy meters designed to measure supply of chilled water shall be installed for each dwelling unit, office or tenant. measuring device shall measure water flow and supply and return temperatures to determine temperature differential for calculating amount of cooling energy consumed
b) where bms installed, smart metering shall be connected to allow real time profiling and management of energy consumption
c) smart meters used shall be specifically designed for measurement of chilled bms systems shall be configured to optimize energy usage
water and not for hot water
d) all smart meters shall be capable of remote data access and shall have data logging capability
e) virtual meters using run-hours not acceptable as sub-meters

meter readings and actual consumption details shall only be for energy measurement, demand management and cost allocation purposes. h 39 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.15 fuel oil piping and storage h.4.15.1 general design and installation of fuel oil piping systems, and storage of fuel oil, shall be in accordance with ch. 13 of uae flsc ref. h.1, ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18, and nfpa 31

h.4.15.2 materials piping materials shall conform to following standards a) brass pipe astm b43 b) brass tubing astm b135 c) copper or copper-alloy pipe astm b42, astm b302 d) copper or copper-alloy tubing (type k, l or m) astm b75, astm b88, astm b280 e) non-metallic pipe astm d2996 f) steel pipe astm a53, astm a106 and g) steel tubing astm a254, astm a539
piping materials shall be rated for operating temperatures and pressures of system. they shall be compatible with type of liquid to be conveyed in pipes
h.4.15.3 joints and connections shall be of type approved for fuel oil piping systems
h.4.15.3 joints and connections shall be of type approved for fuel oil piping systems

joints and connections allowance shall be made for expansion, contraction, jarring and vibration. piping other than tubing, connected to underground tanks, except straight fill lines and test wells, shall be provided with flexible connectors, or otherwise arranged to permit tanks to settle without impairing tightness of piping connections

joints and connections allowance shall be made for expansion, contraction, jarring and vibration. piping other than tubing, connected to underground tanks, except straight fill lines and test wells, shall be provided with flexible connectors, or otherwise arranged to permit tanks to settle without impairing tightness of piping connections

joints and connections allowance shall be made for expansion, contraction, jarring and vibration. piping other than tubing, connected to underground tanks, except straight fill lines and test wells, shall be provided with flexible connectors, or otherwise arranged to permit tanks to settle without impairing tightness of piping connections

piping support h.4.15.4 pipe hangers and supports shall have sufficient strength to withstand all anticipated static and specified dynamic loading conditions associated with intended use. pipe hangers and supports that in direct contact with piping shall be of approved materials that compatible with piping and that will not promote galvanic action

piping support h.4.15.4 pipe hangers and supports shall have sufficient strength to withstand all anticipated static and specified dynamic loading conditions associated with intended use. pipe hangers and supports that in direct contact with piping shall be of approved materials that compatible with piping and that will not promote galvanic action
hangers and anchors shall be attached to building construction in approved manner. spacing between piping supports shall be not less than minimum specified in ansi mss sp-69

h 40 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.4.16 specific appliances and equipment h.4.16.1 gas-fired appliances gas-fired appliances shall be approved, designed, installed and constructed in accordance with nfpa 54 and ch.11 in uae flsc ref. h.1

fireplace stoves and room heaters h.4.16.2 stoves and solid fuel-type room heaters shall be approved by authority. they shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions. fireplace stoves shall be tested in accordance with ul 737. solid fuel-type room heaters shall be tested in accordance with ul 1482. fireplace inserts shall be approved by authority in accordance with ul 1482. they shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions

headings: cooling towers, evaporative condensers and fluid coolers
Description: cooling towers, evaporative condensers and fluid coolers h.4.16.3 cooling tower used in conjunction with air-conditioning appliance shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and requirements given in ch. 40 of ashrae hvac systems and equipment handbook ref. h.22

headings: cooling towers, evaporative condensers and fluid coolers
Description: cooling towers, evaporative condensers and fluid coolers shall be located such as to prevent discharge vapour plumes from entering occupied spaces. they shall be readily accessible for maintenance and repair. plume discharges shall be not less than 1.5 above or 6.1 away from any ventilation inlet to building

separation distance between cooling tower exhaust and external ventilation air intakes or other building openings shall be in accordance with ashrae 62.12019. minimum separation distance shall be calculated based on wind direction and location of outdoor air intake as described in clause 5.5.1(b) and appendix b b1.2, b1.3 and b2.2 of ashrae 62.12019

cooling towers shall be selected to achieve minimum energy performance requirements given in ashrae 90.1. all cooling towers shall be cooling technology institute certified and shall be selected at 32.0 c wet-bulb temperature and cooling tower approach between 2 c to 3 c

infrared radiant heaters h.4.16.4 infrared radiant heaters shall be fixed in position that free of fuel and electric supply lines. heaters shall be installed with clearances from combustible material in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18
sauna heaters h.4.16.5 sauna heaters shall be installed in accordance with ul 875 and manufacturers installation instructions

headings: engine and gas turbine-powered equipment and appliances
Description: engine and gas turbine-powered equipment and appliances h.4.16.6 installation of liquid-fuelled stationary internal combustion engines and gas turbines, including exhaust, fuel storage and piping, shall meet requirements of nfpa 37. stationary engine generator assemblies shall meet requirements of ul 2200

permanently installed equipment and appliances powered by internal combustion engines and turbines shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and nfpa 37. h 41 dubai building code part h indoor environment pool and spa heaters h.4.16.7 pool and spa heaters shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions
oil-fired pool and spa heaters shall be tested in accordance with ul 726. electric pool and spa heaters shall be tested in accordance with ul 1261

cooking appliances h.4.16.8 cooking appliances that designed for permanent installation (including ranges, ovens, stoves, broilers, grills, fryers, griddles and barbecues) shall be approved by authority and relevant ul code, and installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions. note further guidance given in ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18
h.4.16.9 installation of conversion burners shall conform to ansi z21.8

conversion burners h.4.16.10 unit heaters unit heaters shall be installed in accordance with listing and manufacturers installation instructions. oil-fired unit heaters shall be tested in accordance with ul 731

suspended-type unit heaters shall be supported by elements that designed and constructed to accommodate weight and dynamic loads. hangers and brackets shall be of non-combustible material. suspended-type oil-fired unit heaters shall be installed in accordance with nfpa 31. h.4.16.11 stationary fuel cell power systems stationary fuel cell power systems having power output not exceeding 10 mw shall be tested in accordance with ansi/csa fc 1 and installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and nfpa 853
central battery systems for emergency lighting shall also conform to ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1

h.4.16.12 gaseous hydrogen systems installation of gaseous hydrogen systems shall be in accordance with applicable requirements of nfpa 2. h.4.16.13 radiant heating systems electric radiant heating systems selection shall be approved by authority and shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers instructions and ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18

clearances for radiant heating panels to any wiring, outlet boxes and junction boxes used for installing electrical devices or mounting luminaires shall be in accordance with nfpa 70. h.4.16.14 evaporative cooling equipment evaporative cooling equipment shall be installed in accordance with manufacturers instructions and ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18. h.4.16.15 high volume large diameter fans high volume large diameter fan selection shall meet requirements of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. h.18. fans shall be tested in accordance with ansi/amca 230, labelled in accordance with ul 507 and installed in accordance with manufacturers instructions
h 42 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5 water supplies h.5.1 general this section covers all occupancies except healthcare and low-rise residential dwellings (see part k)
requirements for healthcare buildings, and all relevant codes and standards, identified in dha regulations ref. h.2 to ref. h.11 and dha health facility guidelines ref. h.12 to ref. h.16
requirements for healthcare buildings, and all relevant codes and standards, identified in dha regulations ref. h.2 to ref. h.11 and dha health facility guidelines ref. h.12 to ref. h.16
this section sets out minimum requirements and basis of design for water services systems within building. it also includes minimum sustainability criteria

for systems or applications not covered by this section, requirements and recommendations in following documents shall be met a) bs en 806 b) bs en 8558 c) hse approved code of practice l8 ref. h.25 and associated technical guidance documents ref. h.26 to ref. h.28 d) hsg272 ref. h.29 and hsg220 ref. h.30 and e) water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. h.31. h.5.2 water conservation and reuse h.5.2.1 compliance methods there two compliance routes for water use. a) elemental method all buildings shall conform to h.5.2.2. b) performance method calculation method may be employed for building which might not meet elemental requirements for water-efficient fixtures detailed in h.5.2.2. performance method shall use supporting calculations to compare annual water consumption of proposed building with that of reference building which meets elemental requirements of h.5.2.2. reference building shall be equal in shape, size and operational patterns to proposed building. compliance will be demonstrated if calculated annual water consumption of proposed building equal to or lower than annual water consumption of reference building. h.5.2.2 water-efficient fittings following water-efficient fittings shall be used a) fixtures with flow rate less than or equal to flow rates shown in table h.5 b) dual flush toilets c) automatic (proximity detection) or push-button faucets in all public facilities d) cisterns serving single or multiple urinals in public, commercial and industrial buildings with manual or automatic flush controls that operate based on usage patterns. only sanitary flushing shall be possible in event of building closure or shutdown (including overnight). faucets installed for specialized application may be exempted from meeting flow rates, subject to authority approval

h 43 dubai building code part h indoor environment fixture type showerheads hand washbasins kitchen sinks dual flush toilets urinal table h.5 maximum flow rate maximum flow rate 8 l/min 6 l/min 7 l/min 6 l full flush 3 l part flush 2.4 l in non-public facilities 1 l per flush or waterless in public facilities condensate drainage h.5.2.3 condensate water produced by air-conditioning equipment shall be collected and disposed of appropriately. condensate collection pans and drainage pipes shall be installed to provide proper drainage and to prevent any stagnant water. air break of not less than 25 mm shall be provided between condensate piping and wastewater pipe. if condensate water not reused, it shall be discharged into wastewater system through properly sized water trap. condensate reuse h.5.2.4 where cooling load greater than 350 kw, condensate water shall be recovered and reused from all of following a) air-conditioning equipment b) air handling units and c) equipment handling mixture of return air and outside air, where outside air not preconditioned

h 43 dubai building code part h indoor environment fixture type showerheads hand washbasins kitchen sinks dual flush toilets urinal table h.5 maximum flow rate maximum flow rate 8 l/min 6 l/min 7 l/min 6 l full flush 3 l part flush 2.4 l in non-public facilities 1 l per flush or waterless in public facilities condensate drainage h.5.2.3 condensate water produced by air-conditioning equipment shall be collected and disposed of appropriately. condensate collection pans and drainage pipes shall be installed to provide proper drainage and to prevent any stagnant water. air break of not less than 25 mm shall be provided between condensate piping and wastewater pipe. if condensate water not reused, it shall be discharged into wastewater system through properly sized water trap. condensate reuse h.5.2.4 where cooling load greater than 350 kw, condensate water shall be recovered and reused from all of following a) air-conditioning equipment b) air handling units and c) equipment handling mixture of return air and outside air, where outside air not preconditioned

note condensate water can be reused for irrigation, toilet flushing, or other on-site purposes where it will not come into direct contact with human body. condensate water can also be reused for heat recovery (see h.4.8.2)

h 44 h.5.2.5 water-efficient irrigation exterior landscaping (including green roofs) shall be irrigated using non-potable water (see h.5.4.6 for irrigation system examples), or by drip or subsoil water delivery systems. all irrigation systems shall incorporate backflow prevention devices if they connected to potable water source in any location. backflow prevention devices shall be installed in line with manufacturers requirements. h.5.2.6 water metering h.5.2.6.1 main meters dubai electricity and water authority (dewa) main meters shall be installed to measure and record water demand and consumption of building in accordance with g.9

h 44 h.5.2.5 water-efficient irrigation exterior landscaping (including green roofs) shall be irrigated using non-potable water (see h.5.4.6 for irrigation system examples), or by drip or subsoil water delivery systems. all irrigation systems shall incorporate backflow prevention devices if they connected to potable water source in any location. backflow prevention devices shall be installed in line with manufacturers requirements. h.5.2.6 water metering h.5.2.6.1 main meters dubai electricity and water authority (dewa) main meters shall be installed to measure and record water demand and consumption of building in accordance with g.9

h 44 h.5.2.5 water-efficient irrigation exterior landscaping (including green roofs) shall be irrigated using non-potable water (see h.5.4.6 for irrigation system examples), or by drip or subsoil water delivery systems. all irrigation systems shall incorporate backflow prevention devices if they connected to potable water source in any location. backflow prevention devices shall be installed in line with manufacturers requirements. h.5.2.6 water metering h.5.2.6.1 main meters dubai electricity and water authority (dewa) main meters shall be installed to measure and record water demand and consumption of building in accordance with g.9
h.5.2.6.2 sub-meters each individual tenancy in building shall have dewa sub-meter installed which connected to building main meter

sub-meters shall also be installed to record consumption data for internal and external (e.g. irrigation) water uses, for buildings having a) cooling load of 1 mw or greater and/or b) gross area of 5,000 m2 or greater
where bms installed, metering shall be integrated into system to allow real- time profiling and management of water demand and consumption
virtual meters using run-hours shall not be used as sub-meters
sub-meters should be used for demand management and cost allocation purposes

dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.2.7 wastewater reuse if system installed for collection and reuse of greywater produced within building, or for use of treated sewage effluent (tse) from external source, following requirements shall be met. a) building shall be dual-plumbed for collection and recycled use of greywater. any pipes which transport greywater shall be colour-coded differently from pipes that used for potable water and be labelled not suitable for drinking. b) there shall be air break of not less than 25 mm between any potable water sources and greywater collection systems. c) greywater shall not be used for purposes where it will come into direct contact with human body. it shall be treated to standard required by authority. commercial car washing facilities shall recover and reuse at least 50% of their wastewater

all wastewater reuse systems shall incorporate sampling points to enable water quality testing to be undertaken. h.5.2.8 potable water supplied by dewa shall not be used for heat rejection purposes. cooling tower water supply where cooling towers used, treated sewage effluent (tse), seawater or recycled water shall be used to meet water demand for all heat rejection purposes. secondary water sources shall be approved by dewa. separate totalising meter shall be fitted on water supply line to individual cooling towers. daily log of water use shall also be kept. water treatment plant will be required to remove impurities from cooling tower feed water and circulatory water. leaving cooling tower water untreated can lead to organic growth, fouling, and corrosion of system. this reduces efficiency and service life of cooling tower plant. type of water treatment system required depends on number of factors including a) type of cooling tower b) quality of water feed required c) cooling tower manufacturers requirements d) chemistry of make-up and circulation water e) whether or not blowdown will be treated for reuse in cooling tower and f) type of heat exchanger

all wastewater reuse systems shall incorporate sampling points to enable water quality testing to be undertaken. h.5.2.8 potable water supplied by dewa shall not be used for heat rejection purposes. cooling tower water supply where cooling towers used, treated sewage effluent (tse), seawater or recycled water shall be used to meet water demand for all heat rejection purposes. secondary water sources shall be approved by dewa. separate totalising meter shall be fitted on water supply line to individual cooling towers. daily log of water use shall also be kept. water treatment plant will be required to remove impurities from cooling tower feed water and circulatory water. leaving cooling tower water untreated can lead to organic growth, fouling, and corrosion of system. this reduces efficiency and service life of cooling tower plant. type of water treatment system required depends on number of factors including a) type of cooling tower b) quality of water feed required c) cooling tower manufacturers requirements d) chemistry of make-up and circulation water e) whether or not blowdown will be treated for reuse in cooling tower and f) type of heat exchanger

typically, water treatment systems shall include filtration and ultrafiltration, ion exchange/softening, chemical addition of inhibitors and biocides and automated monitoring system. water treatment system shall regulate and control levels of alkalinity, chlorides, hardness, iron levels, organic matter, silica, sulphates, total dissolved solids and total suspended solids in system. h 45 dubai building code part h indoor environment cooling water system shall not contain dead legs or sections where debris and biofilms might accumulate
cooling tower shall be fitted with drift eliminators to minimize release of water droplets

cooling water system should be easily and safely accessible for cleaning, maintenance and disinfecting. operation and maintenance of water systems serving cooling tower shall be designed in accordance with hse approved code of practice l8 ref. h.25. h.5.3 sustainable water heating system central or decentralized hot water systems shall be configured utilizing sustainable hot water heating technology, such as solar hot water, except in buildings where a) such hot water system would be impractical due to tenancy, metering, and pipework distribution constraints or b) hot water generation utilizing local point-of-use electric water heaters would provide more energy-efficient design solution

percentage heating contribution from solar hot water heating system depends on occupancy and estimated hot water usage profile. system designer shall target 75% of total hot water daily demand being produced by solar hot water system. to reduce system standing losses, all hot water storage vessels and distribution pipework shall be insulated

h.5.4 cold water services h.5.4.1 cold water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings cold water distribution a) water closet flushing b) washbasins c) sinks d) showers e) maintenance areas, workshops and back of house areas f) cleaners sinks and g) bib tap points

h.5.4 cold water services h.5.4.1 cold water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings cold water distribution a) water closet flushing b) washbasins c) sinks d) showers e) maintenance areas, workshops and back of house areas f) cleaners sinks and g) bib tap points

h.5.4 cold water services h.5.4.1 cold water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings cold water distribution a) water closet flushing b) washbasins c) sinks d) showers e) maintenance areas, workshops and back of house areas f) cleaners sinks and g) bib tap points

where municipal water system pressures inadequate to serve building, pumped water supply system shall be provided to deliver water to sanitary fittings at all building levels. booster pump set shall be connected to water storage tank. booster set shall provide pressurized supply of cold water to all cold water outlets and hot water plants

booster pumps should be multistage, variable speed pumps rather than duty/ standby single pump system. this approach provides longer system life with higher energy efficiencies, as well as providing wider range of system flow rates for facility
note depending on occupancy type and resiliency strategy required, booster pumps might need to be connected to building emergency power supply

pumped cold water distribution strategy shall be determined by height of building. for high-rise buildings, intermediate water plant rooms might be required at certain floor levels to provide system pressure break

h 46 dubai building code part h indoor environment cold water systems should be maintained, where possible, at temperature below 20 c. water should reach temperature of no more than 20 c within 2 min at outlets
all booster pumps shall have accumulator vessel and incorporate automatic controls to ensure even pump wear and prevent system stagnation
for all buildings, water meter rooms, water meter and isolation valve locations shall conform to dewa regulations ref. h.32

water check meters shall be installed on all water services connections to mechanical plant to monitor water consumption. all parts of cold-water system, including storage tanks and pipework, shall be designed to avoid water stagnation and ensuring flow through all parts of system. dead legs in cold-water systems shall be avoided
cold water distribution system shall be designed in accordance with relevant parts of water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. h.31, bs en 806 and bs en 8558

04 cooled water systems h.5.4.2 in buildings where there requirement for cooled water supply (15 c to 20 c), this can be achieved via installation of heat exchanger connected to building chilled water system. heat exchanger connected to final cooled water storage tank that serves this system. cooled water can be utilized to serve wash hand basins, sinks, baths, showers and shatafs. cooled water systems (see figure h.6) often required in healthcare buildings, hotels and sports facilities. in buildings where chilled water system not available, cooled water system could be achieved by connection to heat pump
