cold water break tank and booster pump set shall be located in pool filtration plant room. pool filtration shall be designed by pool filtration specialist. note objective of pool water treatment system to provide hygienic, safe, comfortable and pleasant environment both for bathers and spectators in pool hall. this to be achieved under anticipated bathing load levels

05 06 08 09 10 02 figure h.7 water recycling 11 12 13 h 48 dubai building code part h indoor environment irrigation water supply h.5.4.6 when supply of water for irrigation of lawned, planted areas and green roofs required, system shall be supplied from recycled water system. suitable recycled water systems include a) greywater recycling systems and b) condensate reuse systems

05 06 08 09 10 02 figure h.7 water recycling 11 12 13 h 48 dubai building code part h indoor environment irrigation water supply h.5.4.6 when supply of water for irrigation of lawned, planted areas and green roofs required, system shall be supplied from recycled water system. suitable recycled water systems include a) greywater recycling systems and b) condensate reuse systems

05 06 08 09 10 02 figure h.7 water recycling 11 12 13 h 48 dubai building code part h indoor environment irrigation water supply h.5.4.6 when supply of water for irrigation of lawned, planted areas and green roofs required, system shall be supplied from recycled water system. suitable recycled water systems include a) greywater recycling systems and b) condensate reuse systems

water disinfection shall be provided for above-ground sprinkler irrigation systems that create aerosol of water droplets. note 1 disinfection of water supply not required for subsurface landscape irrigation systems

note 2 dispersal disinfection filtration systems provide effective means of treatment for water irrigation systems. irrigation system shall be served from water recycling plant or via separate dedicated plant that includes storage tank, pumps, filtration and water treatment plant. backflow protection device shall be provided at point of connection to each irrigation supply. irrigation water supply shall be fed from dedicated pipework distribution system. isolation and drain valves shall be provided to enable system to be easily maintained

note 2 dispersal disinfection filtration systems provide effective means of treatment for water irrigation systems. irrigation system shall be served from water recycling plant or via separate dedicated plant that includes storage tank, pumps, filtration and water treatment plant. backflow protection device shall be provided at point of connection to each irrigation supply. irrigation water supply shall be fed from dedicated pipework distribution system. isolation and drain valves shall be provided to enable system to be easily maintained

note 2 dispersal disinfection filtration systems provide effective means of treatment for water irrigation systems. irrigation system shall be served from water recycling plant or via separate dedicated plant that includes storage tank, pumps, filtration and water treatment plant. backflow protection device shall be provided at point of connection to each irrigation supply. irrigation water supply shall be fed from dedicated pipework distribution system. isolation and drain valves shall be provided to enable system to be easily maintained
all system irrigation system components shall be clearly labelled to prevent risk of cross-connection to other building water distribution systems

h 49 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.5 potable water storage tanks general h.5.5.1 potable water storage shall be provided in building, to protect building against interruptions to incoming mains supplies and to enable water supply pressures to be safely maintained

h.5.5.2 water tank locations note it common in dubai for buildings to incorporate two potable water storage tanks (not including fire suppression water storage), with one tank located at incoming main (basement or ground floor) and one tank at roof level. this strategy permitted, but popularity of pressure boosting systems has enabled cold water storage at roof level to be omitted (see figure h.8). location of cold-water storage tanks also influenced by height of building. for high-rise buildings, intermediate water plant rooms might be required to provide system pressure break

risk assessment shall be carried out to determine best location for potable water tanks. assessment shall take into account building spatial constraints, and access and maintenance. if there risk of flooding, potable water tanks shall not be placed in areas of flooding risk such as basement or at ground floor level

water tanks shall be positioned as far as possible from drainage network lines, manholes, septic tanks and cesspits. in all cases, drainage pipelines shall not run above or next to above- or below-ground water tanks

dewa shall have access to any part of building to conduct inspection of water supply tanks, to verify compliance with public health conditions and associated technical specifications. h 50 01 01 01 02 01 01 01 02 02 02 figure h.8 alternative cold water supply system arrangements key 01 cold water storage tank 02 cold water booster pump set dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.5.3 water storage tank sizing capacity of domestic water supply tanks shall be calculated based on actual demand of building occupants. as minimum, water tanks shall be sized based on 24 h demand from all water connections except firefighting, and shall be not less than 1 m3. water tanks for labour accommodation shall be sized for 48 h demand. table h.6 gives water consumption rates in accordance with dewa transmission planning guidelines ref. h.36. maximum water consumption rates in each range should not be used unless justified based on project requirements

dewa shall have access to any part of building to conduct inspection of water supply tanks, to verify compliance with public health conditions and associated technical specifications. h 50 01 01 01 02 01 01 01 02 02 02 figure h.8 alternative cold water supply system arrangements key 01 cold water storage tank 02 cold water booster pump set dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.5.3 water storage tank sizing capacity of domestic water supply tanks shall be calculated based on actual demand of building occupants. as minimum, water tanks shall be sized based on 24 h demand from all water connections except firefighting, and shall be not less than 1 m3. water tanks for labour accommodation shall be sized for 48 h demand. table h.6 gives water consumption rates in accordance with dewa transmission planning guidelines ref. h.36. maximum water consumption rates in each range should not be used unless justified based on project requirements

dewa shall have access to any part of building to conduct inspection of water supply tanks, to verify compliance with public health conditions and associated technical specifications. h 50 01 01 01 02 01 01 01 02 02 02 figure h.8 alternative cold water supply system arrangements key 01 cold water storage tank 02 cold water booster pump set dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.5.3 water storage tank sizing capacity of domestic water supply tanks shall be calculated based on actual demand of building occupants. as minimum, water tanks shall be sized based on 24 h demand from all water connections except firefighting, and shall be not less than 1 m3. water tanks for labour accommodation shall be sized for 48 h demand. table h.6 gives water consumption rates in accordance with dewa transmission planning guidelines ref. h.36. maximum water consumption rates in each range should not be used unless justified based on project requirements

a) adversely affect nature (e.g. colour, taste or odour) or chemical properties of water b) be affected by either temperature or humidity c) be impervious to light or d) cause any harmful effect to human health
tank shall be free from sharp corners that could accumulate dirt, microbes or prevent effective periodic cleaning
maximum height of reinforced concrete tanks shall be calculated by structural engineer
height of pre-insulated glass-reinforced plastic (grp) tanks shall not exceed more than 3 m, with water levels not exceeding 2.5 and free board not less than 0.5

cold water storage tanks shall be arranged in one of following two ways 1) divided into two equal compartments (50/50 configuration as shown in figure h.9). this type of arrangement allows for one part of tank to be cleaned, disinfected, serviced, repaired, inspected, etc. while other in operation. this means that water supply pipe needs to be supplied to each part of tank, as set out in local requirements. to ensure that water flow provided when required, and that each tank section provided with equal volume of flow, water meter shall be installed on supply to each ball float or chain valve or 2) provided as two separate tanks that installed in parallel configuration. h 52 domestic water supply tanks shall be provided with lockable manholes. dimensions of manhole openings shall be sufficient to allow person to access tank safely for cleaning. openings shall be located away from public circulation areas and sources of contamination

cold water storage tanks shall be arranged in one of following two ways 1) divided into two equal compartments (50/50 configuration as shown in figure h.9). this type of arrangement allows for one part of tank to be cleaned, disinfected, serviced, repaired, inspected, etc. while other in operation. this means that water supply pipe needs to be supplied to each part of tank, as set out in local requirements. to ensure that water flow provided when required, and that each tank section provided with equal volume of flow, water meter shall be installed on supply to each ball float or chain valve or 2) provided as two separate tanks that installed in parallel configuration. h 52 domestic water supply tanks shall be provided with lockable manholes. dimensions of manhole openings shall be sufficient to allow person to access tank safely for cleaning. openings shall be located away from public circulation areas and sources of contamination

figure h.9 sectional cold water storage tank arrangement dubai building code part h indoor environment in each water tank (or water tank section when divided tanks used), following components shall be provided i) isolation valve at inlet and outlet of tank division ii) valve strainer at outlet of each tank division iii) drain connection at bottom of each tank. invert of drain shall be located to fully drain that division of tank iv) overflow pipe from each division of tank v) overflow warning pipe with insect protection screen of 0.65 mm mesh. screen area shall be capable of passing same amount of water as overflow or warning pipe vi) external and internal access ladder and vii) vent pipe with corrosion resistant air inlet mesh

in circumstances where it might be difficult to install overflow or warning pipe to drain line, audible warning alarm shall be installed to inform building maintenance team of tank overflow occurrence

water tanks that installed above ground shall be constructed from pre-insulated grp. tanks shall be installed in conditioned space that free from contamination and shall not be exposed to external dubai climate. sectional grp tanks shall be specified with externally flanged connections (base and sides) to simplify tank cleaning and sterilization

there shall be 1 free space around all sides and above top of grp tank for equipment maintenance. raw water tanks can be constructed out of concrete and can be buried below ground, or they can be located within conditioned room. all concrete tanks shall be lined with suitable grp coating or liner

tanks shall be cleaned and sterilized after completion of work and prior to actual use of tank. all cold water storage tanks shall incorporate laboratory testing certificate stating its suitability for storing drinking water in accordance with dewa requirements ref. h.32. tank pump room h.5.5.5 pump room shall be of sufficient size to enable operation, maintenance and repair of various pumps that connect to tank. each pump set shall be installed on reinforced concrete base

tanks shall be cleaned and sterilized after completion of work and prior to actual use of tank. all cold water storage tanks shall incorporate laboratory testing certificate stating its suitability for storing drinking water in accordance with dewa requirements ref. h.32. tank pump room h.5.5.5 pump room shall be of sufficient size to enable operation, maintenance and repair of various pumps that connect to tank. each pump set shall be installed on reinforced concrete base

firefighting water tanks h.5.5.6 firefighting water tank and pump connection arrangements shall conform to ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1. firefighting water tanks shall be located next to or below fire pump room, depending upon pump type selected. they shall conform to table 1.9, ch. 1 of uae flsc ref. h.1. firefighting water tank area shall have adequate drainage, and arrangement such that overfilling tank does not flood area and pump room, in accordance with table 9.3, ch. 9. of uae flsc ref. h.1. pump room and floor corridors shall be provided with drainage facility to drain dripped and leaked water or water flooded during firefighting operations. centralized firefighting water tank to serve multiple buildings in development permitted provided that buildings owned by one entity and maintenance of system managed and controlled as part of common area. size of tank shall be designed for more than one fire event simultaneously, to be agreed with dcd
mechanical floor shall be provided every 90 in super high-rise buildings to accommodate firefighting pumps and tanks required by section 4.2, ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1
h 53 dubai building code part h indoor environment water systems shall not use materials that aid microbial growth

any cooling water system, including its make-up water tanks, shall be provided with suitable automatically controlled water treatment system (e.g. automatic biocide- dosing device) for management of corrosion, scaling, fouling and microbial growth. all such treatment systems should work effectively at all times when water cooling system in operation

all water features that have water storage volume of over 1,000 l and that create water spray or aerosol shall be designed, installed, operated, treated and maintained to minimize risk of legionella bacteria or microbiological bacteria growth in accordance with latest dm guidelines, if any 1) 2) guidelines for control of legionella in water systems ref. h.33 3) private swimming pools safety guidelines ref. h.34 4) public swimming pools safety guidelines ref. h.35 and 5) hse approved code of practice l8 ref. h.25 and associated technical guidance documents ref. h.26 to ref. h.30
this includes, but not limited to cooling towers, evaporative condensers, hot and cold water systems, warm water systems, evaporative air coolers, spas, water features, fountains, misters, etc

combined firefighting and water storage h.5.5.7 where water tanks also used for firefighting purposes, water storage capacity shall be increased to include firefighting water storage capacity and system shall be designed to facilitate regular turnover of cold water storage volume in tank. tank and pump connection arrangements shall conform to ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1. fire pump test line shall not discharge back into tank

h.5.6 water treatment h.5.6.1 treatment against microbiological bacteria growth proper and effective method shall be implemented to control microbiological bacteria growth in building water systems, cooling towers, and internal and external water features. one of following control methods shall be used a) pasteurization b) chemical treatment (biocides, chlorine, etc) c) silver copper ionization d) filtration systems. choice depends on building, water systems it serves, source of incoming water supply, and capital and on-going maintenance costs

designer shall formulate strategy to maintain water quality and minimize risk of legionella bacteria for each manufactured water system from point of supply to point of use. suitability of materials used in construction of manufactured water system shall not adversely affect water quality

h 54 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.6.2 water softening water softening shall be provided in areas where quality of incoming water supply not suitable for its intended use. note 1 high levels of calcium and magnesium salts in hard water areas result in scale deposits in systems equipment and pipework, which in turn reduce flow and efficiency of system and increase surface area of biofilm
note 2 water softening might be required to serve following equipment within some buildings a) water treatment plant b) steam boilers c) laundry areas d) kitchen areas and e) hot water systems
note 2 water softening might be required to serve following equipment within some buildings a) water treatment plant b) steam boilers c) laundry areas d) kitchen areas and e) hot water systems

softening of cold-water supply to hot water distribution system should be provided where necessary to reduce risk of scale being deposited at base of calorifier and heating coils chemical composition of incoming water shall be investigated at early stages of design. decision shall be made on basis of this investigation as to whether water softening required

h.5.7 servicing and isolation valves water servicing distribution pipework shall incorporate service valves on all items of plant and sources of supply to allow for isolation to facilitate maintenance. as minimum, branch isolation valves shall be provided on branches and risers at connection to main distribution system

h.5.7 servicing and isolation valves water servicing distribution pipework shall incorporate service valves on all items of plant and sources of supply to allow for isolation to facilitate maintenance. as minimum, branch isolation valves shall be provided on branches and risers at connection to main distribution system
isolation valves, non-return valves, flushing and injection points shall be positioned in suitable locations to allow for sterilization of whole system or individual zones during maintenance works
all water servicing valves shall be positioned in accessible location that permits maintenance and replacement of valves without damage to wall, ceiling or floor finishes

h.5.8 backflow protection water systems shall be designed and installed in such way as to reduce risk of contaminating cold water supplies. in particular, requirements of water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. h.31 shall be met, and appropriate classification of fluid category backflow protection shall be provided

where required to prevent cross-contamination, water services system shall be protected by use of break tanks or air gaps, meeting correct fluid category classification, as integral part of plant and equipment served from water services system. this protection shall be provided in all areas of building

h 55 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.9 controls and monitoring to provide early warning of problems within system, system shall include means of monitoring note 1 chosen type of hot water system depends on several factors including occupancy type, building usage, building opening hours, building energy, hot water generation strategy and system installation and maintenance costs. typical hot water system with return configuration shown in figure h.10
a) incoming mains temperature b) water tank storage temperatures and c) water temperatures at furthest hot and cold water outlets (sentinel)
all temperature monitoring points in water service systems shall be linked to bms
h.5.10 hot water services hot water shall be supplied to a) washbasins b) sinks c) showers d) maintenance areas, workshops and back of house services areas and e) cleaners sinks
h.5.10 hot water services hot water shall be supplied to a) washbasins b) sinks c) showers d) maintenance areas, workshops and back of house services areas and e) cleaners sinks

hot water system may be configured as 1) centralized system  hot water system that serves building from central figure h.10 typical domestic hot water return configuration plant 2) decentralized systems  where several hot water systems served from their own plant and 3) point-of-use hot water system  where hot water generated local to sanitary fitting or appliance

key 01 thermal balancing valve 02 secondary circulation pump 03 water heater 01 02 03 h 56 dubai building code part h indoor environment hot water may be generated using direct or indirect heating methods including i) ii) electrical hot water generation (direct) fuel-burning hot water generation (indirect, including boiler/steam) iii) solar hot water generation (utilizing secondary source of direct or indirect heat generation) and iv) heat pump system

note 2 duplicate hot water plant might be required to ensure that hot water can be supplied during periods of plant maintenance. this requirement dependent upon several factors, including occupancy type and building opening hours. pumped hot water return shall be provided, unless electrical trace heating tape used. hot water return shall be designed to maintain distribution temperatures between 50 c to 55 c. hot water return system shall include thermal balancing valves for all hot water sub-circuits. warm water systems typically found in care facilities such as early childhood centres, primary schools and secondary schools. heated water stored in warm water systems shall be maintained at temperature of not less than 60 c. in order to safeguard against scalding, thermostatic mixing valves shall be provided to prevent hot water that delivered to outlets of sanitary fixtures, used primarily for personal hygiene purposes, from exceeding 45 c

all parts of hot-water system, including storage tanks, water heaters and pipework, shall be designed to avoid water stagnation and ensuring flow through all parts of system. dead legs in hot-water systems shall be avoided

temperature stratification shall be avoided in heaters and storage containers by installation of stirring or mixing device. hot water distribution system shall be designed to relevant parts of water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. h.31, bs en 806 and bs en 8558

thermostatic mixing valves shall be installed on all hot water outlets that used for handwashing or bathing, including those in table h.7. thermostatic mixing valves shall conform to hse approved code of practice l8 ref. h.25

sanitary fitting shower and hair washing washbasin baths maximum recommended temperature (c) 41 38 to 41 44 table h.7 sanitary fitting hot water outlet temperatures h 57 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.5.11 water services system installation requirements h.5.12 provisions for future connection water services distribution pipework shall be sized to meet system demands based on number of fittings and equipment connected to it

capped off water services connections shall be provided to all building areas that require future fit-out. pipe velocities shall be restricted to approximately 1.5 m/s to maintain system longevity, minimize noise generation and limit pressure waves

capped off water services connections shall be provided to all building areas that require future fit-out. pipe velocities shall be restricted to approximately 1.5 m/s to maintain system longevity, minimize noise generation and limit pressure waves
note these connections might require sub-metering to enable building owner to charge tenant for volume water they consume

wherever practicable, water services connections shall be configured such that they do not create deadleg. where pipework routing makes this configuration impracticable, water service connections shall be terminated with automatic flushing valve to enable water turnover through each connection
h.5.13 interfaces for bms and automatic controls water services design shall provide volt-free contacts on all plant and equipment for monitoring/control purposes via bms
interior hot and cold-water pipework shall be insulated in accordance with bs 5422
pressure reducing valves shall be installed to enable safe water discharge pressures at all sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances
pressure reducing valves shall be installed to enable safe water discharge pressures at all sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances
surge protection valves shall be installed at top of all water services risers. system shall also incorporate water hammer arrestors
cold-water supply to all water closet ablution hoses shall incorporate vacuum breaker
water supply pressures at sanitary fitting terminal outlets shall be limited to 1.5 bar to ensure safe operation of these fittings

automatic water supply shut-off valves shall be provided on water distribution pipework serving areas of building that might be partially or intermittently occupied. automatic shut-off provisions may be utilized, in conjunction with proximity sensors or leak detection systems, to help reduce water consumption and mitigate risk of leaks that otherwise might go unnoticed and cause damage to building. precise measures that provided shall be determined according to occupancy type. water heaters shall be certified and approved by responsible authority

all water supply pipework and fittings shall be approved by either water regulations advisory scheme (www.wrasapprovals.co.uk/) or water research council (www.wrcplc.co.uk/wrc-approvedtm)
h 58 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.6 drainage h.6.1 general this section covers all occupancies except healthcare and low-rise residential dwellings (see part k)
requirements for healthcare buildings, and all relevant codes and standards, identified within dha regulations ref. h.2 to ref. h.11 and dha health facility guidelines ref. h.12 to ref. h.16
requirements for healthcare buildings, and all relevant codes and standards, identified within dha regulations ref. h.2 to ref. h.11 and dha health facility guidelines ref. h.12 to ref. h.16

this section sets out minimum requirements and basis of design for above- and below-ground drainage systems within building and up to 1.5 beyond site boundary. for systems or applications not covered within this section, requirements in bs en 12056 and bs en 752 shall be met

h.6.2 sanitary plumbing system general h.6.2.1 sanitary plumbing system shall be provided to all domestic sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances. sanitary plumbing system shall surface of sanitary fittings (such as toilets, urinals and wash basins) shall be of material that easy to clean and maintain. all sanitary fittings shall be provided with water trap. if water trap forms part of sanitary appliance, fitting shall be removable. all other water traps shall be fitted directly after sanitary appliance and shall be removable or fitted with rodding eye. all sanitary fitting tap flow rates, and water closet and urinal cistern flush volumes, shall conform to table h.8

h.6.2 sanitary plumbing system general h.6.2.1 sanitary plumbing system shall be provided to all domestic sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances. sanitary plumbing system shall surface of sanitary fittings (such as toilets, urinals and wash basins) shall be of material that easy to clean and maintain. all sanitary fittings shall be provided with water trap. if water trap forms part of sanitary appliance, fitting shall be removable. all other water traps shall be fitted directly after sanitary appliance and shall be removable or fitted with rodding eye. all sanitary fitting tap flow rates, and water closet and urinal cistern flush volumes, shall conform to table h.8

sanitary fitting type shower heads hand wash basins kitchen sinks dual flush water closets urinals maximum flow rate/flush volume 8 l/m 6 l/m 7 l/m 6 l full flush 3 l part flush 2.4 l in non-public facilities 1 l per flush or waterless in public buildings a) convey and collect drainage flows to sewer infrastructure, cesspools, septic tanks table h.8 maximum sanitary fitting flow rates/flush volumes or holding tanks b) minimize risk of blockage or leakage c) prevent foul air from drainage system entering building during normal system usage and d) provide access provisions to clean and maintain system

h 59 dubai building code part h indoor environment 01 02 03 r 5 4 3 2 1 g r 21 20 5 4 3 2 1 g figure h.11 base of discharge stack branch connection arrangements ( chartered institute of plumbing & heating engineering (ciphe). ciphe cannot be held responsible for any errors or omissions related to information included) key 01 vent cowl 02 discharge stack 03 manhole sanitation system disposal h.6.2.2 sanitation system shall be designed to collect and convey soil and waste flows by gravity to public drainage network. sanitation systems shall be designed in accordance with bs en 12056

sanitation pipework and ventilation pipework shall be configured to control pressure fluctuations that might occur in system. sanitary fitting water traps shall be maintained during normal system working conditions. primary ventilated and secondary ventilated discharge stack arrangements may be utilized for this purpose. discharge stack arrangement shall be determined according to building height, grouping of sanitary fittings within building, and any other relevant factors

sanitation pipework and ventilation pipework shall be configured to control pressure fluctuations that might occur in system. sanitary fitting water traps shall be maintained during normal system working conditions. primary ventilated and secondary ventilated discharge stack arrangements may be utilized for this purpose. discharge stack arrangement shall be determined according to building height, grouping of sanitary fittings within building, and any other relevant factors
all building discharge stacks shall terminate externally to vent to atmosphere (see figure h.11)

for tall buildings, branch pipework connections located directly above base of discharge stack shall be configured such that soil and waste flows from upper floor levels do not adversely affect connecting sanitary appliance water traps. to achieve this, one of following requirements shall be met, depending on building height (see figure h.11)

a) for buildings of less than 20 storeys in height, sanitary fittings located one storey level above base of discharge stack shall not be connected to any vertical stack that drains upper floor levels of building

b) for buildings greater than 20 storeys in height, sanitary fittings located two storey levels above base of discharge stack shall not be connected to any vertical stack that drains upper floor levels of building

h 60 dubai building code part h indoor environment where greywater recycling proposed within building, separate discharge stacks shall be provided to drain greywater appliances such as showers, hand wash basins and baths (see figure h.12). for most occupancies, wastewater flows from kitchen appliances should not be recycled. drainage from mechanical plant h.6.2.3 gravity drainage connections shall be provided from water services pressure relief and valve test lines. connection shall be made indirectly into sanitation system, either via deep sealed trapped tundish, or to, or over, floor gully. all air-conditioning units and balcony drains shall be connected to sanitation system. connection shall be made indirectly into waste stack, either via deep sealed trapped tundish, or to, or over, floor gully. flexible polyethylene pipes shall not be used for air-conditioning unit condensate drain pipework

floor drains h.6.2.4 floor drains (see figure h.13) shall be installed in all building areas containing wet sanitary fittings or appliances (including kitchens, toilets, showers, cleaners rooms and ablution areas)

floor drains h.6.2.4 floor drains (see figure h.13) shall be installed in all building areas containing wet sanitary fittings or appliances (including kitchens, toilets, showers, cleaners rooms and ablution areas)

floor drains shall also be provided in mechanical plant rooms, waste rooms and garages, for plant drainage and for cleaning and washdown. all floor drain body and grating materials shall be specified to suit floor finishes within which they installed and imposed traffic loads to which they expected to be subject. waterproof seal shall be achieved between floor finish and edge of floor grating to prevent migration of water at this junction

h 61 dubai building code part h indoor environment figure h.13 typical floor gully body and grating details in order to prevent trap seal evaporation, all floor drains shall be configured to receive wastewater flows from sanitary fitting or condensate connection from air-conditioning unit. where this not practicable, automatic drain trap primer shall be installed. floor gully with back inlet connection shall be utilized to receive waste pipe connections from these fittings. all floor drains shall have water seal at least 75 mm deep. waste pipe connections from bidets or urinals shall connect directly to discharge stack, not floor drain (see figure h.14)

to help control pressure fluctuations (see figure h.16) that naturally occur within drainage systems, air admittance valves (aavs) and passive air pressure attenuators (papas) may be used as alternative to installing secondary ventilation pipework. where this approach adopted, design calculations shall be submitted to authority for approval

all aav and papa fittings shall be sized and installed in accordance with specified valve manufacturers requirements, and shall conform to bs en 12056 and bs en 12380. all valve termination locations shall permit ease of access for maintenance and replacement

wherever practicable, all drainage stacks that utilize aav or papa fittings shall terminate externally. where drainage stacks proposed to terminate internally, designer shall provide technical justification for this approach for approval by authority

ventilation pipework h.6.2.5 vent pipes from manholes, vertical discharge stacks and vent pipes shall be positioned at least 3 horizontally from any opening into building and any mechanical plant air inlet. such vent pipes shall extend at least 2 above roof level (see figure h.15). all discharge stacks and vent pipes shall be fitted with vent cowl

ventilation pipework h.6.2.5 vent pipes from manholes, vertical discharge stacks and vent pipes shall be positioned at least 3 horizontally from any opening into building and any mechanical plant air inlet. such vent pipes shall extend at least 2 above roof level (see figure h.15). all discharge stacks and vent pipes shall be fitted with vent cowl

pipework system soil vent pipe waste vent pipe rainwater pipe vent pipe balcony drain ac drain pipe minimum pipe size (mm) 100 100 100 75 50 32 table h.10 minimum drainage pipework sizes for buildings up to seven storeys h 65 pipework system soil vent pipe waste vent pipe rainwater pipe vent pipe balcony drain ac drain pipe minimum pipe size (mm) 150 150 100 100 50 32 table h.11 minimum drainage pipework sizes for buildings above seven storeys only long radius fittings shall be used in wet portion of any discharge stack. thermoplastic drainage pipework shall not run through electrical rooms, electric sub- stations, prayer rooms, kitchens, kitchen food stores and bedrooms. drainpipes shall not be cast into building structural element without prior approval from structural engineer at authority

where drainage pipework required to pass through structural element in building, cast iron sleeve shall first be fitted within structural element to allow drain to pass through. sleeve shall offer tolerance of at least 50 mm to simplify installation of pipe. gap between pipe and sleeve shall then be filled with suitable sealant. routing of drainage pipework through sensitive areas of building should be avoided. sensitive areas might include, but not limited to, following a) areas of architectural significance b) pipework routes through areas of different ownership or tenancy and c) areas where access to drainage pipework might be restricted. dubai building code part h indoor environment where routing drainage pipework through these areas cannot be avoided, pipework installation shall be configured to mitigate risk of pipework leaks. this shall be achieved by using pipework materials that have limited pipework joints, or pipe in pipe installation techniques

drainpipe sizes and gradients shall be selected based on calculated flows through drainage system. in all instances, self-cleansing velocity shall be achieved through each drain section. drainage design and associated calculations shall be issued to authority for approval. leak detection systems h.6.2.9 leak detection systems shall be installed in areas of building where undetected water or drainage leak could affect sensitive equipment or cause significant damage to building and its interior (e.g. electrical communication rooms, base of mechanical services risers, floor voids and some plant room areas). requirement for and extent of leak detection systems will depend on building occupancy or use. to enable automatic warning signal to be sent to bms, all leak detection systems shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts. h.6.3 below-ground drainage drainage systems h.6.3.1 below-ground drainage systems shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752 to receive soil and waste flows from above-ground sanitation system

drainpipe sizes and gradients shall be selected based on calculated flows through drainage system. in all instances, self-cleansing velocity shall be achieved through each drain section. drainage design and associated calculations shall be issued to authority for approval. leak detection systems h.6.2.9 leak detection systems shall be installed in areas of building where undetected water or drainage leak could affect sensitive equipment or cause significant damage to building and its interior (e.g. electrical communication rooms, base of mechanical services risers, floor voids and some plant room areas). requirement for and extent of leak detection systems will depend on building occupancy or use. to enable automatic warning signal to be sent to bms, all leak detection systems shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts. h.6.3 below-ground drainage drainage systems h.6.3.1 below-ground drainage systems shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752 to receive soil and waste flows from above-ground sanitation system

drainpipe sizes and gradients shall be selected based on calculated flows through drainage system. in all instances, self-cleansing velocity shall be achieved through each drain section. drainage design and associated calculations shall be issued to authority for approval. leak detection systems h.6.2.9 leak detection systems shall be installed in areas of building where undetected water or drainage leak could affect sensitive equipment or cause significant damage to building and its interior (e.g. electrical communication rooms, base of mechanical services risers, floor voids and some plant room areas). requirement for and extent of leak detection systems will depend on building occupancy or use. to enable automatic warning signal to be sent to bms, all leak detection systems shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts. h.6.3 below-ground drainage drainage systems h.6.3.1 below-ground drainage systems shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752 to receive soil and waste flows from above-ground sanitation system
foul water flows shall be collected and conveyed to external drainage network by gravity flow

buried drainage pipework, fittings and ring seal joints shall be specified to suit ground conditions in which they installed and nature of discharge they receive. drainage pipe connections shall be airtight and free from any internal obstructions. pipe bedding and surround materials shall be selected to suit prevailing geotechnical ground conditions. all drainpipe bedding and backfilling materials shall be installed in accordance with specified pipework manufacturers requirements. drainpipes shall not be routed through ducts, bridges or their associated foundations. where drains required to pass through building structural element, they shall be encased within cast iron sleeve. sleeve shall be sized to allow drain to safely pass through. gap between pipe and sleeve shall be filled with suitable sealant. if underground drainpipe line installed less than 600 mm below finished floor level, it shall be provided with 150 mm thick concrete encasement. underground drainage pipework and fittings shall conform to bs en 13476

buried drainage pipework, fittings and ring seal joints shall be specified to suit ground conditions in which they installed and nature of discharge they receive. drainage pipe connections shall be airtight and free from any internal obstructions. pipe bedding and surround materials shall be selected to suit prevailing geotechnical ground conditions. all drainpipe bedding and backfilling materials shall be installed in accordance with specified pipework manufacturers requirements. drainpipes shall not be routed through ducts, bridges or their associated foundations. where drains required to pass through building structural element, they shall be encased within cast iron sleeve. sleeve shall be sized to allow drain to safely pass through. gap between pipe and sleeve shall be filled with suitable sealant. if underground drainpipe line installed less than 600 mm below finished floor level, it shall be provided with 150 mm thick concrete encasement. underground drainage pipework and fittings shall conform to bs en 13476
refer to authority drainage details for confirmation of approved manhole, inspection chamber, pipe bedding, gully and pipe connection arrangements

commercial and industrial waste shall not be drained into public drainage network unless approved by authority. approval will only be granted if appropriate equipment available for initial treatment of waste

h 66 dubai building code part h indoor environment access shall be provided at following points in drainage system 1) at or near end of drainage run 2) at bend or change in system direction or drain gradient 3) at junction (unless each drain run can be cleared from adjacent access point) and 4) at all changes in system pipe size

h 67 dubai building code part h indoor environment sump pits h.6.3.3 all basement levels shall be provided with appropriate means and equipment to drain and filter water (such as sand separation rooms and mechanical plant rooms)
sump pump pits (see figure h.19) shall have depth of not less than 1 from level of lowest inlet pipe

all sump pump pits shall be positioned in accessible location for ease of cleaning and maintenance. all sump pits shall incorporate two submersible pumps operating in duty/standby configuration. where sump pump operation important to operation of building, electrical supply to submersible pump installation shall have generator back-up. each submersible pump shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts. 01 02 note volt-free contacts and control panel enables automatic warning signal to be sent to bms in event of pump failure

all sump pump pits shall be positioned in accessible location for ease of cleaning and maintenance. all sump pits shall incorporate two submersible pumps operating in duty/standby configuration. where sump pump operation important to operation of building, electrical supply to submersible pump installation shall have generator back-up. each submersible pump shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts. 01 02 note volt-free contacts and control panel enables automatic warning signal to be sent to bms in event of pump failure
03 open grated sump pits do not require vent pipe
figure h.19 typical sump pump detail ( cibse. figure based on figure 6.13 from cibse, 2014. guide g  public health and plumbing engineering guide. london cibse)

key 01 guide rail 02 pump 03 auto coupling h 68 dubai building code part h indoor environment foul pumping stations h.6.3.4 where external public drainage network of insufficient depth, or where there risk of internal flooding due to sewer surcharge, foul flows from sanitary fittings shall discharge into foul pumping station
pumping station (see figure h.20) shall be evacuated by submersible pumps that transport foul flows via pumping main to external public drainage network

pumping station shall house pumps that incorporate auto-changeover facility to ensure even pump wear. all pumping stations shall incorporate, as minimum, n+1 resilience with pumps operating in duty/standby configuration, where n indicates duty equipment

wet well capacity of foul pumping station should be sized to provide approximately 24 h foul water storage in event of pump failure. foul water storage volume shall be provided below lowest incoming chamber connection. where pumping station system resilience important to operation of building, electrical supply to pumping station shall have generator back-up. where possible, pumping station shall be located externally. where this cannot be achieved, pumping station shall be located inside building within dedicated plant room that permits easy access for cleaning and maintenance. pumping station shall have dedicated vent pipe that terminates externally to vent to atmosphere

pumping station shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts. note volt-free contacts and control panel enables automatic warning signal to be sent to bms in event of pump failure. 09 11 10 01 01 key 01 invert level 02 110  discharge 03 150 mm (approximately) subject to pump requirements 04 min. level 05 pump 06 min. 100 mm 07 inlet pipe 08 control cables 09 control panel with backup power supply 10 subject to pump requirements 11 ventilation 02 3 5 0 05 400 4 4 5 2 5 0 figure h.20 typical foul water pumping station detail 08 07 06 500 500 04 03 1,000 h 69 dubai building code part h indoor environment manholes h.6.3.5 all manholes shall be installed within boundaries of building plot. during design, care shall be taken to select appropriate location of last manhole (i.e. one before public network) in terms of ease of connection to public drainage network and to fulfil conditions of authority

all inspection chambers, manholes and gully traps constructed in covered building areas shall be dry type (not open channel) and provided with recessed double seal type cover. manhole access covers shall be suitable for wheel loads to which they subjected and for their surrounding floor or road finishes, in accordance with bs en 124-1

all inspection chambers, manholes and gully traps constructed in covered building areas shall be dry type (not open channel) and provided with recessed double seal type cover. manhole access covers shall be suitable for wheel loads to which they subjected and for their surrounding floor or road finishes, in accordance with bs en 124-1
note 2 manholes located in garages, driveways or other areas of vehicle movement likely to require heavy-duty covers

if inspection chambers or manholes installed in agricultural land, manhole cover shall be raised at least 75 mm above natural ground level. manhole venting shall be provided by vent pipe serving first and last manholes of any drainage line. vent pipes shall be located at least 100 mm below cover level

manholes shall be sited away from underground water tanks, at distance not less than depth of water tank. manholes shall not be installed inside buildings, except in chutes, corridors, service rooms, car sheds and ventilated corridors. such manholes shall be dry type (not open channel). manhole schedule shall be arranged as shown in figure h.21. manhole invert level, cover level depth and distance between manholes shall be determined by authority public drainage connection level and final inspection chamber (fic). all datum units shall be produced in international system of units (si units)
cover level invert level distance depth (m) cover type remark to next chamber (m) manhole no

figure h.21 sample manhole schedule invert level of external drainage system shall be determined by consultant. drainage connection level shall match that of fic. depth of last manhole shall be obtained from or approved by authority

acute angle branch connections shall not be made within manholes. pipework connections into manhole shall be installed where tops of each incoming drain connect at same level. note 1 this connection arrangement means that smaller diameter connecting pipes not flooded when there flow through bigger pipes

acute angle branch connections shall not be made within manholes. pipework connections into manhole shall be installed where tops of each incoming drain connect at same level. note 1 this connection arrangement means that smaller diameter connecting pipes not flooded when there flow through bigger pipes

headings: final inspection chamber and provision for future connection
Description: h 70 dubai building code part h indoor environment final inspection chamber and provision for future connection h.6.3.7 final inspection chamber (fic) shall be constructed near building compound wall and opposite public drainage connecting chamber/manhole. fic cover shall be ductile iron with grp push-fit sealing plate. fic manhole shall have one incoming connection and shall operate by gravity flow. where there no public drainage system, fic for building shall still be provided for connection to future public drainage network/manhole. fic shall be located towards narrowest adjacent road

manhole construction h.6.3.6 where manhole or inspection chamber constructed below groundwater table level, entire manhole construction shall be either waterproofed reinforced concrete or grp. all main line channels shall be in centre of manhole. sides of manhole channels shall be extended vertically to same level of soffit of pipe

benching of incoming branch drains shall be inclined towards main direction of flow. diameter of semi-circular channel in bottom of manhole shall be equal to that of outgoing drain diameter. benching of inspection chambers/manholes shall have smooth curved surface using granolithic concrete that does not restrict drainage flows
manhole chamber and access cover sizes shall be not less than minimum values given in table h.13

h 71 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.6.4 rainwater disposal general h.6.4.1 rainwater disposal system shall be provided to remove rainwater from all building roof areas. system shall be designed in accordance with bs en 12056, and configured to reduce impact of sand and dust ingress
system shall be designed to enable regular ongoing maintenance to remove sand and dust from roof gutters, outlets and rainwater pipework
rainfall intensity design criteria shall be taken from intensity duration-frequency curves developed for dubai urban areas as shown in table h.14
for each building development, rainfall intensity criteria used for design purposes shall be agreed with authority

h 72 dubai building code part h indoor environment hardstanding paved areas shall be constructed to slope away from building. where external levels would otherwise cause water to pond along wall, reverse gradient shall be constructed at least 500 mm from wall to divert water away

if public storm water drainage network not available in area, rainwater storm drain or holding tank should be provided within land boundaries. where such facility provided, it shall be sufficient to hold rainwater for at least one day. miscellaneous rainwater drainage h.6.4.5 rainwater pipes shall not be connected to sewer lines. they shall be terminated above ground, to allow free discharge onto external ground surface. exposed roof areas or canopies shall be configured with gradient of not greater than 1/50 and not less than 1/70 in order to direct rainwater to suitable channels, gutters or outlets

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other areas that open to sky shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system. routing of rainwater pipework through sensitive areas of building should be avoided. sensitive areas might include, but not limited to 1) areas of architectural significance 2) pipework routes through areas of different ownership or tenancy and 3) areas where access to drainage pipework might be restricted. where routing pipework through these areas cannot be avoided, pipework installation shall be configured to mitigate risk of pipework leaks. this shall be achieved by using pipework materials that have limited pipework joints, or pipe in pipe installation techniques

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other areas that open to sky shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system. routing of rainwater pipework through sensitive areas of building should be avoided. sensitive areas might include, but not limited to 1) areas of architectural significance 2) pipework routes through areas of different ownership or tenancy and 3) areas where access to drainage pipework might be restricted. where routing pipework through these areas cannot be avoided, pipework installation shall be configured to mitigate risk of pipework leaks. this shall be achieved by using pipework materials that have limited pipework joints, or pipe in pipe installation techniques

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other areas that open to sky shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system. routing of rainwater pipework through sensitive areas of building should be avoided. sensitive areas might include, but not limited to 1) areas of architectural significance 2) pipework routes through areas of different ownership or tenancy and 3) areas where access to drainage pipework might be restricted. where routing pipework through these areas cannot be avoided, pipework installation shall be configured to mitigate risk of pipework leaks. this shall be achieved by using pipework materials that have limited pipework joints, or pipe in pipe installation techniques

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other areas that open to sky shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system. routing of rainwater pipework through sensitive areas of building should be avoided. sensitive areas might include, but not limited to 1) areas of architectural significance 2) pipework routes through areas of different ownership or tenancy and 3) areas where access to drainage pipework might be restricted. where routing pipework through these areas cannot be avoided, pipework installation shall be configured to mitigate risk of pipework leaks. this shall be achieved by using pipework materials that have limited pipework joints, or pipe in pipe installation techniques
siphonic rainwater disposal systems h.6.4.2 siphonic rainwater systems shall be designed and installed in accordance with bs en 12056
siphonic rainwater disposal systems h.6.4.2 siphonic rainwater systems shall be designed and installed in accordance with bs en 12056

only specialist consultants shall be employed to design and install these systems. where siphonic rainwater systems proposed, consultant shall design system using analytical software to demonstrate hydraulic performance of system. consultant shall provide design drawings, schematics and specifications for submission to authority

rainwater disposal system acoustic requirements h.6.4.3 rainwater disposal system shall be designed and routed through building with attention to acoustic requirements of space that it passes through. acoustic insulation shall be provided where required

rainwater disposal system acoustic requirements h.6.4.3 rainwater disposal system shall be designed and routed through building with attention to acoustic requirements of space that it passes through. acoustic insulation shall be provided where required
drainage of hardstanding paved areas h.6.4.4 hardstanding paved areas shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752. they shall be drained using floor gullys and linear drainage channels

h 73 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.6.5 grease traps dedicated above-ground gravity drainage system shall be provided to drain wastewater flows from food production kitchen areas within building. system shall connect to grease trap (see figure h.22). grease traps shall conform to bs en 1825-1 or equivalent. except for residential buildings, design proposals for grease traps shall be submitted to authority for approval
all discharge stacks that serve food production kitchen areas shall terminate externally to enable each stack to safely vent to atmosphere
grease traps shall be positioned external to building in locations that facilitate vacuum tanker access

04 06 03 05 970 25 07 07 02 01 60 670 460 09 150 12 2 0 0 1 6 0 1 5 0 1 6 0 9 7 0 figure h.22 typical kitchen grease trap connection detail key 01 dimension varies to suit requirement 02 5 mm thk. neoprene gasket 03 10  40 brass nut/bolt 04 ductile heavy duty manhole cover 05 1,070 mm  815 mm  15 mm thk. grp sealed cover 06 55 (50 mm) air vent 07 lifting handle 08 110 outlet pipe 09 two bucket 460 mm deep removeable pvc perforated bucket with 25 holes in four rows each side 10 55 holes in three rows 8 nos. in each row 11 100 pvc pipe 12 support for bucket seating 08 01 11 10 630 h 74 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.6.6 oil interceptors oil interceptors shall be provided for vehicle washing and service stations (see figure h.23). oil separators shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752 and bs en 8588. they shall be installed in location that allows easy access for vacuum tanker, to aid regular emptying

oil separators shall have a) dedicated vent pipe and cable duct connection and b) control panel with audible alarm that indicates when separator requires emptying. oil separator access covers shall be suitable for wheel loads to which they subjected and for their surrounding floor or road finishes. 2 5 0 200 9 5 0 03 02 04 05 01 3 0 0 2 0 0 9 0 0 , 1 4 0 0 1,800 - 2,000 figure h.23 typical oil separator detail key 01 oil 02 small dam 03 2  600  600 cast iron heavy duty cover 04 fire hose coupling (type c) 05 oil drainage unit h 75 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.6.7 swimming pools h.6.9 above- and below-ground drainage testing drainage for swimming pools and backwash pumps shall be shown on separate drainage layout plans

for swimming pools on roof or upper floors, separate 100 mm diameter drain (after backwash regulating valve) shall be installed to ground floor manhole connection. this drain shall not connect to basement sump pump. backwash drainage flows from pool filtration system shall discharge unattenuated into public drainage system where this approved by authority. if approval for unattenuated discharge cannot be obtained, backwash water shall discharge into attenuation tank to enable reduced drainage flow rate to public drainage system. all drainage systems shall be tested with air or water to verify that systems do not have any defects. all drainage test certification shall be submitted to authority for review and approval. all drainage systems shall be tested as soon as practicable after installation. interim and final test certificates shall be of agreed format, which shall give full details of site, system, location, type of test and witnesses, together with signatures and test dates
unless more stringent testing requested by authority or another party, following procedures shall be used for above-ground drainage systems
a) pipes shall be interim tested using air pressure of 100 mm water gauge held architectural safety features for pools discussed in b.8.3.2.2
constant for 5 min

h.6.8 provisions for future connection within all buildings, waste and vent pipe connections shall be provided to all areas of possible future fit-out, including, but not limited to, retail units, office or administrative areas, food production and sport and leisure facilities. b) if system fails test, any faults shall be rectified, and test repeated until satisfactory test result has achieved
c) on completion of installation and connection of sanitary appliances, final air test shall be made, using air pressure of 50 mm water gauge held constant for 5 min
for below-ground drainage systems, unless more stringent testing requested by authority or another party, testing shall be undertaken using air or water in accordance with bs en 1610

h 76 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.6.10 septic tank and sewage holding tanks where there no public drainage network available, building shall be provided with sewage holding tank. septic tanks shall be utilized only for remote building locations that expected to generate low foul water flow rates

headings: septic tanks and sewage holding tanks
Description: septic tanks and sewage holding tanks shall meet following requirements

c) swimming pool water shall not be drained into septic tank. i) where insulation provided to prevent leakage through walls, non-penetrating reinforced concrete tanks shall be situated at distance not less than 1 from nearby buildings and boundary walls, and brick tanks at distance not less than 3 m. reinforced concrete tanks shall be at minimum depth of 1.5 from invert of pipe connected to tank inlet, and shall have spacing of at least 3 from nearest water tank. note location constraints illustrated in figure h.24

j) tanks shall not be located within 5.5 set back of vehicular access area unless this unavoidable. if tank has to be located within this area, road and tank construction shall be sufficiently robust for road use by fire tenders and heavy goods vehicles. k) tanks shall be provided with ventilation pipe
l) all tank openings shall be covered in such way as to prevent insects from d) tanks shall be constructed of reinforced concrete, glass reinforced plastic or entering

brickwork. all tanks shall be installed in accordance with tank manufacturers requirements, and to withstand any potential vehicle loading. e) where tank to be founded at lower level than that of adjacent footing, tank shall be constructed before footing

f) tanks shall have openings of adequate size, with heavy-duty lockable access m) holding tanks shall have high-level alarm facility connected to dedicated control panel, which will generate alarm in event of wastewater overflowing. for buildings with bms, control panel shall be linked to bms to generate automatic alarm. for buildings that do not have bms, control panel shall have visual and audible alarm
cover of suitable dimensions to enable cleaning and maintenance
n) tanks shall be provided with breaching pipe for pumping out operations. g) roof level of tank shall not terminate above adjacent ground level in which it situated

h) tanks shall have adequate capacity, calculated on basis of daily personal consumptions given in standard tables produced by authority. tanks shall be emptied without impeding operation of building. h 77 dubai building code part h indoor environment 01 1 01 3 1 02 03 1  04 3 02 03 3 04 (a) reinforced concrete and concrete encased grp holding tanks (b) brickwork holding tank figure h.24 septic tank and sewage holding tank location constraints diagram key 01 site boundary/boundary wall 02 septic/holding tank 03 no underground water tank shall be located within 1m of tank location 04 building key 01 site boundary/boundary wall 02 septic/holding tank 03 no underground water tank shall be located within 3m of tank location 04 building h 78 dubai building code part h indoor environment grp sealing plate shall be installed on last manhole before tank and on manhole utilized for future connection before sewer line. tanks shall be designed in accordance with bs 6297. typical sewage holding tank arrangement shown in figure h.25

h.7.2 lighting power densities  interior lighting power density shall be calculated using either building area method or space-by-space method as set out in sections 9.5 and 9.6 of ashrae 90.12019
when using building area method, maximum average lighting power density for interior connected lighting load shall not exceed values given in table h.15
lighting power density values for occupancies not listed in table h.15 shall not exceed values given in ashrae 90.1 or equivalent as approved by authority

h.7.5 electronic ballasts high frequency electronic ballasts shall be used with a) fluorescent lights of 150 w and less and b) metal halide lights of 150 w and less
h.7.4 lighting controls high frequency electronic ballasts shall conform to international standard approved by authority, and shall be labelled as such
lighting controls for interior lighting shall be provided in accordance with following requirements

h.7.6 light levels on means of egress a) occupants shall be able to control or switch off lighting when daylight levels adequate or when spaces unoccupied. floors and other walking surfaces within exit, exit access and exit discharge, shall be illuminated as follows b) in common areas that not regularly occupied (such as corridors and lobbies), lighting levels shall be automatically reduced when space unoccupied, to maximum of 25% of normal level

h.7.6 light levels on means of egress a) occupants shall be able to control or switch off lighting when daylight levels adequate or when spaces unoccupied. floors and other walking surfaces within exit, exit access and exit discharge, shall be illuminated as follows b) in common areas that not regularly occupied (such as corridors and lobbies), lighting levels shall be automatically reduced when space unoccupied, to maximum of 25% of normal level
a) illumination for stairs, when in use, shall be not less than 108 lux, measured at walking surfaces

b) illumination for floors and walking surfaces, other than stairs, shall be not c) in offices and education facilities, all lighting zones shall be fitted with occupant less than 10.8 lux, measured at floor
sensor controls capable of switching normal lighting on and off based on occupancy level, with following exceptions. 1) lighting required for safety purposes excluded
2) if average design lighting power density value less than 6 w/m2 of gross area, these controls do not need to be provided

d) in offices, artificial lighting within 6 of exterior windows should be fitted with lighting controls. where lighting controls fitted, they shall incorporate photocell sensors that capable of adjusting electric lighting levels to supplement levels of daylight when required. combination of artificial light and daylight shall provide illumination level at working plane between 400 lux and 500 lux. when 100% of daylight available, illumination might exceed 500 lux

c) in assembly occupancies, illumination of walking surfaces of exit access shall be not less than 2.2 lux during periods of performances or projections involving directed light (e.g. onto cinema screen)

c) in assembly occupancies, illumination of walking surfaces of exit access shall be not less than 2.2 lux during periods of performances or projections involving directed light (e.g. onto cinema screen)
d) minimum illumination requirements do not apply where operations or processes require low lighting levels
illumination shall be arranged such that failure of any single lighting unit does not result in illumination level of less than 2.2 lux in any designated area

light levels on means of egress in emergency mode shall conform to ch. 3 and ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1. emergency lighting shall be provided in all areas listed in table 6.6, ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1. exterior routes from point of exit discharge to public way shall be provided with emergency lighting in accordance with table 6.6, ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1. assembly points and mall parking lots shall have emergency lighting or source of illumination (e.g. public street lights) that has separate power supply to building

light levels on means of egress in emergency mode shall conform to ch. 3 and ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1. emergency lighting shall be provided in all areas listed in table 6.6, ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1. exterior routes from point of exit discharge to public way shall be provided with emergency lighting in accordance with table 6.6, ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. h.1. assembly points and mall parking lots shall have emergency lighting or source of illumination (e.g. public street lights) that has separate power supply to building

h 82 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.8 commissioning h.9 fire safety systems commissioning of air distribution systems, water distribution systems, lighting, central control and building management systems, refrigeration systems and boilers shall be carried out in accordance with cibse commissioning codes ref. h.38, ref. h.39, ref. h.40, ref. h.41, ref. h.42, ref. h.43 or other commissioning code/ standard approved by authority. systems manual shall be developed, and shall be provided to building operator upon completion of commissioning works. systems manual shall document information required to allow future operations staff to understand and optimally operate commissioned services

h.9.1 general emergency voice evacuation systems, two-way communication systems, fire detection and alarm systems and fire protection systems shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 7 to ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1. h.9.2 emergency voice evacuation systems emergency voice evacuation systems shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 7 of uae flsc ref. h.1. emergency voice evacuation system shall be provided at all high-rise and super high-rise buildings and following a) malls b) assembly buildings c) amusement and theme parks d) educational buildings e) hotel buildings f) detention and correctional facilities and g) hospitals. dcd does not enforce item 9, table 7.3, ch. 7 of uae flsc ref. h.1. emergency voice evacuation systems therefore not required in storage and industrial buildings in dubai. as specified in table 8.1, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. h.1 1) emergency voice evacuation speakers shall be provided inside exit staircases 2) audible sounders shall not be installed in buildings with emergency voice evacuation systems

h.9.1 general emergency voice evacuation systems, two-way communication systems, fire detection and alarm systems and fire protection systems shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 7 to ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1. h.9.2 emergency voice evacuation systems emergency voice evacuation systems shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 7 of uae flsc ref. h.1. emergency voice evacuation system shall be provided at all high-rise and super high-rise buildings and following a) malls b) assembly buildings c) amusement and theme parks d) educational buildings e) hotel buildings f) detention and correctional facilities and g) hospitals. dcd does not enforce item 9, table 7.3, ch. 7 of uae flsc ref. h.1. emergency voice evacuation systems therefore not required in storage and industrial buildings in dubai. as specified in table 8.1, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. h.1 1) emergency voice evacuation speakers shall be provided inside exit staircases 2) audible sounders shall not be installed in buildings with emergency voice evacuation systems

in addition, dcd does not permit emergency voice evacuation speakers inside emergency command centre. h 83 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.9.3 two-way communications systems h.9.5 fire protections systems two-way communication system for fire fighters shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 7 of uae flsc ref. h.1. fire protection systems shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1. two-way communication system for fire fighters shall be provided at all super high- rise buildings and following note design of firefighting water tanks or combined potable and firefighting water tanks covered in h.5.5.6 and h.5.5.7

dcd requires at least one dry/wet riser landing valve to be provided at roof level. additional landing valves shall be provided if roof area cannot be covered by single 61 hose. motorized zone control valves, as required by table 9.7, ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. h.1 for high-rise buildings, not required by dcd. basements and all corridors on every floor shall be provided with drainage facilities to clear water from fire fighting activities (see ch.9 of uae flsc ref. h.1)
a) malls b) assembly buildings c) amusement and theme parks d) hotel buildings and e) detention and correctional facilities
when required by c.5.9.3.2, two-way communication system shall be provided for use by people of determination, and shall be designed to conform to ch. 7 of uae flsc ref. h.1

h.9.4 fire detection and alarm systems fire detection and alarm systems shall be provided as required by, and designed to conform to, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. h.1. automatic heat detection shall be provided in non-sprinklered, enclosed parking areas, in accordance with table 8.1, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. h.1

audible sounders shall not be installed inside exit staircases, in accordance with table 8.1, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. h.1. in addition, dcd does not permit audible sounders inside emergency command centre. h 84 dubai building code part h indoor environment h.10 acoustics h.10.1 site planning requirements all sites shall be planned and landscaped to contribute to relief and masking of noise in external spaces. this shall include determining appropriate placement of water features, planting and other decorative features
pleasant outdoor soundscape shall be achieved to extent possible

a) structure borne noise from plant b) airborne noise break-out from plant rooms and c) external plant noise break-in through building envelope. building services noise shall be free from attention-catching effects, tonality and impulsiveness

h 85 dubai building code part h indoor environment noise from buildings services and plant shall be controlled to prevent disturbance to any nearby noise sensitive receptors such as dwellings, places of worship, outdoor amenities or circulation areas. control of noise from building shall include limiting noise breaking back into building that plant serving. this contribution to total internal noise level shall be included when designing building envelope, or when specifying plant noise limits and mitigation requirements such as screening or plant enclosures

sound insulation h.10.3.3 sound insulation of building envelope, internal floors and partitions shall be designed in accordance with standards listed in table h.17 or better, and additional requirements described in h.10.4. figure h.27 illustrates examples of sources of noise to be included in design of sound insulation of building facades and internal elements of structure

sound insulation h.10.3.3 sound insulation of building envelope, internal floors and partitions shall be designed in accordance with standards listed in table h.17 or better, and additional requirements described in h.10.4. figure h.27 illustrates examples of sources of noise to be included in design of sound insulation of building facades and internal elements of structure

note sound insulation performance of building elements specified in listed documents presented in terms of their performance on-site. on-site performance will be numerically lower than performance measured in laboratory, which specified by suppliers and manufacturers of building materials. difference can be due to quality of workmanship on-site and because performance can be compromised by flanking transmission, which allows sound to be transmitted via other elements of building, as illustrated in figure h.27
