lockable front door 13 dual socket inside consolidation cabinet with dedicated circuit breaker on domestic supply and not looped with other general power sockets k.9.7.4.3 cable pathways cable pathway specifications shall conform to table k.52
following requirements shall be met for all cable tray and conduit pathway systems
b) day one cable installation shall not exceed 50% of pathway capacity
c) all cable trays shall be hot-dip galvanized slotted steel and shall be hdrf construction

e) slab penetrations and wall penetrations for pathways passing through fire-rated construction shall be sealed with approved fire stopping material in accordance with section 3, ch.1 of uae flsc ref. k.1. fire stopping shall be reinstated whenever cables installed after completion of initial fire stopping works
f) vertical pathways shall be continuous between all levels with no reduction of capacity through penetrations
g) pathways shall not run through areas exposed to 1) excessive heat 2) moisture 3) corrosive atmospheric or environmental conditions 4) high voltages 5) rfi or 6) emi
labelling villa/townhouse number table k.51 minimum specifications for consolidation cabinet h) separation of telecom and electrical pathways shall conform to iso/iec 14763-2
k 141 dubai building code part k villas i) all conduit junction/pull box dimensions shall be 300 mm  300 mm  150 mm (w  h  d) minimum internal dimension

pathway via slab opening vertical pathway specification to allow vertical routing of telecom conduits two  50 mm conduits (copper), junction/pull box per floor per conduit horizontal pathway one  25 mm conduit per dual copper outlet from cabinet increase conduit size if multiple dual outlets fed on same route junction/pull boxes at sharp/90 bends or routes over 30 table k.52 cable pathway specifications k.9.7.4.4 cables and termination equipment all fixed and permanently installed telecom cables shall be halogen-free and achieve minimum rating of cca-s1b, d2, a2 when tested in accordance with bs en 13501-6 and be ce marked. note ce marking represents manufacturers declaration that products conform to applicable manufacturing and testing standard

pathway via slab opening vertical pathway specification to allow vertical routing of telecom conduits two  50 mm conduits (copper), junction/pull box per floor per conduit horizontal pathway one  25 mm conduit per dual copper outlet from cabinet increase conduit size if multiple dual outlets fed on same route junction/pull boxes at sharp/90 bends or routes over 30 table k.52 cable pathway specifications k.9.7.4.4 cables and termination equipment all fixed and permanently installed telecom cables shall be halogen-free and achieve minimum rating of cca-s1b, d2, a2 when tested in accordance with bs en 13501-6 and be ce marked. note ce marking represents manufacturers declaration that products conform to applicable manufacturing and testing standard
all optical fibre components shall be selected from approved product list held by sps
for villas/townhouses, fibre optic cables shall be provided by sps

within each villa/townhouse developer shall supply 12u consolidation cabinet with four port fibre terminal box (with lc/apc and sc/apc pigtails and adaptors) fitted inside cabinet to all sps to terminate 4 core sm drop cable

to deliver services from consolidation cabinets to building outlets, twisted pair copper cables shall be provided. full design responsibility of developer however, following minimum requirements shall be followed for efficient and effective provision of services
a) cables and components shall conform as minimum to requirements of category 6 as specified in iso 11801-1
h) permanent link cable length from consolidation cabinet to to shall not exceed 90

i) cable lengths shall be de-rated where required due to local temperature conditions and cable specifications to enable end-to-end error free channel performance up to 1 gbps for category 6 and 10 gbps for category 6
j) at consolidation cabinet, copper cables shall be terminated on rj45 patch panel and labelled with socket and outlet served. terminations shall be to tia 568b pair scheme
k) in each to, each cable shall be terminated such as to maintain twists in each pair up to termination. termination shall be in accordance with selected manufacturer installation instructions

k 142 dubai building code part k villas m) components of system shall all be of same category (6 or 6 a) and type (utp or stp), and from single manufacturer, to ensure optimum performance and compatibility
n) test results for copper cable tests shall be saved and recorded for future reference purposes

labelling scheme k.9.7.4.5 k.9.7.4.5.1 general installed system shall be administered in accordance with iso/iec-14763-1. all sections of installation shall be provided with suitable identification labels to clearly indicate location and purpose of each item or cable. instructions and optical fibre caution notices shall also be provided. all labels shall be in both english and arabic and of font sizes to suit individual applications

k.9.7.4.5.2 sp gaid and eid identification plate for each villa/townhouse sp identification plate (see figure k.91) shall be installed at each villa/ townhouse. identification plate shall be made of plastic plate or light metal plate with alphanumeric characters (gaid or eid) engraved on it. gaid and eid reference number details shall be made available to developer during inspection stage

figure k.91 example eid and gaid identification plate with labelling details k 143 dubai building code part k villas k.9.7.4.5.3 component and location labelling when labelling telecom cabling and equipment, common suffixes and designations shall be used in label text as detailed in table k.53 and table k.54

location equipment rack floor table k.53 labelling designations labelling designation rck fl label type format labelling of cabinet inside villa/ townhouse floor number/name  location + number example fl01-acp12 labelling for 4 core fibre terminal box (always terminate pigtail 1 to core 1 of sm fibre cable) mmr rack number-odf number-odf row/slot number- core numbers table k.54 labelling scheme for equipment rk2-odf1-s1-c1,c2,c3,c4 labelling scheme for 2 core adapters inside fibre terminal box shall follow figure k.92 depending upon orientation of adaptor

figure k.92 labelling scheme for 2 core adapter inside fibre terminal box k 144 dubai building code part k villas k.10 indoor environment k.10.1 hvac systems and occupant comfort k.10.1.1 general this section sets out minimum requirements, basis of design for heating, ventilation and air-conditioning (hvac) systems and thermal comfort within buildings. relevant sustainability criteria and cross-references to uae flsc ref. k.1 included. hvac systems shall be designed to minimize energy usage and ensure comfort of building occupants. systems shall be selected to ensure long life, easy maintenance and simple and effective controls. for systems or applications not covered by this section, design solutions and guidance shall be obtained from current edition of ashrae handbooks, guides and standards

figure k.92 labelling scheme for 2 core adapter inside fibre terminal box k 144 dubai building code part k villas k.10 indoor environment k.10.1 hvac systems and occupant comfort k.10.1.1 general this section sets out minimum requirements, basis of design for heating, ventilation and air-conditioning (hvac) systems and thermal comfort within buildings. relevant sustainability criteria and cross-references to uae flsc ref. k.1 included. hvac systems shall be designed to minimize energy usage and ensure comfort of building occupants. systems shall be selected to ensure long life, easy maintenance and simple and effective controls. for systems or applications not covered by this section, design solutions and guidance shall be obtained from current edition of ashrae handbooks, guides and standards

k.10.1.2 acoustic requirements and noise criteria ch. 49, table 1 of ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. k.32 identifies design guidelines for acceptable noise levels for hvac-related background noise for range of typical building and room types. these design guidelines shall be used as basis for determining acceptable noise levels for specific room types within villa. if higher or lower value considered desirable, analysis of economics, space use and user needs shall be obtained from acoustic consultant to determine appropriate value

k.10.1.2 acoustic requirements and noise criteria ch. 49, table 1 of ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. k.32 identifies design guidelines for acceptable noise levels for hvac-related background noise for range of typical building and room types. these design guidelines shall be used as basis for determining acceptable noise levels for specific room types within villa. if higher or lower value considered desirable, analysis of economics, space use and user needs shall be obtained from acoustic consultant to determine appropriate value

design criteria dry bulb temperature relative humidity value to be used 24 c  1.5 c 50%  5% table k.56 indoor design conditions for dubai k 145 dubai building code part k villas indoor design conditions can vary depending on occupancy or use of rooms in villa. ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. k.32 shall be used as reference for all indoor design conditions for specific occupancies or usage

design criteria dry bulb temperature relative humidity value to be used 24 c  1.5 c 50%  5% table k.56 indoor design conditions for dubai k 145 dubai building code part k villas indoor design conditions can vary depending on occupancy or use of rooms in villa. ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. k.32 shall be used as reference for all indoor design conditions for specific occupancies or usage
k.10.1.3.5 external load criteria building envelope shall meet requirements in k.7.2 to determine thermal transmittance and shading coefficients
when diversity factors to be used in heat load calculations not known, coefficients indicated in ch. 18 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33 shall be used
following safety factors shall be applied a) sensible heat 10% b) latent heat 5%

k.10.1.3.3 outdoor air design conditions all buildings that fully air-conditioned shall be provided with outdoor air system. system shall ensure that building provided with outdoor air for at least 95% of year. following maximum design temperatures shall be used, where outdoor air treated a) dry bulb temperature 34 c b) wet bulb temperature 32 c

k.10.1.3.4 heat gain and loss calculations heat load calculations shall be carried out for each air-conditioned space, including peak load incidence in that space. calculations shall be carried out using software registered with authority

following parameters shall be taken into account in building load calculations a) building envelope orientation b) building envelope design and construction details c) building floor plans d) building elevations and sections e) impact of external shading factors (see k.7.2.3) and f) any special requirements for building use or operation
internal load criteria k.10.1.3.6 k.10.1.3.6.1 occupancy total number of occupants shall be determined based on ashrae 62.2- 2019
internal load criteria k.10.1.3.6 k.10.1.3.6.1 occupancy total number of occupants shall be determined based on ashrae 62.2- 2019

k.10.1.3.6.2 lighting project specific lighting loads shall be used. where lighting loads not available, they shall be determined based on recommendations in ashrae 90.1. k.10.1.3.6.3 electrical equipment loads project specific electrical equipment loads shall be used. where equipment loads not available, they shall be as recommended in ashrae 90.1 for each application type

k 146 dubai building code part k villas k.10.1.3.7 building energy simulation and modelling energy simulation and modelling can be undertaken, if required, to evaluate energy performance and predicted annual energy consumption/co2 emissions of all villas/townhouses with floor area greater than 2,000 m2
chillers shall meet minimum efficiency requirements and test procedures given in table 6.8.1 to table 6.8.3 of ashrae 90.12019
chiller equipment requirements shall be met for all chillers, including those where leaving fluid design temperature <4.5 c

modelling software package should be capable of determining energy load requirements as set out in ashrae standard 90.2. energy modelling should be carried out using licensed software registered with authority having jurisdiction

thermal comfort criteria k.10.1.4 hvac systems shall be capable of providing range of internal conditions in table k.57, for 95% of year variable dry bulb temperature relative humidity lower limit 22.5 c 30% (min) table k.57 thermal comfort requirements upper limit 25.5 c 60% (max) for occupant comfort, normal occupied spaces shall have average air velocity between 0.2 m/s and 0.3 m/s

energy conservation and efficiency building systems k.10.1.5 k.10.1.5.1 minimum efficiency of hvac systems hvac equipment and systems shall meet minimum energy efficiency requirements and test procedures approved by a) uae.s 5010-1 labelling  energy efficiency label for electrical appliances, part 1 household air-conditioners by emirates authority for standardisation and metrology (esma) and k.10.1.5.2 efficient sizing of hvac systems hvac systems shall be efficiently sized to minimize energy use of building
thermal energy load calculations shall be carried out for all conditioned areas of building and results of these calculations shall be used as basis for selecting air-conditioning equipment
ventilation calculations shall be carried out. results of such calculations shall be used for sizing outdoor air systems, exhaust systems and energy recovery units (if applicable)

k.10.1.5.3 central air-conditioning units equipped with energy recovery units and regulated air intake system to prevent energy loss by exhausting conditioned air to atmosphere, energy recovery systems shall be used in all combined supply and extract air handling units where applicable and found practical in terms of a) quantity of air extracted b) availability of energy recovery systems for that capacity and c) assessment of benefits

for villas with requirement for treated outdoor air of over 1,000 l/s, energy recovery systems shall be provided to handle at least 50% of total exhausted air. energy recovery systems shall have at least 70% sensible load recovery efficiency
b) ashrae 90.2. figure k.93 shows typical energy recovery wheel

k 147 dubai building code part k villas 01 02 k.10.1.5.4 pipe and duct insulation following shall be insulated to minimize heat loss and prevent condensation a) all pipes carrying refrigerant, hot water or chilled water and b) ducts supplying conditioned air (including prefabricated ducts). this shall include pipes and ducts passing through conditioned and unconditioned spaces

k 147 dubai building code part k villas 01 02 k.10.1.5.4 pipe and duct insulation following shall be insulated to minimize heat loss and prevent condensation a) all pipes carrying refrigerant, hot water or chilled water and b) ducts supplying conditioned air (including prefabricated ducts). this shall include pipes and ducts passing through conditioned and unconditioned spaces
k.10.1.6 ventilation and air quality k.10.1.6.1 general adequate supply of outdoor air shall be provided to facilitate health and comfort of occupants of buildings and to limit condensation

adequate space pressurization shall be provided to reduce moisture and contaminant transfer between adjacent spaces, thereby reducing contamination in occupied spaces and unwanted condensation and mould growth. space pressurization (via return, transfer or exhaust air) in space or location shall be designed in accordance to ashrae 62.2 or as approved by authority. k.10.1.6.2 minimum ventilation requirements for adequate indoor air quality outdoor air rates shall meet minimum requirement of ashrae 62.2

headings: minimum ventilation requirements for adequate indoor air quality
Description: adequate space pressurization shall be provided to reduce moisture and contaminant transfer between adjacent spaces, thereby reducing contamination in occupied spaces and unwanted condensation and mould growth. space pressurization (via return, transfer or exhaust air) in space or location shall be designed in accordance to ashrae 62.2 or as approved by authority. k.10.1.6.2 minimum ventilation requirements for adequate indoor air quality outdoor air rates shall meet minimum requirement of ashrae 62.2
indoor air quality k.10.1.6.3 air filters for general ventilation shall meet efficiency classification given in iso 16890-1 based upon particulate matter
indoor air quality k.10.1.6.3 air filters for general ventilation shall meet efficiency classification given in iso 16890-1 based upon particulate matter

paints, coatings, adhesives and sealants used in building shall not exceed permitted limits for volatile organic compounds (vocs) specified by dubai central laboratory ref. k.34. these materials shall be accredited/certified from dubai central laboratory, or any other laboratory approved by authority

carpet systems (carpets or new permanently installed carpet padding) shall be certified/accredited by dubai central laboratory, or any other laboratory approved by authority. figure k.93 ventilation energy recovery thermal wheel key 01 plate heat exchanger 02 rotary heat exchanger k 148 dubai building code part k villas note alternative filtration techniques, such as electronic filters and air cleaners using photocatalytic oxidation, should be approved by authority prior to installation/use due to negative health effects that can arise from exposure to ozone and its volatile reaction products. substantial technical evidence required on use of these techniques and should be validated by international agencies and test standards. they not considered to be replacement for mechanical filtration but can be used as aids to achieve better indoor air quality

carpet systems (carpets or new permanently installed carpet padding) shall be certified/accredited by dubai central laboratory, or any other laboratory approved by authority. figure k.93 ventilation energy recovery thermal wheel key 01 plate heat exchanger 02 rotary heat exchanger k 148 dubai building code part k villas note alternative filtration techniques, such as electronic filters and air cleaners using photocatalytic oxidation, should be approved by authority prior to installation/use due to negative health effects that can arise from exposure to ozone and its volatile reaction products. substantial technical evidence required on use of these techniques and should be validated by international agencies and test standards. they not considered to be replacement for mechanical filtration but can be used as aids to achieve better indoor air quality

carpet systems (carpets or new permanently installed carpet padding) shall be certified/accredited by dubai central laboratory, or any other laboratory approved by authority. figure k.93 ventilation energy recovery thermal wheel key 01 plate heat exchanger 02 rotary heat exchanger k 148 dubai building code part k villas note alternative filtration techniques, such as electronic filters and air cleaners using photocatalytic oxidation, should be approved by authority prior to installation/use due to negative health effects that can arise from exposure to ozone and its volatile reaction products. substantial technical evidence required on use of these techniques and should be validated by international agencies and test standards. they not considered to be replacement for mechanical filtration but can be used as aids to achieve better indoor air quality

k.10.1.6.4 air inlets and exhausts outdoor air inlets for all ventilation systems, including doors, operable windows and mixed mode ventilation systems, shall be located at suitable distance from potential sources of contamination as specified in ashrae 62.2 and ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. k.32. note this to reduce possibility of odour, smoke or other air contaminants entering ventilation system. exhaust air shall be discharged in such way that it does not get drawn back into building or building ventilation system. it shall also not become nuisance to building occupants or occupants of nearby buildings, or to pedestrians. air inlets and exhaust louvers/vents shall be positioned such as to prevent recirculation of air and separated by distance not less than minimum given in ashrae 62.2. air inlets and exhaust shall be located relative to prevailing wind directions, using wind rose diagrams for building. air inlets shall be positioned at upwind or windward direction. exhausts (such as from kitchens and toilets) shall discharge at downwind or leeward direction. intake air shall be drawn into system through sand trap louvers sized for at least 1 m/s across face area of louver, to provide 80% or higher filtration efficiency at coarse sand grain size (355 m to 425 m)
k.10.1.6.5 chlorofluorocarbon (cfc) free and ozone friendly materials all thermal insulation shall be cfc-free

all fire suppressants shall use substances with zero ozone depletion potential (odp). k.10.1.7 natural ventilation natural ventilation of occupied spaces via windows, doors or other openings permitted but shall not be relied upon to provide ventilation and thermal comfort. operating mechanism for such openings shall be accessible so that openings readily operable by building occupants. k.10.1.8 mechanical ventilation k.10.1.8.1 general ventilation system design and selection shall be determined by mechanical engineer for given application, taking into account all relevant issues associated with building design, usage, configuration and commissioning, operation and maintenance of system. mechanical ventilation system shall consist of one or more supply or exhaust fans and associated ducts and controls. outdoor air ducts connected to return side of fan coil unit or air handler plenum box shall be permitted as supply ventilation, provided that manufacturer requirements for return air temperature met and ventilation load at peak condition accounted for when sizing fan coil unit or air handler, in order to control temperature and remove excess humidity

all fire suppressants shall use substances with zero ozone depletion potential (odp). k.10.1.7 natural ventilation natural ventilation of occupied spaces via windows, doors or other openings permitted but shall not be relied upon to provide ventilation and thermal comfort. operating mechanism for such openings shall be accessible so that openings readily operable by building occupants. k.10.1.8 mechanical ventilation k.10.1.8.1 general ventilation system design and selection shall be determined by mechanical engineer for given application, taking into account all relevant issues associated with building design, usage, configuration and commissioning, operation and maintenance of system. mechanical ventilation system shall consist of one or more supply or exhaust fans and associated ducts and controls. outdoor air ducts connected to return side of fan coil unit or air handler plenum box shall be permitted as supply ventilation, provided that manufacturer requirements for return air temperature met and ventilation load at peak condition accounted for when sizing fan coil unit or air handler, in order to control temperature and remove excess humidity

all fire suppressants shall use substances with zero ozone depletion potential (odp). k.10.1.7 natural ventilation natural ventilation of occupied spaces via windows, doors or other openings permitted but shall not be relied upon to provide ventilation and thermal comfort. operating mechanism for such openings shall be accessible so that openings readily operable by building occupants. k.10.1.8 mechanical ventilation k.10.1.8.1 general ventilation system design and selection shall be determined by mechanical engineer for given application, taking into account all relevant issues associated with building design, usage, configuration and commissioning, operation and maintenance of system. mechanical ventilation system shall consist of one or more supply or exhaust fans and associated ducts and controls. outdoor air ducts connected to return side of fan coil unit or air handler plenum box shall be permitted as supply ventilation, provided that manufacturer requirements for return air temperature met and ventilation load at peak condition accounted for when sizing fan coil unit or air handler, in order to control temperature and remove excess humidity

mechanical exhaust system, supply system or combination thereof shall be installed to operate for each villa or townhouse unit to provide ventilation with outdoor air in accordance with ashrae 62.2- 2019
local exhaust systems shall be provided in kitchens, bathrooms and toilet rooms and shall have capacity to exhaust minimum airflow rate determined in accordance with ashrae 62.2- 2019
k 149 dubai building code part k villas mechanical ventilation installations shall conform to requirements of ashrae fundamentals handbook chapter 16 ref. k.33 and ashrae 62.2- 2019

k.10.1.8.2 ducts and duct connectors duct sizing shall be based on recommended velocity and pressure drop ranges given in ch. 21 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. all metallic duct systems shall be constructed in accordance with smacna hvac duct construction standards  metal and flexible ref. k.35

k.10.1.8.2 ducts and duct connectors duct sizing shall be based on recommended velocity and pressure drop ranges given in ch. 21 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. all metallic duct systems shall be constructed in accordance with smacna hvac duct construction standards  metal and flexible ref. k.35

k.10.1.8.2 ducts and duct connectors duct sizing shall be based on recommended velocity and pressure drop ranges given in ch. 21 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. all metallic duct systems shall be constructed in accordance with smacna hvac duct construction standards  metal and flexible ref. k.35

ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. k.1 requires flexible air ducts to be tested and classified in accordance with ansi/ul 181, and only used when air temperature in ducts does not exceed 250 c or as vertical ducts serving not more than two adjacent stories in height. in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. k.1, pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings, vapour retarder facings, adhesives, fasteners, tapes and supplementary materials added to air ducts, plenums, panels, and duct silencers used in duct systems, shall have, in form in which they used, maximum flame spread index of 25 without evidence of continued progressive combustion and maximum smoke developed index of 50 when tested in accordance with astm e84 or ul 723. when fire testing pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings and their adhesives, and tapes, specimen preparation and mounting procedures of astm e2231 shall be followed

ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. k.1 requires flexible air ducts to be tested and classified in accordance with ansi/ul 181, and only used when air temperature in ducts does not exceed 250 c or as vertical ducts serving not more than two adjacent stories in height. in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. k.1, pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings, vapour retarder facings, adhesives, fasteners, tapes and supplementary materials added to air ducts, plenums, panels, and duct silencers used in duct systems, shall have, in form in which they used, maximum flame spread index of 25 without evidence of continued progressive combustion and maximum smoke developed index of 50 when tested in accordance with astm e84 or ul 723. when fire testing pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings and their adhesives, and tapes, specimen preparation and mounting procedures of astm e2231 shall be followed

ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. k.1 requires flexible air ducts to be tested and classified in accordance with ansi/ul 181, and only used when air temperature in ducts does not exceed 250 c or as vertical ducts serving not more than two adjacent stories in height. in accordance with ch. 10 of uae flsc ref. k.1, pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings, vapour retarder facings, adhesives, fasteners, tapes and supplementary materials added to air ducts, plenums, panels, and duct silencers used in duct systems, shall have, in form in which they used, maximum flame spread index of 25 without evidence of continued progressive combustion and maximum smoke developed index of 50 when tested in accordance with astm e84 or ul 723. when fire testing pipe and duct insulation and coverings, duct linings and their adhesives, and tapes, specimen preparation and mounting procedures of astm e2231 shall be followed

k.10.1.8.3 air filters hvac systems shall be provided with approved air filters to minimum recommended filter efficiency reporting value in accordance with ashrae hvac systems and equipment handbook ref. k.36. filters shall also be installed in return air system, upstream from any heat exchanger or cooling coil

media-type air filters shall conform to ul 900. high efficiency particulate air filters shall conform to ul 586. electrostatic-type air filters shall conform to ul 867. air filters utilized within dwelling units shall be designed for intended application and not required to be approved
ducts shall be constructed to allow even distribution of air over entire filter

ductwork shall be effectively sealed to limit air leakage in system. application of duct sealing and air leakage shall meet requirements of ashrae 111 and smacna hvac duct construction standards, depending on specific application. k.10.1.8.4 domestic kitchen exhaust equipment where domestic range hoods and domestic appliances equipped with downdraft exhaust located within dwelling units, such hoods and appliances shall discharge to exterior through sheet metal ducts constructed of galvanized steel, stainless steel, aluminium or copper. such ducts shall have smooth inner walls and shall be airtight and equipped with backdraft damper. where installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and where mechanical ventilation otherwise provided, ductless range hoods not required to discharge to outdoors. k 150 dubai building code part k villas k.10.1.9 hydronic systems k.10.1.9.1 general this section applies to hydronic piping systems that part of hvac systems. they include steam, hot water, chilled water, steam condensate and ground source heat pump loop systems. design and installation of hydronic systems shall meet requirements of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

ductwork shall be effectively sealed to limit air leakage in system. application of duct sealing and air leakage shall meet requirements of ashrae 111 and smacna hvac duct construction standards, depending on specific application. k.10.1.8.4 domestic kitchen exhaust equipment where domestic range hoods and domestic appliances equipped with downdraft exhaust located within dwelling units, such hoods and appliances shall discharge to exterior through sheet metal ducts constructed of galvanized steel, stainless steel, aluminium or copper. such ducts shall have smooth inner walls and shall be airtight and equipped with backdraft damper. where installed in accordance with manufacturers installation instructions and where mechanical ventilation otherwise provided, ductless range hoods not required to discharge to outdoors. k 150 dubai building code part k villas k.10.1.9 hydronic systems k.10.1.9.1 general this section applies to hydronic piping systems that part of hvac systems. they include steam, hot water, chilled water, steam condensate and ground source heat pump loop systems. design and installation of hydronic systems shall meet requirements of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

k.10.1.9.2 materials pipe material and associated pipeline equipment and fittings shall have appropriate temperature and pressure rating for system in which it operating. they shall be suitable for fluid or gas conveyed. hydronic pipe material shall conform to relevant astm standards and ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

k.10.1.9.3 pipe joints and connections pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. k.10.1.9.4 valves shutoff valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

k.10.1.9.3 pipe joints and connections pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. k.10.1.9.4 valves shutoff valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

k.10.1.9.3 pipe joints and connections pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. k.10.1.9.4 valves shutoff valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

k.10.1.9.3 pipe joints and connections pipe joints and connections shall be suitable for pressure of hydronic system. k.10.1.9.4 valves shutoff valves shall be installed in hydronic piping systems in order to enable isolation of all piping equipment. note further details given in ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33

k.10.1.9.5 pipe installation piping, valves, fittings and connections shall be installed in accordance with conditions of approval. hydronic piping systems shall be designed and installed to permit system to be drained. openings for pipe penetrations in walls, floors or ceilings shall be larger than penetrating pipe. openings through concrete or masonry building elements shall be sleeved. annular space surrounding pipe penetrations within fire-rated walls or floors shall be protected in accordance with section 3, ch. 1 of uae fl.sc ref. k.1. hydronic piping system shall not be in direct contact with building materials that cause piping material to degrade or corrode, or that interfere with operation of system. piping shall be installed to prevent detrimental strains and stresses in pipe. provisions shall be made to protect piping from damage resulting from expansion, contraction and structural settlement. piping shall be installed to avoid structural stresses or strains within building components. pipe shall be supported in accordance with ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. flash point of transfer fluid in hydronic piping system shall be not less than 28 c above maximum system operating temperature. transfer fluid shall be compatible with make-up water supplied to system

k.10.1.9.5 pipe installation piping, valves, fittings and connections shall be installed in accordance with conditions of approval. hydronic piping systems shall be designed and installed to permit system to be drained. openings for pipe penetrations in walls, floors or ceilings shall be larger than penetrating pipe. openings through concrete or masonry building elements shall be sleeved. annular space surrounding pipe penetrations within fire-rated walls or floors shall be protected in accordance with section 3, ch. 1 of uae fl.sc ref. k.1. hydronic piping system shall not be in direct contact with building materials that cause piping material to degrade or corrode, or that interfere with operation of system. piping shall be installed to prevent detrimental strains and stresses in pipe. provisions shall be made to protect piping from damage resulting from expansion, contraction and structural settlement. piping shall be installed to avoid structural stresses or strains within building components. pipe shall be supported in accordance with ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. flash point of transfer fluid in hydronic piping system shall be not less than 28 c above maximum system operating temperature. transfer fluid shall be compatible with make-up water supplied to system

k.10.1.9.5 pipe installation piping, valves, fittings and connections shall be installed in accordance with conditions of approval. hydronic piping systems shall be designed and installed to permit system to be drained. openings for pipe penetrations in walls, floors or ceilings shall be larger than penetrating pipe. openings through concrete or masonry building elements shall be sleeved. annular space surrounding pipe penetrations within fire-rated walls or floors shall be protected in accordance with section 3, ch. 1 of uae fl.sc ref. k.1. hydronic piping system shall not be in direct contact with building materials that cause piping material to degrade or corrode, or that interfere with operation of system. piping shall be installed to prevent detrimental strains and stresses in pipe. provisions shall be made to protect piping from damage resulting from expansion, contraction and structural settlement. piping shall be installed to avoid structural stresses or strains within building components. pipe shall be supported in accordance with ch. 22 of ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. flash point of transfer fluid in hydronic piping system shall be not less than 28 c above maximum system operating temperature. transfer fluid shall be compatible with make-up water supplied to system

k.10.1.9.6 pipe design hydronic piping design and sizing shall follow guidelines within ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33. for heating and chilled water services following design criteria shall be applied. a) pressure drop shall not exceed 250 pa/m for all pipe sizes. b) maximum pipe velocity shall not exceed 1.2 m/s for pipe size 50 mm and smaller, and 2.5 m/s for pipe size 65 mm and larger. c) minimum pipe velocity shall be not less than 0.45 m/s. above criteria shall be reviewed against ashrae fundamentals handbook ref. k.33 based on particular installation and anticipated operating hours. k 151 dubai building code part k villas piping to be embedded in concrete shall be pressure tested prior to pouring concrete. during pouring, pipe shall be maintained at proposed operating pressure. joints of pipe or tubing that embedded in portion of building, such as concrete or plaster, shall meet following requirements

1) steel pipe shall be welded by electrical arc or oxygen/acetylene method. 2) copper tubing shall be joined by brazing with filler metals having melting point of not less than 538 c. 3) polybutylene pipe and tubing shall be installed in continuous lengths or shall be joined by heat fusion

k.10.1.9.7 testing hydronic piping systems other than ground source heat pump loop systems shall be tested hydrostatically at 1.5 times maximum system design pressure, but not less than 689 kpa (100 psi). duration of each test shall be not less than 15 min. ground source heat pump loop systems shall be tested before connection (header) trenches backfilled. assembled loop system shall be pressure tested with water at 689 kpa (100 psi) for 30 min with no observed leaks. flow and pressure loss testing shall be performed and actual flow rates and pressure drops shall be compared to calculated design values. if actual flowrate or pressure drop values differ from calculated design values by more than 10%, problem shall be identified and corrected. k.10.1.9.8 flushing, cleaning and water treatment before system operated, all water piping shall be flushed, chemically cleaned and treated following guidelines in ashrae hvac applications handbook ref. k.32

k.10.1.9.9 refrigeration k.10.1.9.9.1 general design, construction and installation of refrigeration systems shall meet requirements of ashrae refrigeration handbook ref. k.37 and ashrae 15, including a) system requirements b) refrigerant types and classifications c) system application requirements d) machinery room requirements e) refrigerant piping installation and materials and f) testing

k.10.1.9.9.2 refrigerant and ozone depletion management refrigerants with zero odp or with global warming potential less than 100 shall be used, unless equipment contains less than 0.23 kg of refrigerant. k.10.1.10 hvac systems controls k.10.1.10.1 use of programmable controllers for hvac system all air-conditioning or comfort cooling systems shall be fitted with programmable controller and temperature sensors which, at basic level, provides on/off controls (timer controls) and temperature control functionality
control shall be simple and capable of operating independently without need for any advanced integrations

room temperature sensors shall be installed on interior wall, away from heating or cooling vents and other sources of heat or draughts (doorways, windows, skylights, direct sunlight or bright lamps) which can potentially influence their function

k 152 dubai building code part k villas k.10.1.10.2 interlock of toilet/bathroom fans to prevent operation of extract fans of bathrooms/toilets when rooms not occupied, bathroom extract fans shall be controlled through lighting switch/ timers/sensors or synchronizing light sensors as relevant for project

k.10.1.10.3 occupancy/motion sensors for internal lighting devices as minimum, occupancy sensors for control of lighting devices shall be provided in following areas a) corridor/hallway b) bathroom/toilets
override auto-setting shall be provided as part of system

k.10.2 water supplies k.10.2.1 general this subsection sets out minimum requirements and basis of design for water systems that serve low-rise residential dwelling. it also includes minimum sustainability criteria

where systems or applications not covered within this section, reference shall be made to current edition of a) bs en 806 b) bs en 8558 c) hse approved code of practice l8 ref. k.39 and associated technical guidance documents ref. k.40 and ref. k.41 and d) water supply regulations (water fittings) ref. k.42

k.10.2.2 water conservation and reuse k.10.2.2.1 compliance method there two compliance routes for water use. a) elemental method all buildings shall conform to k.10.2.2.2. b) performance method alternatively, calculation method may be employed for villa or townhouse which might not comply with elemental requirements for water efficient fixtures detailed in k.10.2.2.2. performance method shall use supporting calculations to compare annual water consumption of proposed building with that of reference building which meets elemental requirements of k.10.2.2.2. reference building shall be equal in shape, size and operational patterns to proposed villa. compliance demonstrated if calculated annual water consumption of proposed building equal to or lower than annual water consumption of reference building. k.10.2.2.2 water efficient fittings following water efficient fittings shall be used a) fixtures with flow rate less than or equal to flow rates shown in table k.58 b) dual flush toilets. faucets installed for specialized application may be exempt from meeting flow rates, subject to authority approval

k.10.2.2 water conservation and reuse k.10.2.2.1 compliance method there two compliance routes for water use. a) elemental method all buildings shall conform to k.10.2.2.2. b) performance method alternatively, calculation method may be employed for villa or townhouse which might not comply with elemental requirements for water efficient fixtures detailed in k.10.2.2.2. performance method shall use supporting calculations to compare annual water consumption of proposed building with that of reference building which meets elemental requirements of k.10.2.2.2. reference building shall be equal in shape, size and operational patterns to proposed villa. compliance demonstrated if calculated annual water consumption of proposed building equal to or lower than annual water consumption of reference building. k.10.2.2.2 water efficient fittings following water efficient fittings shall be used a) fixtures with flow rate less than or equal to flow rates shown in table k.58 b) dual flush toilets. faucets installed for specialized application may be exempt from meeting flow rates, subject to authority approval

k 153 dubai building code part k villas all parts of cold water system, including storage tanks and pipework, shall be designed to avoid water stagnation and ensure flow through all parts of system. dead legs in cold water systems shall be avoided
cold water distribution system shall be designed to relevant parts of water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. k.42, bs en 806 and bs en 8558
water meter and isolation valve locations shall conform to dewa regulations ref. k.38

k.10.2.3.2 swimming pools cold water supply that serves pool water treatment system shall be fed from dedicated cold water break tank to completely isolate chemical treatment plant from buildings cold water supply. booster pump-set shall be connected to break tank to provide pressurized supply of cold water to water treatment equipment

cold water break tank and booster pump-set shall be located in pool filtration plantroom. pool filtration system shall be designed by pool filtration specialist. note objective of pool water treatment system to provide hygienic, safe, comfortable and pleasant environment for bathers

tank pump-set installation k.10.2.4 pump-set shall be installed adjacent to tank within internal room of sufficient size for operation, maintenance and repair of various pumps that connect to tank. each pump-set shall be installed on reinforced concrete base

fixture type showerheads hand washbasins kitchen sinks dual flush toilets maximum flow rate 8 l/min 6 l/min 7 l/min 6 l full flush 3 l part flush table k.58 maximum flow rates cold water services k.10.2.3 k.10.2.3.1 general cold water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings a) water closet flushing b) washbasins c) sinks d) showers e) baths f) bidets and g) bib tap points

fixture type showerheads hand washbasins kitchen sinks dual flush toilets maximum flow rate 8 l/min 6 l/min 7 l/min 6 l full flush 3 l part flush table k.58 maximum flow rates cold water services k.10.2.3 k.10.2.3.1 general cold water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings a) water closet flushing b) washbasins c) sinks d) showers e) baths f) bidets and g) bib tap points
booster pump-set shall connect to water storage tank. booster set shall provide pressurized supply of cold water to all cold water outlets and hot water plant

booster pump-set should incorporate minimum of two variable speed pumps to ensure system resilience. booster pump-set shall have accumulator vessel and incorporate automatic controls to ensure even pump wear and prevent system stagnation

k 154 dubai building code part k villas cold water storage tanks k.10.2.5 cold water storage shall be provided to protect building against interruptions to incoming mains supplies and to ensure that water supply pressures can be safely maintained

capacity of domestic water supply tanks shall be calculated based on actual demand of building as stipulated by dewa. as minimum, water tanks shall be sized based on 24 h demand from all water connections. villas or townhouses typically require 250 l to 350 l per day
cold water storage may be provided utilizing single tank, single tank with central division or two separate cold water storage tanks

if continuous supply of cold water required during periods of tank cleaning or maintenance, tank with central division or two separate storage tanks shall be provided. for both of these tank arrangements, each tank shall store two equal volumes (50/50 configuration) of water. in each water tank (or water tank section when divided tanks used), following components shall be provided a) isolation valve at inlet and outlet of tank division b) valve strainer at outlet of each tank division 03 04 02 01 05 06 07 08 08 01 c) drain connection at bottom of each tank. invert of drain shall be figure k.94 typical water tank fitting connection detail located to fully drain that division of tank d) overflow pipe from each division of tank e) overflow warning pipe with insect protection screen (0.65 mm mesh  design needs to ensure that screen area will pass same amount of water as overflow or warning pipe) f) external and internal access ladder (if required) g) vent pipe with air inlet corrosion resistant mesh

key 01 servicing valve 02 fixed access cover 03 screened air inlet corrosion resistant mesh (0.65 mm max. opening) 04 sleeve for vent pipe 05 straight or dipped entry to warning pipe 06 screen (0.65 mm max. opening) to prevent ingress of insects etc

07 warning/overflow pipe 08 insulation (applicable to grp pre-insulated panel sectional tanks and steel tanks) k 155 dubai building code part k villas all tank interconnecting pipework and valves shall be configured to ensure balanced throughput of water through each tank mitigating risk of deadlegs and associated water stagnation. above ground cold water storage tanks should be constructed of pre-insulated glass- reinforced plastic (grp). backflow protection k.10.2.8 water systems shall be designed and installed to reduce risk of contaminating cold water supplies. in particular, requirements of water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. k.42 and classification of fluid category backflow protection shall be followed

tanks shall be installed in conditioned space that free from contamination and shall not be positioned in location where they exposed to external dubai climate

combined firefighting and water storage k.10.2.6 where water tanks also used for firefighting purposes, water storage capacity shall be increased to include firefighting water storage capacity. tank and pump connection arrangements shall conform to ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. k.1. this water storage arrangement not preferred unless system can be designed to ensure regular turnover of cold water storage volume in tank. where this arrangement adopted, fire pump test line shall not discharge back into tank. servicing and isolation valves k.10.2.7 water servicing distribution pipework shall incorporate service valves on all items of plant and sources of supply to allow for isolation to facilitate maintenance. as minimum, branch isolation valves shall be provided on branches and risers at connection to main distribution system

combined firefighting and water storage k.10.2.6 where water tanks also used for firefighting purposes, water storage capacity shall be increased to include firefighting water storage capacity. tank and pump connection arrangements shall conform to ch. 9 of uae flsc ref. k.1. this water storage arrangement not preferred unless system can be designed to ensure regular turnover of cold water storage volume in tank. where this arrangement adopted, fire pump test line shall not discharge back into tank. servicing and isolation valves k.10.2.7 water servicing distribution pipework shall incorporate service valves on all items of plant and sources of supply to allow for isolation to facilitate maintenance. as minimum, branch isolation valves shall be provided on branches and risers at connection to main distribution system
all water servicing valves shall be positioned in accessible location that permits maintenance and replacement without damage to wall, ceiling or floor finishes

where required to prevent cross contamination, water services system shall be protected by use of break tanks or air gaps, meeting correct fluid category classification, as integral part of plant and equipment served from water services system. this protection shall be provided in all areas of building
k.10.2.9 hot water services hot water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings a) wash basins b) sinks c) showers and d) baths
k.10.2.9 hot water services hot water shall be supplied to following sanitary fittings a) wash basins b) sinks c) showers and d) baths

pumped hot water return shall be provided, unless electrical trace heating tape used. hot water return shall be designed to maintain distribution temperatures between 50 c to 55 c. hot water return system shall include thermal balancing valves for all hot water sub-circuits. all parts of hot water system, including storage tanks, water heaters and pipework, shall be designed to avoid water stagnation and ensure flow through all parts of system. dead legs in hot water systems shall be avoided
hot water distribution system shall be designed to relevant parts of water supply (water fittings) regulations ref. k.42, bs en 806 and bs en 8558
k 156 dubai building code part k villas thermostatic mixing valves shall be installed on all hot water outlets that used for handwashing or bathing, including those in table k.59

sanitary fitting shower and hair washing wash basin baths maximum recommended temperature (c) 01 41 38 to 41 44 table k.59 sanitary fitting hot water outlet temperatures thermostatic mixing valves shall meet requirements of hse approved code of practice l8 ref. k.39

k.10.2.10 use of renewable sources of energy for domestic heating renewable energy shall be utilized to reduce dependence on grid power for domestic hot water heating purposes. solar water heating (solar thermal) or heat pump technology shall be employed for domestic hot water requirements. solar hot water heating system shall incorporate measures for efficient distribution systems, pipe insulation and use of energy efficient electric hot water system (which normally used as backup)

k 157 figure k.95 solar hot water detail key 01 solar collector 02 solar pump station 03 hot water storage tank 04 back-up heat source 05 domestic hot water distribution system 06 solar controller 07 expansion vessel 08 incoming cold-water feed 05 04 02 06 03 08 dubai building code part k villas k.10.2.11 water services installation requirements water services distribution pipework shall be sized to meet system demands based upon number of fittings and equipment connected to it
pipe velocities shall be restricted to approximately 1.5 m/s to maintain system longevity, minimize noise generation and limit pressure waves
interior hot and cold water pipework shall be insulated in accordance with bs 5422
pressure reducing valves shall be installed to ensure safe water discharge pressures do not exceed 2 bar at all sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances
pressure reducing valves shall be installed to ensure safe water discharge pressures do not exceed 2 bar at all sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances
cold water supply to all water closet ablution hoses shall incorporate vacuum breaker

k.10.2.12 water treatment against microbiological bacteria growth all water features that have water storage volume of over 1,000 l and that create water spray or aerosol shall be designed, installed, operated and maintained to minimize risk of legionella bacteria or microbiological bacteria growth in accordance with a) latest dm guidelines, if any b) guidelines for control of legionella in water systems ref. k.43 c) private swimming pools safety guidelines ref. k.5 and d) hse approved code of practice l8 ref. k.39 and associated technical guidance documents ref. k.40 and ref. k.41 this includes, but not limited to, hot and cold water systems, evaporative air coolers/condensers, spas, fountains and misters. designer shall formulate strategy to maintain water quality and minimize risk of legionella bacteria for each manufactured water system from point of supply to point of use. suitability of materials used in construction of manufactured water system shall not adversely affect water quality. k 158 k.10.3 drainage k.10.3.1 general this subsection sets out minimum requirements and basis of design for drainage systems that serve low-rise residential dwellings

this subsection sets out minimum requirements and basis of design for above and below ground drainage systems within building and up to 1.5 beyond building site boundary. for systems or applications not covered within this section, requirements in bs en 12056 and bs en 752 shall be met

this subsection sets out minimum requirements and basis of design for above and below ground drainage systems within building and up to 1.5 beyond building site boundary. for systems or applications not covered within this section, requirements in bs en 12056 and bs en 752 shall be met

sanitary plumbing systems k.10.3.2 k.10.3.2.1 general sanitary plumbing system shall be provided to all domestic sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances. sanitary plumbing system shall a) convey and collect drainage flows to sewer infrastructure, cesspools, septic tanks or holding tanks b) minimize risk of blockage or leakage c) prevent foul air from drainage system entering building during normal system usage and d) provide access provisions to clean and maintain system

sanitary plumbing systems k.10.3.2 k.10.3.2.1 general sanitary plumbing system shall be provided to all domestic sanitary fittings and kitchen appliances. sanitary plumbing system shall a) convey and collect drainage flows to sewer infrastructure, cesspools, septic tanks or holding tanks b) minimize risk of blockage or leakage c) prevent foul air from drainage system entering building during normal system usage and d) provide access provisions to clean and maintain system

surface of sanitary fittings (such as toilets and wash basins) shall be of material that easy to clean and maintain. all sanitary fittings shall be provided with water trap. if water trap forms part of sanitary appliance, fitting shall be removable. all other water traps shall be fitted directly after sanitary appliance and shall be removable or be fitted with rodding eye. all sanitary fitting tap flow rates, and water closet cistern flush volumes, shall conform to table k.58

dubai building code part k villas k.10.3.2.2 sanitation system disposal sanitation system shall be designed to collect and convey soil and waste flows by gravity to public drainage network. sanitation systems shall be designed in accordance with bs en 12056

sanitation pipework and ventilation pipework shall be configured to control pressure fluctuations that can occur in system. sanitary fitting water traps shall be maintained during normal system working conditions. primary ventilated and secondary ventilated discharge stack arrangements may be utilized for this purpose. discharge stack arrangement selected shall be determined according to building height, grouping of sanitary fittings within building, and any other relevant factors

sanitation pipework and ventilation pipework shall be configured to control pressure fluctuations that can occur in system. sanitary fitting water traps shall be maintained during normal system working conditions. primary ventilated and secondary ventilated discharge stack arrangements may be utilized for this purpose. discharge stack arrangement selected shall be determined according to building height, grouping of sanitary fittings within building, and any other relevant factors

figure k.96 greywater sanitary plumbing connection detail routing of drainage pipework through sensitive areas of building should be avoided. sensitive areas include majlis, dining rooms, bedrooms, any area of architectural significance, and areas where access to drainage pipework restricted

sanitation system shall be designed and routed through building with attention to acoustic requirements of space that it passes through. acoustic insulation shall be provided where required

all floor drain body and grating materials shall be specified to suit floor finishes within which they installed and imposed traffic loads to which they expected to be subject. waterproof seal shall be achieved between floor finish and edge of floor grating to prevent migration of water at this junction

figure k.97 floor drain connection detail to discharge stack in order to prevent trap seal evaporation, all floor drains shall be configured to receive wastewater flows from sanitary fitting or condensate connection from air- conditioning unit. where this not practicable, automatic drain trap primer shall be installed. floor gulley with back inlet connection shall be utilized to receive waste pipe connections from these fittings. all floor drains shall have minimum 75 mm deep water seal. waste pipe connection from bidets shall connect directly to discharge stack, not floor drain (see figure k.98)

access junctions shall be installed in discharge stacks at every storey level to provide access to clear blockages. k.10.3.2.6 sanitation piping all internal pipework shall be manufactured from pvc-u in accordance with bs en 1329-1. waste pipework shall conform to bs 5255 and bs en 1329-1

only long radius fittings shall be permitted in wet portion of any discharge stack. thermoplastic drainage pipework shall not run through electrical rooms, kitchens, kitchen food stores and bedrooms. drainpipes shall not be cast into building structural element without prior approval from structural engineer at authority

where drainage pipework required to pass through structural element in building, cast iron sleeve shall first be fitted within structural element to allow drain to pass through. sleeve shall offer tolerance of at least 50 mm to simplify installation of pipe. gap between pipe and sleeve shall then be filled with suitable sealant. size of sanitary fitting outlet connections installed within sanitation system shall be not less than minimum shown in table k.60. k 161 dubai building code part k villas drainage discharge stack sizes shall be in accordance with table k.61 for low-rise- residential dwellings

sanitary fitting water closet wash basin kitchen sink floor drain bath tub/shower washing machine balcony drain table k.60 sanitary fitting outlet sizes pipework system soil vent pipe waste vent pipe rainwater pipe vent pipe balcony drain ac drain pipe minimum outlet size (mm) 100 32 40 75 40 40 50 minimum pipe size (mm) 100 100 100 75 50 32 table k.61 minimum drainage pipework sizes for low-rise residential dwellings below-ground drainage systems shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752 to receive soil and waste flows from above-ground sanitation system. foul water flows shall be collected and conveyed to external drainage network by gravity flow

buried drainage pipework, fittings and ring seal joints shall be specified to suit ground conditions they installed within and nature of discharge they receive. drainpipe sizes and gradients shall be selected on calculated flows that pass through drainage system. in all instances, self-cleansing velocity shall be achieved through each drain section

drainage pipe connections shall be airtight and free from any internal obstructions. pipe bedding and surrounding materials shall be selected to suit prevailing geotechnical ground conditions. all drainpipe bedding and backfilling materials shall be installed in accordance with specified pipework manufacturers requirements. if underground drainpipe line installed less than 600 mm below ffl, it shall be provided with 150 mm thick concrete encasement. underground drainage pipework and fittings shall conform to requirements bs en 13476

k 162 dubai building code part k villas access shall be provided at following points in drainage system a) at or near end of drainage run b) at bend or change in system direction or drain gradient c) at junction of drain connection (unless each junction connection can be cleared from another access point) d) at all changes in system pipe size
distances between means of access shall not exceed values in table k.62

drainage pipes which extend underneath flooring and inside walls shall be protected from any external works or against potential settlement of floors. such installations shall be provided with access provisions at distances that do not exceed parameters identified in table k.62

k 163 dubai building code part k villas k.10.3.3.3 sump pits all basement levels shall be provided with appropriate means and equipment to drain and filter water (such as sand separation rooms and mechanical plantrooms). sump pump pits (see figure k.101) shall have depth of not less than 1 from level of lowest inlet pipe. all sump pump pits shall be positioned in accessible location for ease of cleaning and maintenance. all sump pits shall incorporate two submersible pumps operating in duty/standby configuration. each submersible pump shall be wired to dedicated control panel which incorporates volt-free contacts

open grated sump pits do not require vent pipe. 01 02 k.10.3.3.4 manholes all manholes shall be installed within boundaries of building plot. during design, care shall be taken to select appropriate location of last manhole (i.e. one before public network) in terms of ease of connection to public drainage network and fulfilling conditions of authority

open grated sump pits do not require vent pipe. 01 02 k.10.3.3.4 manholes all manholes shall be installed within boundaries of building plot. during design, care shall be taken to select appropriate location of last manhole (i.e. one before public network) in terms of ease of connection to public drainage network and fulfilling conditions of authority

manhole schedule shall be arranged as shown in figure k.102. manhole invert level, cover level depth and distance between manholes shall be determined by authority public drainage connection level and final inspection chamber (fic). all datum units shall be produced in international system of units (si units)

key 01 guide rail 02 pump 03 auto coupling 03 figure k.101 typical sump pump detail ( cibse. figure based on figure 6.13 from cibse, 2014. guide g  public health and plumbing engineering guide. london cibse)

k 164 dubai building code part k villas depth (m) cover type remark if inspection chambers or manholes installed in agricultural land, manhole cover shall be raised 75 mm above natural ground level. cover level invert level distance to next chamber (m) manhole no

figure k.102 sample manhole schedule invert level of external drainage system shall be determined by consultant. drainage connection level shall match that of fic. depth of this last manhole shall be obtained from or approved by authority

acute angle branch connections shall not be made within manholes. pipework connections into manhole shall be installed where top of each incoming drain connect at same level. note 1 this connection arrangement means that smaller diameter connecting pipes not flooded when there flow through bigger pipes

acute angle branch connections shall not be made within manholes. pipework connections into manhole shall be installed where top of each incoming drain connect at same level. note 1 this connection arrangement means that smaller diameter connecting pipes not flooded when there flow through bigger pipes

all inspection chambers, manholes, gully traps constructed in covered building areas shall be dry type (not open channel) and provided with recessed double seal type cover. manhole access cover specification shall be suitable for wheel loads they subjected to and their surrounding floor or road finishes in accordance with bs en 124-1. note 2 manholes located in garages, driveways or other areas of vehicle movement likely to require heavy-duty covers

all inspection chambers, manholes, gully traps constructed in covered building areas shall be dry type (not open channel) and provided with recessed double seal type cover. manhole access cover specification shall be suitable for wheel loads they subjected to and their surrounding floor or road finishes in accordance with bs en 124-1. note 2 manholes located in garages, driveways or other areas of vehicle movement likely to require heavy-duty covers
k 165 manhole venting shall be provided by vent pipe serving first and last manholes of any drainage line. vent pipes shall be located at least 100 mm below cover level

manholes shall be sited away from underground water tanks, at distance not less than depth of water tank. manholes shall not be installed inside villas, except in chutes, corridors, service rooms, car sheds and ventilated corridors. such manholes shall be dry type (not open channel)

k.10.3.3.5 manhole construction where manhole or inspection chamber constructed below groundwater table level, complete manhole construction shall be either waterproofed reinforced concrete or grp. all main line channels shall be in centre of manhole. sides of manhole channels shall be extended vertically to same level of soffit of pipe. benching of incoming branch drains shall be inclined towards main direction of flow. diameter of semi-circular channel in bottom of manhole shall be equal to that of outgoing drain diameter. benching of inspection chamber/manholes shall have smooth curved surface using granolithic concrete that does not restrict drainage flows

k.10.3.3.5 manhole construction where manhole or inspection chamber constructed below groundwater table level, complete manhole construction shall be either waterproofed reinforced concrete or grp. all main line channels shall be in centre of manhole. sides of manhole channels shall be extended vertically to same level of soffit of pipe. benching of incoming branch drains shall be inclined towards main direction of flow. diameter of semi-circular channel in bottom of manhole shall be equal to that of outgoing drain diameter. benching of inspection chamber/manholes shall have smooth curved surface using granolithic concrete that does not restrict drainage flows
manhole chamber and access cover sizes shall be not less than minimum values given in table k.63

headings: final inspection chamber and provision for future connection

rainwater disposal k.10.3.4 k.10.3.4.1 general rainwater disposal system shall be provided to remove rainwater from all building roof areas. system shall be designed in accordance with bs en 12056, and configured to reduce impact of sand and dust ingress. rainfall intensity design criteria shall be taken from intensity duration-frequency curves developed for dubai urban areas as shown in table k.64

dubai building code part k villas rainwater disposal gutters, channels and rainwater pipes shall be a) installed with gradient not greater than 1/50 and not less than 1/70 b) made of robust material, complete with waterproof joints and c) installed in safe and reliable manner that equipped with suitable means of gutter and pipe protection (where required). rainwater shall be drained directly on to surface of road or passage. it shall not be drained into drainage pipes of septic tanks or cesspits, or into adjacent neighbours premises
k.10.3.4.2 drainage of hardstanding or paved areas hardstanding paved areas shall be designed in accordance with bs en 752. they shall be drained using floor gullies and linear drainage channels
drainage of paved and hardstanding areas shall be configured to intercept sand and dust that would otherwise be washed into drainage system during periods of rainfall

k.10.3.4.3 miscellaneous rainwater drainage rainwater pipes shall not be connected to sewer lines. they shall be terminated above ground, to allow free discharge onto external ground surface. exposed roof areas or canopies shall be configured with maximum gradient of 1/50 and not less than 1/70 in order to direct rainwater to suitable channels, gutters or outlets

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other open to sky areas shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other open to sky areas shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system

all internal roof or paved areas that open to sky (that have catchment area of 16 m2 or less) shall be provided with floor drains to enable rainwater pipework to connect to nearest gully or waste discharge stack. all other open to sky areas shall be provided with rainwater drain that provides free discharge to external area. for all air ventilation shafts, access doors shall be provided at lower level of well to facilitate cleaning and maintenance of rainwater drainage system

swimming pools k.10.3.5 backwash drainage flows from pool filtration system shall discharge unattenuated into public drainage system where this approved by authority. if approval for unattenuated discharge cannot be obtained, backwash water shall discharge into attenuation tank to enable reduced drainage flow rate to public drainage system

headings: septic tanks and sewage holding tanks
Description: septic tanks and sewage holding tanks k.10.3.6 where there no public drainage network available, building shall be provided with sewage holding tank and septic tank. septic tank and sewage holding tanks shall meet following requirements

c) swimming pool water shall not be drained into septic tank. d) tanks shall be constructed of reinforced concrete, grp or brickwork. all tanks shall be installed in accordance with tank manufacturers requirements, and to withstand any potential vehicle loading. k 167 dubai building code part k villas e) where tank to be founded at lower level than that of adjacent footing, 01 tank shall be constructed before footing

1 f) tanks shall have openings of adequate size, with heavy-duty lockable access cover of suitable dimensions to enable cleaning and maintenance. g) roof level of tank shall not terminate above adjacent ground level in which it situated

h) tanks shall have adequate capacity, calculated on basis of daily personal consumptions given in standard tables produced by authority. tanks shall be emptied without impeding operation of building. i) provided that suitable insulation provided to prevent leakage through walls, non-penetrating reinforced concrete tanks shall be situated at distance not less than 1 from nearby buildings and boundary walls, and brick tanks at distance not less than 3 m. reinforced concrete tanks shall be at minimum depth of 1.5 from invert of pipe connected to tank inlet, and shall have spacing of at least 3 from nearest water tank. note location constraints illustrated in figure k.103

j) tanks shall not be located within 5.5 set back vehicular access area unless this unavoidable. if tank has to be located within this area, road and tank construction shall be sufficiently robust for road use by fire tenders and heavy goods vehicles. k) tanks shall be provided with ventilation pipe
l) all tank openings shall be covered in such way as to prevent insects from entering
m) in event of wastewater overflowing, holding tank shall have high-level alarm facility that connects to dedicated control panel. control panel shall have visual and audible alarm
n) tank shall be provided with breaching pipe for pumping out operations

k 168 1 02 03 1  key 01 site boundary/boundary wall 02 septic/holding tank 03 no underground water tank shall be located within 1 of tank location 04 building 04 (a) reinforced concrete and concrete encased grp holding tanks 01 3 04 02 03 3 3 key 01 site boundary/boundary wall 02 septic/holding tank 03 no underground water tank shall be located within 3 of tank location 04 building (b) brickwork holding tank figure k.103 septic tank and sewage holding tank location constraints diagram dubai building code part k villas grp sealing plate shall be installed on last manhole before tank and on manhole utilized for future connection before sewer line. tanks shall be designed in accordance with bs 6297. typical sewage holding tank arrangement shown in figure k.104
03 all tank locations shall be subject to approval by authority and should be positioned in location that enables tank to be connected in future to public drainage network

b) foundation level of base of soakaway shall be kept at least 1 above winter water table. c) soakaway shall be located at least 3 away from building footing or boundary wall

k.10.4 lighting k.10.4.1 general suitable low-energy lighting arrangement shall be provided within each villa or townhouse

lighting controls k.10.4.2 lighting controls may consist of toggle switches, dimmer switches or smart control system. lighting controls system shall be selected as part of overall energy efficient solution for internal lighting

lighting controls k.10.4.2 lighting controls may consist of toggle switches, dimmer switches or smart control system. lighting controls system shall be selected as part of overall energy efficient solution for internal lighting

as minimum, occupancy sensors shall be provided to control interior lighting devices as required by k.10.1.10.3. automatic lighting control shall be provided to shut down exterior lighting during daylight hours. occupancy sensors should be provided if exterior lighting only used to illuminate exterior circulation paths
k.10.5 fire safety systems emergency lighting k.10.5.1 standalone, self-contained emergency lighting shall be provided in basements in accordance with table 6.5, ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. k.1
k.10.5 fire safety systems emergency lighting k.10.5.1 standalone, self-contained emergency lighting shall be provided in basements in accordance with table 6.5, ch. 6 of uae flsc ref. k.1

fire detection and alarm k.10.5.2 table 8.13, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. k.1 requires smoke detection and alarm system in all villas/townhouses. system shall be designed in accordance with section 4, ch. 8 of uae flsc ref. k.1

fire alarm control panel or monitoring panel shall be located near front door of villa/townhouse. each villa/townhouse shall be provided with audio visual notification devices outside that visible from common approach road
k 171 dubai building code part k villas k.11 security common areas of villa or townhouse communities shall conform to security requirements of sira in part j. k 172 dubai building code part k villas
